en: The Nigerian government announced Friday it was suspending Twitter in the country, just days after Twitter deleted a harmful tweet by Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari that suggested the state would use violence against the Igbo ethnic group.
swa: Serikali ya Naijeria imetangaza siku ya Ijumaa kwamba inaufungia mtandao wa Twita nchini humo, siku kadhaa baada ya mtandao huo kufuta twiti hatari iliyoandikwa na Rais wa Naijeria Muhammadu Buhari iliyodai kwamba serikali itatumia nguvu dhidi ya kabila la Igbo.
mt0: <pad> The Nigerian government announced on Friday that it will shut down Twitter in the country, days after the network removed a threatening tweet by President Muhammadu Buhari that said the government will use force against the Igbo ethnic group.</s>

en: Despite removing the tweet, the message continues to circulate on social media, bringing up painful memories of a civil war that left more than one million dead.
swa: Pamoja na kuondolewa kwa twiti hiyo, ujumbe uliendea kusambaa kwenye mitandao ya kijamii, hali iliyokumbushia maumivu ya vita vya wenyewe kwa wenyewe vilivyopoteza maisha ya watu zaidi ya milioni moja.
mt0: <pad> Although the tweet was removed, it continued to spread on social media, recalling the pain of civil war that killed over one million people.</s>

en: But the tweet also sparked a movement on social media in support of Nigerians from the Igbo ethnic group.
swa: Lakini twiti hiyo ilichochea harakati kwenye mitandao ya kijamii kusimama na Wanaijeria wa kabila la Igbo.
mt0: <pad> But the tweet sparked a social media movement to stand with Nigerians of the Igbo ethnic group.</s>

en: In a series of tweets posted on June 1, 2021, Buhari threatened to treat Nigerians from the eastern part of the country in the language they understand, in a reference to Nigerias 1967-1970 civil war against the secessionist Republic of Biafra, in southeastern Nigeria.
swa: Kwenye mfululizo wa twiti zilizochapishwa mnamo June 1, 2021, Buhari anatishia kuwashughulikia Wanaijeria wanaotoka kwenye sehemu ya mashariki ya nchi hiyo kwa kutumia lugha wanayoielewa, akirejea vita vya wenyewe kwa wenyewe nchini Naijeria kati ya mwaka 1967-1970 dhidi ya vuguvugu la kujitenga la Jamhuri ya Biafra, kusini mashariki mwa Naijeria.
mt0: <pad> In a series of tweets posted on June 1, 2021, Buhari threatens to deal with Nigerians from the east of the country in their language, referring to the civil war in Nigeria between 1967-1970 against the Biafra separatist movement, southeast of Nigeria.</s>

en: The tweets came after a series of attacks on government and security installations in the region, which have been blamed on an armed group linked to the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), a pro-Biafra secessionist movement.
swa: Twiti hiyo iliandikwa baada ya mfululizo wa mashambulio dhidi ya serikali na vyombo vya usalama kwenye eneo hilo, ambalo linalaumiwa kuwa na kikundi cha kijeshi  kinachohusishwa na Wenyeji wa Biafra (IPOB), vuguvugu la watu wanaotaka sehemu ya Biafra ijitenge.
mt0: <pad> The tweet was written after a series of attacks on the government and security forces in the region, which is allegedly being carried out by a militia group linked to the IPOB, a movement for Biafra's independence.</s>

en: IPOB denied involvement in the attack, says the Voice of America.
swa: Kikundi hicho kimekanusha kuhusika na mashambulizi hayo, kwa mujibu wa Sauti ya Amerika.
mt0: <pad> The group denied the attacks, according to the American Voice.</s>

en: Many of those misbehaving today are too young to be aware of the destruction and loss of lives that occurred during the Nigerian Civil War, Buharis now-deleted tweet said:

mt0: <pad> Many of those who are showing disobedience today were too young to understand the destruction and loss of lives that happened during the Civil War in Nigeria, Buhari tweeted.</s>

mt0: <pad> Tweets responded to the remarks made by Buhari, who was clearly angry while in the country's capital, Abuja, about the direction of attacks on election officials.</s>

en: The brutal civil war led to the death of over one million ethnic Igbos and other Easterners, according to Chima J. Korieh, a professor of African History at United States Marquette University.

mt0: <pad> The violence caused the deaths of over a million Igbo and other East Africans, according to Chima J. Korieh, professor of African history at Marquette University in the United States.</s>

en: For most Nigerians, the war over the breakaway state of Biafra is generally regarded as an unfortunate episode best forgotten, but for the Igbo people who fought for secession, it remains a life-defining event, asserts Nigerian writer Adaobi Tricia Nwaubani.
swa: Kwa Wanaijeria wengi, vita vya kujitenga kwa jimbo la Biafra, kwa ujumla, huchukuliwa kama tukio la baya la kusahauliwa, lakini kwa watu wa Igbo waliopambana kujitenga, linabaki kuwa tukuo lililobadili maana ya maisha yao, anasema mwandishi wa Naijeria Adaobi Tricia Nwaubani.
mt0: <pad> For many Nigerians, the Biafra War is generally seen as a bad event to be ignored, but for the Igbo people who fought for independence, it remains a event that changed the meaning of their lives, says the Nigerian author Adaobi Tricia Nwaubani.</s>

en: Twitter policy on hateful conduct prohibits tweets that promote violence or threaten people based on race, ethnicity, national origin.
swa: Sera ya Twita kuhusu tabia za chuki inazuia twiti ambazo zinahubiri ghasia na kutishia watu kwa kigezo cha rangi, kabila, asili ya utaifa wa mtu.
mt0: <pad> The Twitter policy on hate behavior bans tweets that promote violence and intimidate people on the basis of color, race, origin or nationality.</s>

en: Such tweets, like Buharis, are either deleted by the tech company or the user is compelled to remove the violating content.
swa: Twiti za namna hiyo, kama ya Buhari, hufutwa na kampuni hiyo au watumiaji wenyewe hulazimisha kufuta maudhui yanayokwenda kinyume na sera.
mt0: <pad> Tweets like that one, like Buhari's, are deleted by the company or users themselves forced to remove content that violates its policy.</s>

en: Deleted abusive tweets are still visible

mt0: <pad> threatening tweets are still visible online.</s>

en: An investigation by the social media forensic expert Digital Africa Research Lab (DigiAfricaLab) reveals that Buharis abusive tweet is still visible across numerous timelines two days after it was deleted by Twitter, due to Quote Tweets:
swa: Uchunguzi uliofanywa na mtaalam wa mtandao ya kijamii wa Digital Africa Research Lab (DigiAfricaLab) unaonesha kwamba twiti ya vitisho iliyoandikwa na Buhari bado inaonekana kwenye akaunti kadhaa siku mbili baada ya kuwa imefutwa na Twita, shauri ya kunukuliwa na watumiaji wengine:
mt0: <pad> A study by the Digital Africa Research Lab (DigiAfricaLab) shows that the Buhari's threatening tweet is still visible on several accounts two days after it was deleted by Twitter, due to its retweets by other users.</s>

en: Over 30 hours after Twitter deleted a Tweet by Nigerian president @MBuhari for violating its rules, the deleted Tweet REMAINS VISIBLE across numerous timelines due to Quote Tweets!
swa: Zaidi ya saa 30 baada ya Twita kufuta twiti ya rais wa Naijeria @MBuhari kwa kosa la kuvunja sheria, twitiiliyofutwa BADO INAONEKANA kwenye akaunti nyingi mtandaoni kwa sababu ya kunukuliwa!
mt0: <pad> Over 30 hours after Twitter deleted the tweet of Nigerian President @MBuhari for violating the law, the deleted tweet is still visible on many social media accounts because of retweets.</s>

en: Signing onto different accounts through different devices, DigiAfricaLab was still able to view the more than 17,000 quoted tweets made by users before the social media company pulled down the offensive tweets from the timelines of @MBuhari and @NGRPresident, both verified Twitter handles of President Buhari.
swa: Kwa kuingia mtandao kwa kutumia akaunti tofauti kupitia vifaa tofauti, DigiAfricaLab iliweza kuona zaidi ya twiti 17,000 zilizonukuliwa na watumiaji kabla kampuni hiyo ya mtandao wa kijamii haijaifuta twiti hiyo kutoka kwenye akaunti ya @MBuhari na @NGRPresident, zote zikiwa ni anuani za twita zilizohakikiwa zinazotumika na Rais Buhari.
mt0: <pad> With the use of multiple accounts through different devices, DigiAfricaLab was able to see over 17,000 tweets that were retweeted by users before the social network removed the tweet from the @MBuhari and @NGRPresident accounts, both verified Twitter addresses used by President Buhari.</s>

en: Furthermore, DigiAfricaLab was able to click and expand President Buharis deleted tweet.
swa: Zaidi ya hayo, DigiAfricaLab iliweza kubofya na kukuza twiti ya Rais Buhari iliypfutwa.
mt0: <pad> Moreover, DigiAfricaLab was able to click and retweet the President Buhari's deleted tweet.</s>

en: Deleted tweets may still be visible to Twitter users because Twitter's software, also called, Application Programming Interface (API) relies on third-party applications that connect to Twitter servers via a URL.
swa: Twiti zil nizofutwa zinaweza kuendelea kuonekana kwa watumiaji wa mtandao wa twita kwa sababu zana inayotumiwa na Twita (API) hutegemea zana za mitandao mingine inayounganisha kazi data za Twita kwa kupitia URL.
mt0: <pad> The deleted tweets can still be seen by the Twitter network users because the Twitter application is dependent on other network tools that connect the Twitter data through URL.</s>

en: Another reason, according to J. D. Biersdorfer of New York Times, was that deleted tweets may still be cached away and therefore available to show up in search results  until the site goes indexing again and updates itself with a fresh copy of your Twitter profile and posts.
swa: Sababu nyingine, kwa mujibu wa  J. D. Biersdorfer wa New York Times, ni kwamba twiti zilizofutwa zinaweza kuwa bado zinapatikana na hivyo kuonekana kwenye matokeo ya utafutaji mtandaoni  mpaka tovuti ihuishwe na nakala mpya ya twiti kwenye ukurasa mkuu wa akaunti husika.
mt0: <pad> Another reason, according to J. D. Biersdorfer of the New York Times, is that deleted tweets may still be available and thus appear in search results on the internet until the site is updated with a new copy of the tweet on the main page of the account until the site is refreshed with a new copy of the tweet on the main page of the account.</s>

en: President Buharis abusive tweet generated a backlash from Nigerian Twitter users who trended the #IAmIgboToo hashtag to express their displeasure.
swa: Twiti ya vitisho ya Rais Buhari iliibua mjadala mkali kutoka kwa Wanaijeria wanaotumua mtandao wa Twita, mjadala uliogonga vichwa vya mtandao huo kwa alama habari ya #IAmIgboToo kuonesha masikitiko yao.
mt0: <pad> The tweet of President Buhari's threat sparked a fierce discussion among Nigerian Twitter users, a discussion that hit the internet with the hashtag #IAmIgboToo to show their discontent.</s>

en: In addition, Nigerian Twitter users from different ethnic groups also adopted Igbo names to show their solidarity with the Igbo people.
swa: kadhalika, watumiaji wa mtandao wa Twita nchini Naijeria kutoka kwenye makundi mbalimbali ya kikabila pia walitumia majina ya lugha ya Igbo  kama namna ya kusimama na watu wa kabila la Igbo.
mt0: <pad> Similarly, Twitter users in Nigeria from different ethnic groups also used Igbo names as a way of connecting with the people of the Igbo ethnic group.</s>

en: An analysis conducted on June 4, 2021 by Global Voices on the Brand Mentions app revealed that in the past seven days, the #IAmIgboToo hashtag had 508 mentions, 319,200 interactions, 457,500 reach, and 313,100 shares on both Twitter and Instagram.
swa: Uchambuzi uliofanywa mnamo Juni 4, 2021 na Global Voices kwa kutumia zana ya Brand Mentions  ulionesha kwamba ndani ya siku saba, alama ishara ya #IAmIgboToo ilitajwa mara 508, imetumiwa mara 319,200, imewafikia watu 457,500, na kusambazwa mara 313,100 kwenye mtandao wa Twita na Instagram.
mt0: <pad> A analysis conducted by Global Voices on June 4, 2021 using the Brand Mentions tool showed that in just seven days, the hashtag #IAmIgboToo had been mentioned 508 times, used 319,200 times, reached 457,500 people, and shared 313,100 times on Twitter and Instagram.</s>

en: Blossom Ozurumba, Global Voices Igbo language translator, noted that violence always starts with dehumanization:
swa: Blossom Ozurumba, mtafsiri wa lugha ya Igbo wa Global Voices alibainisha kwamba vitisho huanza na kutweza utu wa mtu:
mt0: <pad> Blossom Ozurumba, a Igbo-language translator for Global Voices, noted that intimidation begins with denigrating the individual's dignity.</s>

en: The use of dehumanization makes it easier to remove the moral concern associated with killing, discriminating, or torturing others based on their group identity.
swa: Ukishatweza utu wa watu inakuwa rahisi kuondoa ule wasiwasi wa kimaadili kuhusu mauaji, ubaguzi au kutesa wengine kwa sababu tu ya utambulisho wa makabila.
mt0: <pad> Once you have devalued human dignity it is easy to remove the moral concern about murder, discrimination or harassment of others for just their race identity.</s>

en: If they arent seen as human, it is easier to justify acts of violence against them.
swa: Kama hawaonekani kuwa binadamu, ni rahisi kuhalalisha matendo ya vurugu dhidi yao.
mt0: <pad> If they don't seem like humans, it's easy to justifie acts of violence against them.</s>

en: Dehumanization, according to Ozurumba, makes it easier to remove the moral concern associated with killing, discriminating, or torturing others based on their group identity.
swa: Kuteza utu, kwa mujibu wa Ozurumba, kunafanya iwe rahisi kuondoa hali ya kuguswa kimaadili na vitendo vya mauaji, ubaguzi, au utesaji wa watu kwa sababu tu ya makabila yao.
mt0: <pad> To preserve the human dignity, according to Ozurumba, makes it easier to remove the morally charged state of killing, discrimination, or torture of people for their race only.</s>

en: On March 27, a heated debate ensued on Kenyan social media about utterances made on-air by three radio hosts during a breakfast show.
swa: Mnamo Machi 27, mjadala mkali uliibuka kwenye mitandao ya kijamii ya Kenya juu ya matamshi yaliyotolewa hewani na watangazaji wa redio tatu wakati wa kipindi cha asubuhi Breakfast Show.
mt0: <pad> On March 27, a fierce debate erupted on social media in Kenya over comments made by three radio presenters during the breakfast show.</s>

en: The hosts were discussing an ongoing court case involving Eunice Wangari, a woman who was pushed off a 12-floor building by a man with whom she was on a date.
swa: Watangazaji walikuwa wakijadili kesi inayoendelea ya kortini inayomshirikisha Eunice Wangari, mwanamke ambaye alisukumwa nje ya jengo la ghorofa 12 na mwanamume ambaye alikuwa na mahusiano naye.
mt0: <pad> The broadcasters were discussing the ongoing court case involving Eunice Wangari, a woman who was pushed out of a 12th floor building by her boyfriend who had a relationship with her.</s>

en: On Twitter, angered Kenyans lashed out at the presenters Shaffie Weru, Joseph Munoru, and Neville Muysa for their remarks on the case of alleged gender-based violence, and called out the hosts victim-blaming.
swa: Kwenye mtandao wa Twitter, Wakenya wenye hasira waliwaghadhabisha watangazaji Shaffie Weru, Joseph Munoru, na Neville Muysa kwa matamshi yao juu ya kesi ya madai ya unyanyasaji wa kijinsia, na kuwaita watangazaji hao wahanga-wa-kulaumu.
mt0: <pad> On Twitter, angry Kenyans attacked the broadcasters Shaffie Weru, Joseph Munoru, and Neville Muysa for their comments about the alleged sex abuse case, calling the broadcasters victims of blaming.</s>

en: Shaffie is insinuating that the lady who was pushed from the 12th floor of a building in Nairobi CBD after she said no to a man's advancements was because she was too loose & very available hence putting herself is such a situation.
swa: Shaffie anasisitiza kwamba mwanamke huyo alisukumwa kutoka gorofa ya 12 ya jengo jijini Nairobi baada ya kusema hapana kwa mwanamume ni kwa sababu alijiachia sana na kuwa huru kwa hivyo kujiweka mwenyewe katika hali kama hiyo.
mt0: <pad> Shaffie insists that the woman who was thrown from the 12th floor of a building in Nairobi after saying no to a man is because she was too free and too liberated to put herself in such a situation.</s>

en: What the actual hell!
swa: Ni kuzimu gani!
mt0: <pad> What are the names of the devils?</s>

en: The case divided online users as a section of citizens took sides with the hosts.
swa: Kesi hii imegawanya watumiaji wa mitandao kwani kuna baadhi yao wanakubaliana na watangazaji hao.
mt0: <pad> The case has divided internet users as some of them agree with the advertisers.</s>

en: Although the trio was fired by the radio station, it brought to the fore how hostile the Kenyan online space has become for women.
swa: Ingawa watatu hao walifukuzwa kazi na kituo hicho cha redio, ilileta wazi jinsi uhasama wa nafasi mkondoni ya Kenya imekua kwa wanawake.
mt0: <pad> Although the three were fired by the station, it highlighted how Kenya's online violence has grown against women.</s>

en: There are about 21.75 million internet users in Kenya, or 40 percent of the country's population, according to 2021 data by research firm DataReportal.
swa: Kuna takribani watumiaji 21.75 milioni wa mitandao nchini Kenya, au asilimia 40 ya idadi ya watu nchini kulingana na utafiti wa data uliofanywa na kampuni ya DataReportal mwaka 2021.
mt0: <pad> There are approximately 21.75 million internet users in Kenya, or 40 percent of the country's population according to a data report by the company DataReportal in 2021.</s>

en: Around 11 million of those use social media, an increase of 2.2 percent compared to 2020.

en: Three years after the court deemed the country's buggery laws unconstitutional, Trinidad and Tobago's Equal Opportunity Act (EOA) finally looks set to amend its regulations pertaining to sexual orientation.
swa: Miaka mitatu baada ya mahakama kutamka wazi kwamba sheria hizo zinakwenda kinyume na katiba, hatimaye Trinadad na Tobago inaonekana iko njiani kurekebisha kanuni za Sheria ya Fursa Sawa (EOA) zinazohusiana na ushoga.
mt0: <pad> Three years after the court clearly declared that these laws were inconsistent with the constitution, finally Trinidad and Tobago seems to be on its way to correcting the provisions of the Equality of Opportunity Act (EOA) relating to homosexuality.</s>

en: The Act's self-proclaimed purpose is to prohibit certain kinds of discrimination and promote equality of opportunity between persons of different status.
swa: Sheria hiyo ina lengo linalosomekana kama, kuzuia aina fulani za ubaguzi na kukuza usawa wa fursa baina ya watu wenye hali tofauti.
mt0: <pad> The law is supposed to have the purpose of preventing some forms of discrimination and promoting equal opportunity between people of different backgrounds.</s>

en: To this end, an Equal Opportunity Commission and an Equal Opportunity Tribunal were established to handle such issues but so far, neither body has been unable to deal with matters of discrimination based on sexual orientation.
swa: Kwa minajili ya lengo hiyo,  Tume ya Fursa na Mahakama ya Fursa Sawa zilianzishwa ili kushughulikia masuala hayo lakini mpaka sasa, vyombo hivyo vinashindwa kushughulikia masuala ya ubaguzi dhidi ya ushoga.
mt0: <pad> For that purpose, the Equality Commission and the Equality Court were established to deal with these issues but until now, the agencies have failed to deal with cases of discrimination against gays.</s>

en: The current laws only cover discrimination based on sex, race, ethnicity, origin, religion, marital status, or disability in matters of employment, training, education, and the like.
swa: Sheria zilizopo zinashughulikia ubaguzi wa kijinsia, rangi, kabila, asili, dini, hali ya ndoa, au ulemavu kwenye masuala ya ajira, mafunzo, elimu na kadhalika.
mt0: <pad> The existing laws deal with discrimination based on gender, race, ethnicity, origin, religion, marital status, or disability in the fields of employment, training, education and so on.</s>

en: Pressure to amend the current Act mounted after Scotiabank Trinidad and Tobago announced on April 14 that it would extend its health benefits to the partners of employees in same-sex relationships, in the same way it already offered access to the common-law partners of heterosexual employees.

mt0: <pad> The pressure to amend the current law increased after Scotiabank in Trinidad and Tobago announced on April 14 that it will extend its health care package to same-sex partners, in the same way as it did for same-sex partners.</s>

en: For internet and technology companies, collecting user data remains one of their main sources of income.

mt0: <pad> For internet and technology companies, collecting information about internet users has become their major source of revenue.</s>

en: But this business model includes a security risk for users, as demonstrated by recurring cases of undisclosed commercial use, massive leaks, and hacking incidents.
swa: Hata hivyo, namna hii ya kujipatia kipato inawaweka hatarini watumiaji kama inavyojidhihirisha katika matukio ya mara kwa mara ya uwekaji wazi wa taarifa za kibiashara, uvujaji mkubwa wa taarifa na udukuaji.
mt0: <pad> However, this method of earnings puts users at risk as it is manifested in frequent cases of openly posted business information, large data breaches and hacking.</s>

mt0: <pad> Is there a reasonable way to protect the privacy of internet users?</s>

mt0: <pad> Companies like Google and Apple have invested a lot of energy in collecting daily information about their customers, especially through mobile devices, and the integration of different commonly used tools like calendars and agendas.</s>

en: A multitude of apps track the user's location in real time, while health and sports apps dig deep into their biometric information.
swa: Vitumizi kadha wa kadha vimekuwa vikifuatilia mahali halisi mtu alipo, na kwa upande mwingine vitumizi vya masuala ya afya na michezo vikijikita katika kukusanya taarifa za vinasaba vya wateja.

en: This data is collected and analyzed, allegedly to offer more tailored and sophisticated services.

mt0: <pad> This information is collected and analyzed in order to make it easier and provide the user with what he or she needs quickly.</s>

en: In fact, most users do not realize they are offering a wealth of data to service providers and platform owners, free of charge.

mt0: <pad> However, the reality is that, internet users and technology tools do not know that they are providing their information for free without any charge.</s>

en: Privacy activists, such as Austrian Max Schrems, have expressed strong concerns about this model.

mt0: <pad> activists for online privacy such as Austrian citizen Max Schrems have expressed their concerns about this practice of internet and technology companies to make money through the information of their customers.</s>

en: They highlight the risks of increasingly frequent privacy violations and abuses.

mt0: <pad> He highlights the danger of an increased number of cases of abuses and violations of privacy rights law.</s>

en: This was perhaps best illustrated by the Facebook scandal known as the Cambridge Analytica case  in which British consulting firm Cambridge Analytica obtained the personal data of 87 million Facebook users without consent, in order to provide analytical assistance to the 2016 presidential campaigns of Ted Cruz and Donald Trump.
swa: Moja ya matukio kama haya pengine yameelezwa vizuri sana kupitia tukio la skendo ya Facebook linalofahamika kama kesi ya Cambridge Analytica ambapo Taasisi binafsi ya ushauri ya Cambridge Analytica ilijikusanyia taarifa binafsi za watumiaji milioni 87 wa Facebook bila idhini yao kwa lengo la  kuwasaidia wagombea kiti cha Urais Ted Cruz na Donald Trump mapema mwaka 2016.
mt0: <pad> One of these cases is perhaps best illustrated by the Cambridge Analytica case where private consulting firm Cambridge Analytica collected personal information of 87 million Facebook users without their consent to help Ted Cruz and Donald Trump as US presidential nominees in 2016.</s>

en: Schrems says he warned Facebook representatives about the data-mining activities of Cambridge Analytica, but could not convince them to act:
swa: Schrems anasema kuwa aliwatahadharisha wawakilishi wa Facebook kuhusu matukio ya ukusanyaji taarifa za wateja wao uliokuwa unafanywa na taasisi ya Cambridge Analytica, na hata hivyo, hakuweza kuwashawishi kuchukua hatua:
mt0: <pad> Schrems says he warned Facebook representatives about the practices of collecting customer data by Cambridge Analytica, but he could not convince them to take action.</s>

en: They [Facebook representatives] explicitly said that in their view, by using the platform you consent to a situation where other people can install an app and gather your data.
swa: Wawakilishi wa Facebook bila kumumunya maneno walisema kuwa kwa maoni yao, unapotumia jukwaa la mmiliki fulani unakuwa umeruhusu watu hao wapakie vitumizi vyao [kwenye simu za mkononi na vifaa vingine] kwa ajili ya kukusanya taarifa za mtumiaji.
mt0: <pad> Facebook representatives said that in their opinion, by using the platform of a third party owner you are allowing those people to install their tools [on your phone and other devices] to collect user information.</s>

en: But why would you care about privacy if you have nothing to hide, after all?

mt0: <pad> However, why do you worry about privacy online when you have nothing to hide?</s>

en: Arguing that you don't care about the right to privacy because you have nothing to hide is no different than saying you don't care about free speech because you have nothing to say.
swa: Kufikiri kuwa hujali chochote kuhusu haki ya faragha mtandaoni kwa kuwa huna cha kuficha ni sawa na kufikiri kuwa hujali chochote kuhusu haki ya kujieleza kwa kuwa huna chochote cha kusema.

en: Besides the seductive dangers of nostalgia for those who still remember analog times, we are also facing a real risk of dependence on information technology.

mt0: <pad> For those who remember, aside from the joys and pains of the years of the analog system, we are now facing a great danger of dependence on information technology.</s>

en: In May 2018, the European Union passed the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

en: The law adds multiple constraints to data management, such as asking users for explicit authorization for the use of their data and requiring companies to remove this data after a period of three years without interaction.

mt0: <pad> The law has added several requirements to the storage of data including obtaining clear consent from the user regarding his or her data and requiring companies to delete these data after three years without being forced.</s>

en: It also introduces extremely large fines for those who do not respect these rules.

en: In early March, Kenya procured over 1 million doses of Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine doses through the COVID-19 Vaccines Global Access initiative, a World Health Organization-backed global vaccine distribution effort known as COVAX.
swa: Mapema mwezi Machi, Kenya ilinunua zaidi ya dozi milioni 1 za chanjo ya Oxford-AstraZeneca kupitia mpango wa Upatikanaji wa Chanjo ya UVIKO-19 Duniani, inayoratibiwa na Shirika la Afya Duniani kupitia utaratibu unaoitwa COVAX.
mt0: <pad> Earlier in March, Kenya bought over 1 million doses of Oxford-AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine through the Global Access to Vaccine Program, coordinated by the World Health Organization through a program called COVAX.</s>

en: The delivery marked the start of a campaign to offer the vaccine free of charge at select public and private hospitals.
swa: Kupokelewa kwa chanjo hizo kulianzisha kampeni ya kutoa chanjo bure katika hospitali teule za umma na binafsi.
mt0: <pad> The failure of the vaccines led to a campaign to provide free vaccines at selected public and private hospitals.</s>

en: The rollout was broken down into three phases: healthcare workers and security and immigration officials, citizens over age 58 and adults with certain medical conditions, and other citizens in vulnerable conditions such as those living in informal settlements.
swa: Kutolewa kwa dawa hizo kuligawanywa katika hatua tatu: watumishi wa afya na maafisa usalama na uhamiaji, wananchi wenye umri zaidi ya miaka 58 na watu wazima wenye changamoto mbalimbali za afya, na wananchi wengine wanaoishi kwenye mazingira hatarishi kama wale wanaoishi kwenye makazi yasiyo rasmi.
mt0: <pad> The distribution of the drugs was divided into three phases: health workers and immigration and security officers, citizens over 58 and elderly people with different health problems, and other citizens living in risky environments such as those living in unofficial housing.</s>

en: The country is set to receive 24 million doses through COVAX.
swa: Nchi hiyo inategemea kupokea dozi milioni 24 kupitia utaratibu wa  COVAX.
mt0: <pad> The country is expected to receive 24 million doses through the COVAX program.</s>

en: It plans to vaccinate 50 percent of the population by June 2022 through a combination of COVAX vaccines and donations from other countries, reports The Washington Post.
swa: Kwa mujibu wa jarida la The Washington Post, Kenya inalenga kuchanja asimilia 50 ya wananchi wake ifikapo Juni 2022 kwa ushirikiano kati ya mradi wa COVAX na misaada kutoka mataifa mengine.
mt0: <pad> According to The Washington Post, Kenya is aiming to vaccinate 50% of its population by June 2022 in cooperation with the COVAX project and other aid from other countries.</s>

en: In a press release, UNICEF Representative to Kenya Maniza Zaman celebrated the arrival of the first vaccines in Kenya.
swa: Kwenye taarifa yake kwa vyombo vya habari, Mwakilishi wa UNICEF nchini Kenya Maniza Zaman alipongeza kuwasili kwa chanjo za kwanza nchini Kenya.
mt0: <pad> In a statement to the media, UNICEF's Kenyan Representative Maniza Zaman hailed the arrival of the first vaccines in Kenya.</s>

en: With the arrival of these vaccines, UNICEF and partners are honouring the promise of the COVAX facility to ensure people from less wealthy countries are not left behind in the global rollout of life-saving vaccines, she said.
swa: Kufuatilia kuwasili kwa chanjo hizi, UNICEF na washirika wake wanapongeza ahadi ya COVAX kuhakikisha kuwa watu wanaotoka kwenye nchi zisizo na uwezo mkubwa kiuchumi hawaachwi nyuma kwenye mpango huu wa kimataifa wa kuokoa maisha ya watu kwa chanjo, alisema.
mt0: <pad> While monitoring the delivery of these vaccines, UNICEF and its partners welcome the COVAX's commitment to ensure that people from low-income countries are not left out of this international effort to save lives through the vaccine, he said.</s>

en: However, this elaborately planned three-phase rollout fell apart as soon as the exercise began because of a last-minute government decision to fast-track phase two in response to the third wave, conflicting politically charged interests, and the states failure to consult and inform citizens.
swa: Hata hivyo, mpango huu wa tatu ulivurugika mara baada ya zoezi kuanza kwa sababu ya uamuzi wa dakika za mwisho wa kuharakisha awamu ya pili ya mpango huyo kama namna ya kukabiliana na wimbi la tatu la maambukizi, maslahi ya kisiasa yanayokinzana, na serikali kushindwa kuwasiliana na kuwajulisha wananchi.
mt0: <pad> However, this third plan was derailed immediately after its start because of the last-minute decision to rush the second phase of the plan as a way to deal with the third wave of transmission, conflicting political interests, and the government's inability to communicate and inform the public.</s>

en: In his article questioning what is going on with Kenyas COVID-19 vaccine drive, Patrick Gathara, a Nairobi-based writer and award-winning political cartoonist noted:
swa: Katika makala yake inayohoji kile kinachoendelea kwenye mpango wa chanjo ya UVIKO-19 nchini Kenya, Patrick Gathara, mwandishi anayeishi Kenya na mchoraji wa katuni za siasa aliyepata tuzo mbali mbali alisema:
mt0: <pad> Patrick Gathara, a Kenyan writer and award-winning political cartoonist, said in his article on the progress of the COVID-19 vaccine program in Kenya, that he was "very disappointed" with the government's response to the pandemic.</s>

en: Politicians loudly and self-servingly argued that they should be given priority to inspire confidence among the population, even though the Ministry of Health was reporting encountering little resistance.
swa: Kwa sauti kubwa na ubinafsi, wanasiasa walidai kwamba wao ndio wanaopaswa kupewa kipaumbele ili kuwajengea imani wananchi, ingawa Wizara ya Afya tayari ilisharipoti kutokuwepo kwa upinzani mkubwa wa chanjo hiyo.
mt0: <pad> With a big voice and selfishness, politicians argued that they should be prioritized to build trust with the people, although the Health Ministry had already reported that there was no large opposition to the vaccine.</s>

en: Because the state had ignored the need to explain its plan to the population, there was widespread confusion about where and when people were expected to be in line.
swa: Kwa kuwa serikali imepuuza takwa la kueleza mpango wake kwa wananchi, kulikuwa na mkanganyiko mkubwa kuhusu wapi na lini watu wanatarajiwa kusimama kwenye mstari.
mt0: <pad> Since the government has ignored the need to explain its plan to the public, there was great confusion about where and when people were expected to stand in line.</s>

en: Despite government directives prioritizing citizens over the age of 58, Kenyan media reported that businessmen and politicians not in this age group have found a way to get the jab early, exposing the country's rich-poor divide.
swa: Pamoja na maelekezo ya serikali  kuwapa kipaumbele wananchi wenye umri wa zaidi ya miaka 58,  vyombo vya habari nchini Kenya viliripoti kwamba wafanyabiashara na wanasiasa wasio kwenye kundi la umri huu wamekuwa wakipata huduma kinyume na utaratibu, hali inayoonesha ubaguzi mkubwa wa masikini unaofanywa na wenye fedha.
mt0: <pad> Although the government has instructed that people over 58 years of age should be prioritized, Kenyan media have reported that businessmen and politicians who are not in this group have been receiving services against the order, which shows the great discrimination of poor by the rich.</s>

en: Meanwhile, eligible senior citizens and poor Kenyans, who aren't well connected and don't have money to pay a bribe, often wait in line all day starting at 5 a.m., only to be asked to return the following day because the doses are finished, according to The Washington Post.
swa: Wakati huo huo, wazee wanaostahili na Wakenya maskini, ambao hawana mtandao wa watu wa kuwasaidia na wasio na fedha za kuhonga,  huonekana wakingoja kwenye mstari siku zote kuanzia saa 11 alfajiri, na kuishia kuombwa warudi siku nyingine kwa sababu dawa zimeisha, kwa mujibu wa habari iliyoandikwa na jarida la The Washington Post.
mt0: <pad> While the elderly and poor Kenyans, who do not have a network of support and no money to bribe, are seen waiting in line every day from 11 o'clock in the morning, and are finally asked to return another day because the medicines are out of stock, according to a report by The Washington Post.</s>

en: They have another door for their friends, Mary Njoroge, 58, one of the teachers, told The Washington Post.
swa: Wana mlango mwingine kwa marafiki zao, Mary Njoroge, 58, mmoja wa walimu, aliliambia The Washngton Post.
mt0: <pad> They have another door for their friends, Mary Njoroge, 58, one of the teachers, told The Washington Post.</s>

en: Without a godfather to help you through this process, what are you supposed to do?
swa: Bila kuwa na mtu wa kukusaidia kukamilisha mchakato wote, utafanya nini?
mt0: <pad> Without having someone to help you complete the whole process, what will you do?</s>

en: A similar incident in another government hospital was reported by @_Sativa, a Twitter user based in Nairobi, Kenyan.
swa: Tukio kama hilo liliripotiwa kwenye hospitali nyingine ya serikali na @_Sativa, mtumiaji wa Twita anayeishi Nairobi, ambaye pia ni Mkenya.
mt0: <pad> Same incident was reported at another government hospital by @_Sativa, a Twitter user who lives in Nairobi, Kenya, and also a Kenyan.</s>

en: In a Twitter thread, he recounted the experience of his aunt, a retired teacher in her 60s.
swa: Kwenye uzi huo wa Twita, alielezea kile ambacho shangazi yake alikutana nacho, mwalimu mstaafu mwenye zaidi ya miaka 60.
mt0: <pad> In the tweet, she described what her grandmother had experienced, an elderly teacher who was over 60.</s>

en: While elderly people waited in line, a nurse called out names and young people came to the front to get vaccinated.
swa: Wakati wazee wakisubiri mstarini, muuguzi aliita majina na vijana walikuja mbele na wakatangulia kupata chanjo.
mt0: <pad> While the elderly waited in line, the nurse called names and the younger people came forward and got the first shot.</s>

en: When his aunt asked what was happening, the nurse gave her a number where she could send money, he said in his Twitter thread.
swa: Shangazi yake alipouliza nini kinaendelea, muuguzi alimpa namba [ya simu] ambayo angeweza kutumia fedha, alisema kwenye uzi huo wa Twitter.
mt0: <pad> When his uncle asked what was going on, the nurse gave him a number [of a phone] where he could use money, he said in a tweet.</s>

en: Following reports of increased enthusiasm from the public for the vaccination campaign, Kenyas Cabinet Secretary for Health, Mutahi Kagwe told the media:
swa: Kufuatia taarifa za kuongezeka kwa hamasa ya watu kwa kampeni hiyo ya chanjo, Waziri wa Afya wa Kenya, Mutahi Kagwe aliviambia vyombo vya habari:
mt0: <pad> After reports of an increased interest in the vaccination campaign, Kenya's Health Minister Mutahi Kagwe told the press that the government was committed to keeping the vaccine campaign going.</s>

en: I think somewhere along the line we seem to have developed some confusion that anybody can walk into a vaccination centre and get vaccines.
swa: Nadhani tumefika mahali tumetengeneza hali ya sintofahamu kwamba mtu yeyote anaweza kwenda kwenye kituo cha kutolea chanjo na kupata huduma.
mt0: <pad> I think we've reached a point where we've created a confusion that anybody can go to a vaccination center and get service.</s>

en: I want to make it very clear, those carrying out vaccination will have to account for every dose that they have used and that dose that they have used must be matched against an eligible person.
swa: Ninataka kuliweka suala hili vizuri, wale wanaotoa huduma ya chanjo watatoa hesabu ya kila dawa waliyoitumia na kwamba dawa zilizotumika lazima zioanishwe na mtu anayestahili huduma hiyo.
mt0: <pad> I want to make this clear, those who provide vaccination services will report every drug they use and that the drugs used must be identified by the person eligible for the service.</s>

en: The National Nurses Association of Kenya president Alfred Obengo pleaded with Kenyans who are not on the priority list to avoid queuing for the vaccine.
swa: Rais wa Chama cha Taifa cha Wauguzi nchini Kenya Alfred Obengo aliwaomba Wakenya wasio kwenye orodha ya kipaumbele kuepuka kusimama kwenye foleni ya chanjo.
mt0: <pad> The president of the Kenya National Nursing Association Alfred Obengo urged Kenyans who were not on the prioritisation list to avoid waiting in line for the vaccine.</s>

en: In providing clarity on how the Kenyan government could have avoided this confusion in its rollout plan, Gathara concludes his article by saying:
swa: Akifafanua namna serikali ya Kenya ingeweza kuepuka mkanganyiko huo katika kutekeleza mpango huo,  Gathara anahitimisha makala yake kwa kusema:
mt0: <pad> When describing how Kenya's government could have avoided this confusion in implementing the plan, Gathara concludes his article by saying:</s>

en: Much of this could have been avoided if the Kenyan government and its global partners, including the World Health Organization and Western governments, treated Kenyans as partners in the rollout rather than colonial subjects to be brutalised and exploited.
swa: Tungeweza kuepuka kadhia hii kama serikali ya Kenya na washirika wake duniani, ikiwa ni pamoja na Shirika la Afya Duniani na serikali za nchi za magharibi, zingefanya kazi na Kenya kama mbia wa mpango huu na sio koloni linalotendewa ukatili na kunyonywa.
mt0: <pad> We could have avoided this tragedy if the Kenyan government and its international allies, including the World Health Organization and Western governments, worked with Kenya as a beneficiary of this plan and not a colony that is subject to brutality and exploitation.</s>

en: Sadly for Kenyans, their colonial state does not know how to act any differently.
swa: Inasikitisha sana kwa Wakenya, nchi yao ambayo ni koloni haifahamu namna nyingine ya kufanya.
mt0: <pad> It's very sad for Kenyans, their country that is a colony doesn't know how to do it otherwise.</s>

en: Last December, the world's eyes were riveted on Argentina as abortion was legalized in that country.
swa: Mwezi Desemba mwaka jana, dunia yote ilijielekeza nchini Argentina ambako utoaji mimba uliruhusiwa rasmi kisheria nchini humo.
mt0: <pad> In December last year, the world turned its attention to Argentina where abortion was legally recognized in the country.</s>

en: But to what extent are girls and women being forced to become mothers in other parts of the world?
swa: Lakini je, ni kwa kiwango gani wasichana na wanawake wanalazimishwa kuwa wazazi katika sehemu nyingine duniani?
mt0: <pad> But, how much more are girls and women forced to be parents in other parts of the world?</s>

swa: Tazama au sikiliza kipindi hiki cha Global Voices Insights (kilichoruka hewani mubashara tarehe 7 Aprili), ambapo mhariri wetu wa Amerika Kusini Melissa Vida anafanya mazungumzo kuhusu haki za uzazi na wataalam na wanaharakati wafuatao:
mt0: <pad> Watch or listen to this Global Voices Insights (broadcast live on April 7), where our South American editor Melissa Vida speaks with the following experts and activists about parental rights:</s>

mt0: <pad> Debora Diniz (Brazil): a cultural studies expert who conducts research projects on bioethics, women's rights, human rights and health.</s>

swa: Anafundisha Chuo Kikuu cha Brasilia, lakini pia akitafiti katika Chuo Kikuu cha Brown, na ni mwanaharakati wa haki za uzazi.
mt0: <pad> She teaches at the University of Brasilia, but also researched at Brown University, and is a activist for parental rights.</s>

en: Her documentaries on abortion, equal marriage, secular state and stem cell research have received numerous national and international awards and have been screened in numerous competitions.

mt0: <pad> His documentaries about abortion, marriage equality, government segregation and religion and the study of stem cells have received numerous national and international awards and have been nominated in various competitions.</s>

mt0: <pad> Joy Asasira (Uganda): a prominent advocate for maternal health in Africa, Human Rights and gender issues and a global strategist of advocacy, campaigner, and activist and organizer of movements and a director of coordination and planning.</s>

en: Joy was awarded Uganda Law Societys best Female Human Rights Lawyer 2018/2019 and recognition as an emerging mid-career woman leader in Global Health at the Women Leaders in Global Health Conference (2017) at Stanford University.
swa: Joy alitunukiwa tuzo ya Chama cha Wanasheria nchini Uganda (ULS) ya Mwanasheria Mwanamke Bora wa Haki za Binadamu kwa 2018/2019 na akatambuliwa kama kiongozi mwanamke chipukizi katika Afya ya Dunia kwenye Mkutano wa Wanawake Viongozi duniani uliofanyika Chuo Kikuu cha Stanford mwaka 2017.

en: Emilie Palamy Pradichit (Thailand): founder and director of Manushya Foundation, which she founded in 2017 (Manushya means Human Being in Sanskrit), with the goal to reinforce the power of local communities, in particular women human rights defenders, so they can fight for their rights, equality, and social justice.
swa: Emilie Palamy Pradichit (Thailand): mwanzilishi na mkurugenzi wa Shirika la Manushya, alilolianzisha mwaka 2017 (Manushya ni neno la Sanskrit lenye maana ya Mtu), akiwa na lengo la kuhamasisha nguvu ya jamii za watu wa maeneo mahususi, hususani wanawake watetezi wa haki za binadamu, ili waweze kupigania haki zao, usawa na haki za kijamii.
mt0: <pad> Emilie Palamy Pradichit (Thailand): founder and director of the Manushya Foundation, which she founded in 2017 (Manushya is a Sanskrit word meaning Man), with the aim of mobilizing the power of community groups of people from specific areas, particularly women human rights activists, to fight for their rights, equality and social rights.</s>

en: In early March, as Tanzanians began to speculate about the health and location of President John Magufuli, many citizens took to social media with their queries and concerns.
swa: Mwanzoni mwa mwezi Machi, wakati wa-Tanzania walipoanza kuhoji afya na mahali alipo Rais John Magufuli, raia wengi walitumia mitandao ya kijamii kuuliza maswali na hata kuonesha wasiwasi wao.
mt0: <pad> In early March, when Tanzanians began to question the health and whereabouts of President John Magufuli, many people used social media to ask questions and even show their concerns.</s>

en: In response, the government issued threats of mass arrests to anyone who used social media to share false information about the president.
swa: Katika kujibu maswali hayo, serikali ilitishia kumkamata mtu yeyote aliyetumia mitandao ya kijamii kusambaza taarifa potofu kuhusu rais.
mt0: <pad> In response to those questions, the government threatened to arrest any person who used social media to spread false information about the president.</s>

en: Authorities swiftly referred to Tanzanias 2015 Cybercrimes Act, and the 2020 Electronic and Postal Communications (Online Content) Regulations (EPOCA) to arrest and detain those who violated its rules.
swa: Mamlaka za serikali zilirejea Sheria ya Makosa ya Mtandao ya Tanzania ya mwaka 2015 na Kanuni za Mawasiliano ya Kieletroniki na Posta (Maudhui ya Mtandao) (EPOCA) zilizotungwa mwaka 2020 kuelezea uwezekano wa kuwakamata na kuwaweka ndani wote waliovunja sheria hizo.
mt0: <pad> The government authorities have re-examined the Tanzanian Internet Crime Act of 2015 and the Electronic Postage Stamp and Communications (Internet Content) Regulations (EPOCA) promulgated in 2020 to explain the possibility of arrest and imprisonment for any person who violates those laws.</s>

en: The government has often used cybercrime laws and online content regulations to undermine and clamp down on digital rights and freedom of expression in Tanzania, this time was no different.
swa: Huu ulikuwa ni mwendelezo wa hatua za serikali, ambayo mara kadhaa, imetumia sheria za makosa ya mtandao na kanuni za maudhui ya mtandaoni kudhibiti na kubana haki za kidijitali na uhuru wa maoni nchini Tanzania.
mt0: <pad> This was a continuation of government actions, which have often used internet crime laws and online content rules to control and restrict digital rights and freedom of expression in Tanzania.</s>

en: On March 17, then-Vice President Samia Suluhu Hassan revealed on state TV that John Magufuli had died.
swa: Mnamo Machi 17, aliyekuwa Makamu wa Rais Samia Suluhu Hassan alitangaza kwenye televisheni ya taifa kwamba John Magufuli amefariki.
mt0: <pad> On March 17, former Vice President Samia Suluhu Hassan announced on national television that John Magufuli had died.</s>

en: Soon after, Hassan was sworn in as the sixth president of Tanzania.
swa: Siku chache baadae, Hassan aliapishwa kuwa rais wa sita wa Tanzania.
mt0: <pad> A few days later, Hassan was sworn in as the sixth president of Tanzania.</s>

en: By then, at least four people had been arrested in different parts of the country for spreading false rumors about Magufulis health and location.
swa: Hadi wakati huo,  watu wasiopungua wanne walikuwa wamekamatwa katika maeneo mbalimbali ya nchi kwa kosa la kusambaza uvumi wa uongo kuhusu afya na mahali aliko Magufuli.
mt0: <pad> At the time, at least four people had been arrested in different parts of the country for spreading false information about Magufuli's health and location.</s>

en: Many now wonder if Tanzania will review its repressive online content regulations in a post-Magufuli world, or whether these laws will remain firmly in place until 2025- the remainder of Magufuli's term served by Hassan.
swa: Wengi hivi sasa wanajiuliza ikiwa Tanzania itapitia upya kanuni zake zinazodhibiti maudhui ya mtandaoni baada ya utawala wa Magufuli, au ikiwa sheria hizi zitaendelea kutumika mpaka mwaka 2025  kipindi cha Magufuli kilichobaki kitakachokamilishwa na Rais Samia Hassan.
mt0: <pad> Many people now wonder if Tanzania will review its rules on online content after the presidency of Magufuli, or if these rules will continue to be in force until 2025 the rest of Magufuli's term which will be completed by President Samia Hassan.</s>

en: In early March, Innocent Bashungwa, Tanzanias Minister of Information, Culture, Arts and Sports, issued a warning specifically to the media to desist from spreading rumors about Magufulis whereabouts, who had not been seen in the public eye since February 27.
swa: Mapema mwezi Machi, Innocent Bashungwa, Waziri wa Habari, Utamaduni, Sanaa na Michezo wa Tanzania, alitoa tahadhari kwa vyombo vya habari kuepuka kusambaza uvumi kuhusu  aliko Magufuli, ambaye wakati huo alikuwa hajaonekana hadharani tangu Februari 27.
mt0: <pad> Earlier in March, Innocent Bashungwa, Tanzania's Minister of Information, Culture, Sports and Sport, warned the media not to spread rumors about where Magufuli was, who hadn't been seen publicly since February 27.</s>

en: Additionally, the Minister of Legal and Constitutional Affairs, Mwigulu Nchemba, also threatened netizens with jail time via his Twitter account for sharing nonsense rumors, specifically citing Section 89 of the Penal Code and Section 16 of the Cybercrimes Act.
swa: Aidha, Waziri wa Sheria na Mambo ya Katiba, Mwigulu Nchemba, pia aliwatishia watumiaji wa mitandao adhabu ya kifungo kupitia akaunti yake ya Twita kwa kosa la kusambaza uvumi wa kijinga, akirejea Kifungu cha 89 cha Kanuni za Adhabu na Kifungu cha 16 cha Sheria ya Makosa ya Mtandao.
mt0: <pad> Also, the Minister of Law and Constitutional Affairs, Mwigulu Nchemba, also threatened internet users with jail time via his Twitter account for the crime of distributing false information, citing Article 89 of the Penal Code and Article 16 of the Internet Crime Act.</s>

en: Police Chief Ramadhani Kingai expressed specific interest in the Twitter account of Kigogo, a Swahili name referring to a high-ranking official, who often exposes government wrongdoing.
swa: Mkuu wa Polisi Ramadhani Kingai alionesha nia ya kutaka kuifahamu akaunti ya Twita yenye jina la Kigogo, ambayo kwa muda mrefu imejipambanua kuanika mabaya ya serikali.
mt0: <pad> The police chief Ramadhani Kingai expressed an interest in knowing the Twitter account with the name Kigogo, which has been known for long to criticize the government.</s>

en: Human rights activists have condemned these moves and the overall climate of fear created by these regulations and subsequent threats of enforcement.
swa: Wanaharakati wa haki za binadamu wameshutumu hatua hizi zinazochukuliwa na maafisa wa serikali na hali ya woga inayojengwa na kanuni hizi sambamba na vitisho vinavyoambatana na utekelezaji wake.
mt0: <pad> Human rights activists have condemned these measures by government officials and the fear that these rules create as well as the intimidation associated with their implementation.</s>

en: EPOCA 2020: Further restrictions on digital rights

en: Tanzania has experienced remarkable internet, communications and technological advancements over the last decade.
swa: Kwa zaidi ya muongo mmoja uliopita, Tanzania imefurahia mtandao madhubuti na maendeleo makubwa ya mawasiliano na teknolojia.
mt0: <pad> For over a decade, Tanzania has enjoyed a strong network and great development in communication and technology.</s>

en: Nevertheless, the state often plays an influential role over Tanzanian media companies and platforms and independent media lacks diversity in terms of viewpoints and representation.
swa: Pamoja na maendeleo hayo, serikali imekuwa ikijiwekea mazingira ya kudhibiti makampuni na majukwaa ya majadiliano na kwa sababu hiyo vyombo huru vya habari vinashindwa kujipambanua  kwa maana ya aina ya maoni yanayochapishwa na sura ya uwakilishi wake.
mt0: <pad> However, the government has been setting a context for itself to control companies and debating platforms and because of this, independent media cannot distinguish themselves in terms of the type of opinion published and its form of representation.</s>

en: The internet created new spaces online for Tanzanias young bloggers and social media activists to make their voices heard, but the government has not welcomed this new reality.
swa: Mtandao wa Intaneti umetengeneza jukwaa jipya mtandaoni kwa wanablogu vijana wa Tanzania na wanaharakati wanaotumia mitandao ya kijamii kupaza sauti zao, lakini serikali haionekani kukubaliana na ukweli huu mpya.
mt0: <pad> The Internet has created a new online platform for young Tanzanian bloggers and activists who use social media to raise their voices, but the government seems not to accept this new reality.</s>

en: In 2010, Tanzania first published the Electronic and Postal Communications Act, the first of its kind in the country.
swa: Mwaka 2010, Tanzania ilichapisha Sheria ya Mawasiliano ya Kieletroniki na Posta, ambayo ilikuwa ya aina yake nchini humo.
mt0: <pad> In 2010, Tanzania published the Law on Electronic Communications and Postage Stamps, which was the first of its kind in the country.</s>

en: By 2018, specific regulations regarding online content were released through Electronic and Postal Communications (Online Content) Regulations, 2018.
swa: Kufikia 2018, kanuni mahususi zinazodhibiti maudhui ya mtandaoni zilitolewa kupitia Kanuni za Mawasiliano ya Kieletroniki na Posta (Maudhui ya Mtandaoni) 2018.
mt0: <pad> As of 2018, specific rules that govern online content were issued through the Electronic Communications and Postage Stamp (Online Content) 2018 Regulations.</s>

en: The government argued that these regulations were intended to monitor and regulate citizens use of social media, in particular, and tackle issues like hate speech and disinformation.
swa: Serikali ilidai kwamba kanuni hizi zililenga kufuatilia kwa karibu matumizi ya mitandao ya kijamii, hususani, kupambana na tatizo la habari zinazoeneza chuki na uzushi mitandaoni.
mt0: <pad> The government said that these rules were intended to closely monitor the use of social media, particularly, to fight the problem of spreading hatred and lies on the internet.</s>

en: However, the regulations applied not only to mainstream media but to individual bloggers and content providers, who were shocked by the new requirement to pay $900 United States dollars for a license.
swa: Hata hivyo, kanuni hizo si tu zilitumika dhidi ya vyombo vikuu vya habari lakini pia kwa wanablogu mmoja mmoja na watoa huduma za maudhui, ambao walishangazwa na takwa jipya la kisheria la kulipa kiasi cha dola za Marekani 900  ili kupata leseni.
mt0: <pad> However, these rules were not only used against major media outlets but also for individual bloggers and content providers, who were surprised by the new law requiring them to pay 900 US dollars to obtain a license.</s>

en: This includes anyone who produces live-streaming TV or radio.
swa: Takwa hili pia lilimhusu yeyote anayetayarisha na kurusha mubashara matangazo ya televisheni au radio mtandaoni.
mt0: <pad> The law also applies to any person who produces and broadcasts television or radio broadcasts online.</s>

en: The sudden imposition of fees turned Tanzanian social media dark as many bloggers and content providers gave up due to the exorbitant costs.
swa: Giza kubwa lilitanda kwenye mitandao ya kijamii kufuatia takwa hili la ghafla la ada ambapo wanablogu wengi na wazalishaji wa maudhui waliamua kuachana na shughuli zao kwa sababu ya gharama hizo kubwa.
mt0: <pad> A large buzz spread across social media after this sudden tax hike where many bloggers and content creators decided to quit their business because of the high costs.</s>

en: Opposition politicians and social media practitioners critiqued the regulations for undermining online media freedoms as well as civil society.
swa: Wanasiasa wa upinzani na watumiaji wa mitandao ya kijamii walikosoa vikali kanuni hizi kwa kupoka uhuru wa mitandao ya kijamii pamoja na asasi za kiraia.
mt0: <pad> Political opponents and social media users have strongly criticised these rules for restricting the freedom of social media and civil rights.</s>

en: In 2020, Tanzania released revised EPOCA regulations, issued under Section 103 of the Electronic and Postal Communication Act, 2010, adopted in July 2020, and announced through Government Gazette on Government Notice No. 538.
swa: Mwaka 2020, Tanzania ilitoa marekebisho mapya ya kanuni za maudhui ya mtandaoni, chini ya kifungu cha 103 cha Sheria ya Mawasiliano ya Kieletroniki na Posta, 2020, na kuanza kutumika Julai 2020, na kuzitangaza kupitia Tangazo Na 538 katika Gazeti la Serikali.
mt0: <pad> In 2020, Tanzania published new changes to the rules of online content, under Article 103 of the Electronic Communications and Postage Act, 2020, and began to take effect in July 2020, and were announced through Notification No. 538 in the Government Gazette.</s>

en: There are several main differences between the 2018 and 2020 versions of EPOCA.

mt0: <pad> Some major differences between the 2018 and 2020 edition of the Online Content Rules (EPOCA) are as follows:</s>

en: Firstly, the Tanzania Communications Regulatory Authority (TCRA) recategorized fees with three additional sub-categories under online content: news & current affairs, entertainment and education or religious, furthering imposing restrictions on individual content providers.
swa: Kwanza, Mamlaka ya Mawasiliano Tanzania (TCRA) ilitengeneza upya makundi ya ada na kuongeza makundi madogo chini ya maudhui ya mtandaoni yaani: taarifa & habari, burudani na elimu au dini, na kuendelea kuzuia watu binafsi kutoa maudhui.
mt0: <pad> First, the Tanzania Communications Regulatory Authority (TCRA) re-categorized the charge groups and added smaller categories under internet content that are: news & information, entertainment and education or religion, and continued to ban individuals from providing internet content.</s>

en: Any person who provides network services without obtaining any relevant individual license, commits an offense and shall be liable upon conviction to a fine of not less than 6 million Tanzanian shillings [ $2,587 United States dollars] or imprisonment for a term not less than 12 months or to both.
swa: Mtu yeyote anayetoa huduma za mtandao bila kupata leseni muafaka, anafanya kosa na adhabu yake ni hukumu ya kulipa faini isiyopungua Shilingi za Kitanzania milioni 6 [dola za marekani 2,587] au kifungo cha jela kisichopungua miezi 12 au vyote kwa pamoja.
mt0: <pad> Any person who provides internet services without obtaining the proper license is a criminal offence and the penalty is a fine not less than 6 million Tanganyikan Shillings [US$ 2,587] or a 12-month jail term or both.</s>

en: Secondly, the TCRA expanded a more detailed list of prohibited content including, among other things, content that motivates or promotes phone tapping, espionage, data theft, tracking, recording or intercepting communications or conversation without right.
swa: Pili, TCRA iliongeza orodha ya maudhui yasiyoruhusiwa na kujumuisha, pamoja na mambo mengine, maudhui yanayohamasisha kurekodi simu za watu, kupeleleza mawasiliano, kuiba data, kufuatilia mawasiliano, kurekodi na kuingilia mawasiliano au mazungumzo bila ruhusa.
mt0: <pad> Second, TCRA added the list of prohibited content and included, among other things, content that encourages people to record phone calls, spy on communication, steal data, track communication, record and interfere with communication or conversations without permission.</s>

en: Thirdly, EPOCA 2020 also reduced the amount of time that a license-holder has to respond to prohibited content violations by suspending or terminating an account.
swa: Tatu, Kanuni za Maudhui ya Mtandaoni (EPOCA 2020) pia zimepunguza kipindi ambacho mwenye leseni anaweza kufanyia kazi ukiukwaji wa kanuni za maudhui kwa kusimamishwa au kufutiwa akaunti.
mt0: <pad> Third, the Online Content Rules (EPOCA 2020) have also reduced the time period that the licensee can take action on violations of the content rules by suspending or terminating an account.</s>

en: Global Voices spoke with several legal and human rights experts who have condemned EPOCA 2020 revisions, saying it undermines both digital rights and civil society protections.

mt0: <pad> Global Voices spoke to some legal and human rights experts who criticized the 2020 Content Policy changes, saying they restrict digital rights and civil rights.</s>

en: They argue that these regulations further repress digital rights and deter bloggers and writers from owning their online content.
swa: Walisema kuwa kanuni hizi zinabana haki za kidijitali na kuwazuia wanablogu na waandishi kumiliki maudhui ya mtandaoni.
mt0: <pad> They said that these rules restrict digital rights and prevent bloggers and writers from owning online content.</s>

en: The biggest problem here is that these powers contain no safeguards against abuse, and with the current situation, they certainly have the effect of stifling legitimate freedom of expression in Tanzania, said one human rights professional who asked to remain anonymous.
swa: Tatizo kubwa hapa ni kwamba hakuna tahadhari zimeweka kuzuia mamlaka haya yasitumike vibaya, na kwa hali ilivyo hivi sasa, mamlaka haya yana madhara kwenye uhuru wa kujieleza kwa haki nchini Tanzania, alisema mmoja wa wataalam wa haki za binadamu aliyeomba asifahamike.
mt0: <pad> The main problem here is that there are no warnings set to prevent this power from being abused, and in the current situation, this power has an impact on the right to free expression in Tanzania, said one human rights expert who asked not to be identified.</s>

mt0: <pad> He warned citizens to be careful when they speak on public platforms because the government has legal power to obtain all their information through the owners of those platforms.</s>

en: EPOCA 2020 makes it virtually impossible to remain anonymous online, under Regulation 9(e), coupled with the requirement imposed on the internet café providers to register users via recognized IDs, assign static IP addresses to their computers and put camera surveillance to record the activities in their premises, according to this analysis by the Media Council of Tanzania.
swa: Kanuni za Maudhui ya Mtandaoni za mwaka 2020 zinafanya isiwezekane kabisa mtu kutokufahamika unapokuwa mtandaoni, chini ya Kanuni ya 9(e), watoaji wa huduma ya vyumba vya kuuza mtandao wa inteneti (internet café) wanalazimika kujisajili kwa kutumia vitambulisho vinavyotambulika, kuweka utambulisho pekee wa mtandaoni kwa kila kompyuta (IP address) na kufunga kamera za usalama kurekodi shughuli zote zinazoendelea kwenye maeneo yao ya kazi, kwa mujibu wa uchambuzi huu uliofanywa na Baraza la Habari la Tanzania.
mt0: <pad> The 2020 Internet Content Rules make it almost impossible to be anonymous online, under Article 9(e), internet café service providers are required to register with recognized identities, set a unique internet address for each computer (IP address) and install security cameras to record all activity in their premises, according to this analysis by the Tanzanian News Agency.</s>

en: These regulations reinforce criminal defamation, restrict anonymity, provide hefty punishments for violations and grant sweeping powers of content removal to the TCRA and intermediaries.
swa: Kanuni hizi zinachangia vitendo vya jinai vya kuchafua heshima za watu, kuzuia haki ya kutokufahamika, kutoa adhabu kali kwa kukiukwa kwa kanuni hizi na kukabidhi mamlaka makubwa mno ya kuondoa maudhui kwa TCRA na vyombo vingine vilivyo chini yake.
mt0: <pad> These rules contribute to criminal behaviors of insulting people's honor, prevent the right to privacy, provide harsh punishments for violations of these rules and give TCRA and other agencies under its authority a great deal of power to remove content.</s>

en: EPOCA is incompatible with internationally acceptable digital rights standards.

mt0: <pad> The Online Content Rules (EPOCA) contradict internationally accepted standards for digital property.</s>

en: Overall, these regulations stifle legitimate freedom of expression and press freedom in Tanzania.

mt0: <pad> All in all, these rules restrict the freedom of opinion and press freedom in Tanzania.</s>

en: Yet, the Tanzanian government is obligated to respect and uphold rights to freedom of expression and association of all persons  including members of the media, civil society, and the political opposition, according to Tanzanias constitution as well as international and regional treaties.

mt0: <pad> However, the government of Tanzania is responsible for respecting and protecting the rights of people to express themselves and to gather, including journalists, members of civil society, and opposition politicians, under the constitution of Tanzania and international and regional treaties and agreements.</s>

mt0: <pad> Tanzanians agree with the mystery and gravity of Magufuli's death and the legacy he has left behind while their eyes are closed to look forward.</s>

en: Who has the power to decide what does or doesn't appear on the internet?

mt0: <pad> Who has the power to decide what is visible and what is not visible on the internet?</s>

en: That's the fundamental question posed by activist and writer Jillian C. York in her upcoming book Silicon Values,* set for release on March 23, 2021.
swa: Hili ndilo swali muhimu linaloulizwa na mwanaharakati na mwandishi Jillian C. York kwenye kitabu chake kijacho Silicon Values,* kinachotarajiwa kuzinduliwa mnamo Machi 23, 2021.
mt0: <pad> "What is the Silicon Valley?" is a key question asked by activist and author Jillian C. York in her upcoming book Silicon Values,* which is scheduled to be released on March 23, 2021.</s>

en: On Wednesday, February 10 at 2:00pm GMT, Jillian will join Global Voices executive director Ivan Sigal for a live video conversation about the book, which, as she notes in the preface, seeks to encapsulate the history of how Silicon Valleys major communications platforms created a system apartspecifically, a system that governs how we can express ourselves online.
swa: Mnamo Jumatano, Februari 10 saa 2:00mchana GMT, Jillian ataungana na mkurugenzi mtendaji wa Global Voices Ivan Sigal kwa mazungumzo mubashara ya video kuhusu kitabu chake, ambacho, kama anavyoeleza kwenye dibaji, tunatafuta kuchimbua historia ya namna majukwaa makubwa ya mawasiliano ya Silicon Valley yalivyotengeneza mfumo wake wa kipekeehususani, mfumo ambao unatawala namna tunavyoweza kujieleza mtandaoni.
mt0: <pad> On Thursday, February 10 at 2:00 p.m. GMT, Jillian will join Ivan Sigal, the Executive Director of Global Voices, for a live video conversation about her book, which, as she explains in the introduction, seeks to uncover the history of how the big communication platforms of Silicon Valley have created their uniquely specific system, a system that governs the way we can communicate online.</s>

en: Jillian, who is the Director of International Freedom of Expression at the Electronic Frontier Foundation, is also a long-standing member of Global Voices, where she cut her teeth writing about digital rights and freedom of expression in the context of the Middle East.
swa: Jillian, ambaye ni Mkurugenzi wa Uhuru wa Kujieleza wa Kimataifa katika shirika la Electronic Frontier Foundation, na ni mwanachama maarufu wa siku nyingi wa Global Voices, ambako anapambana kuandika kuhusu uhuru wa kidijitali na uhuru wa kujieleza katika mukhtadha wa Mashariki ya Kati.
