en: The novel coronavirus was first reported in Tanzania in mid-March 2020.
swa: Kirusi cha kwanza cha Korona kiliripotiwa nchini Tanzania katikati ya mwezi Machi, 2020.
mt0: <pad> The first case of the coronavirus was reported in Tanzania in mid-March, 2020.</s>

en: But, after recording up to 509 cases and 21 deaths in late April, the nation announced its status as coronavirus-free in June.
swa: Hata hivyo, baada ya takwimu kuendelea kupanda na kufikia wagonjwa 509 na vifo 21 mwishoni mwa mwezi Aprili, serikali ya Tanzania ilitangaza kuwa hakuna hata mgonjwa mmoja wa UVIKO-19 mwezi Juni.
mt0: <pad> However, after the numbers continued to rise and reach 509 patients and 21 deaths by the end of April, the government of Tanzania announced that there was no single case of COVID-19 in June.</s>

en: That same month, Kassim Majaliwa, the countrys prime minister, told parliament there are only 66 active coronavirus cases in the country, but did not provide further details.
swa: Mwezi huo huo, Kassim Majaliwa, Waziri mkuu wa nchi hiyo, aliliambia bunge kwamba kulikuwa na wagonjwa 66 tu  nchini kote, lakini hakutoa ufafanuzi zaidi.
mt0: <pad> The same month, the Prime Minister of the country, Kassim Majaliwa, told the parliament that there were only 66 patients in the country, but did not provide any more details.</s>

en: Since then, government has been silent on the coronavirus with a strong politic of denial and no data released to the public on infections or deaths.
swa: Tangu wakati huo, serikali imekuwa kimya kuhusiana na virusi vya Korona huku matamko makali ya kisiasa kukanusha uwepo wa virusi hivyo yakiendelea kutolewa bila kuambatana na takwimu zozote za wagonjwa wala vifo.
mt0: <pad> Since then, the government has been silent about the coronavirus virus while strong political statements denying the existence of the virus continue to be issued without any numbers of patients or deaths.</s>

en: Today, most activities continue business-as-usual, including Tanzania's tourism industry, attracting thousands of visitors to its airports with few public health protocols in place.
swa: Leo, shughuli nyingi zinaendelea kama kawaida, ikiwa ni pamoja na sekta ya utalii nchini Tanzania, inayovutia maelfu ya wageni kuingia nchini humo kupitia viwanja vya ndege visivyo na utaratibu wa kufanya ukaguzi wa kutosha.
mt0: <pad> Today, many activities are going on as normal, including the tourist industry in Tanzania, which attracts thousands of foreigners to enter the country through airports without proper check-ups.</s>

en: The airport in Zanzibar received the lowest 2-star rating on COVID-19 health and safety measures by Skytrax COVID-19 Airport Safety Rating, the worlds only assessment and certification of airport health and safety measures during the pandemic.
swa: Uwanja wa ndege Zanzibar ulipata alama ya chini kabisa ya nyota mbili kwenye tathmini ya afya na usalama iliyofanywa na Skytrax Wanaohakiki Hali ya Usalama katika Viwanja vya Ndege dhidi ya UVIKO-19, kipimo pekee cha uhakika kuthibitisha hatua zinazochukuliwa na mamlaka za viwanja vya ndege kuimarisha tahadhari wakati wa mlipuko wa ugonjwa huo.
mt0: <pad> The Zanzibar Airport received the lowest possible two stars in its health and safety review by Skytrax Airport Safety Checkers against COVID-19, the only reliable test to confirm the measures taken by airport authorities to strengthen their alert during the outbreak of the disease.</s>

en: According to their report, new cases of the South African virus variant were confirmed in two travelers flying into Denmark on January 19, from Tanzania.
swa: Kwa mujibu wa repoti hiyo ya Skytrax, wagonjwa wapya wawili walioambukizwa aina mpya ya kirusi cha Afrika Kusini walithibitika kusafiri kuingia Denmaki mnamo Janurari 19, wakitokea Tanzania.
mt0: <pad> According to the Skytrax report, two new South African patients were confirmed to have travelled into Denmark on January 19, from Tanzania.</s>

en: The highly anticipated annual African music festival, Sauti za Busara, will take place in mid-February in Zanzibar, with support from the European Union in Tanzania and several European embassies, despite the risk of highly contagious new coronavirus variants circulating in the United Kingdom, South Africa, and Brazil.
swa: Tamasha kubwa la muziki linalosubiriwa kwa hamu ambalo hufanyika mara moja kwa mwaka, Sauti za Busara, litafanyika katikati ya mwezi Februari visiwani Zanzibar, kwa hisani ya Umoja wa Ulaya nchini Tanzania na baadhi ya balozi za nchi za Ulaya zilizoko nchini Tanzania, wakati huu ambapo nchi inakabiliwa na hatari kubwa ya aina hiyo mpya ya kirusi wa Korona inayosambaa katika nchi za Uingereza, Afrika Kusini, na Brazil.
mt0: <pad> The annual music festival, the Voices of Wisdom, will be held in the middle of February in Zanzibar, with the support of the European Union in Tanzania and some European ambassadors in Tanzania, during this time when the country is facing a great risk of the new coronavirus that has spread in the UK, South Africa and Brazil.</s>

en: On January 24, the Catholic Archdiocese of Arusha issued a letter warning congregants of the existence of COVID-19 in Tanzania, and urged members to follow all necessary public health measures to prevent the spread of the virus in churches.
swa: Mnamo Januari 24, Jimbo Kuu Katoliki la Arusha lilitoa waraka wa maonyo kwa waumini wake dhidi ya uwepo wa UVIKO-19 nchini Tanzania, na kuwaasa waumini wake kufuata tahadhari zote muhimu za afya  ili kujilinda na kusambaa kwa virusi hivyo makanisani.
mt0: <pad> On January 24, the Archdiocese of Arusha issued an alert to its followers about the presence of COVID-19 in Tanzania, and urged its followers to follow all important health warnings to protect themselves from the spread of the viruses in churches.</s>

en: While Tanzanias recorded cases are moderate compared to other countries, the governments silence about COVID-19 data raised grave concerns among public health experts and human rights activists, who are forbidden from speaking or talking about COVID-19 in digital spaces.
swa: Ingawa kumbukumbu zinaonesha kuwa Tanzania ina wangonjwa wachache ukilinganisha na nchi nyingine, ukimya wa serikali kuhusu takwimu za UVIKO-19 umeleta hali ya wasiwasi miongoni mwa wataalam wa afya na wanaharakati wa haki za binadamu, ambao  wamezuiwa kuzungumza na kuongelea UVIKO-19  katika majukwaa ya mitandaoni.
mt0: <pad> Although records show that Tanzania has fewer cases compared to other countries, the government's silence on COVID-19 numbers has raised concern among health experts and human rights activists, who have been barred from speaking and discussing COVID-19 on social media platforms.</s>

en: The country updated its 2018 Electronic and Postal Communications (Online Content) Regulations in July, prohibiting any content with information with regard to the outbreak of a deadly or contagious disease in the country or elsewhere without the approval of the respective authorities.
swa: Nchi hiyo ilifanya marekebisho ya toleo la 2018 la Kanuni za Mawasiliano ya Kieletroniki na Posta (Maudhui ya Mtandaoni mwezi Julai, ikizuia maudhui yenye taarifa zinazohusiana na mlipuko wa ugonjwa hatari au unaoua nchini au kokote pale bila ruhusa ya mamlaka husika.
mt0: <pad> The country amended the 2018 edition of the Electronic Communications and Postal (Online Content) Law in July, prohibiting any content that contains information about a fatal or deadly disease outbreak in the country or elsewhere without the approval of the relevant authorities.</s>

en: Despite initial restrictions to contain the spread of the virus, schools, colleges, offices and other social activities are back to normal.
swa: Ingawa hatua za awali za kudhibiti maambukizi ya virusi zilichukuliwa, hivi sasa shule, vyuo, ofisi, na shughuli nyingine za kijamii zimerudi katika hali ya kawaida.
mt0: <pad> Although initial measures to control the virus were taken, nowadays schools, universities, offices, and other social activities have returned to normal.</s>

en: Even as the virus continues to spread in the region.
swa: Hata hivyo, virusi hivyo vinaendelea kusambaa nchini humo.
mt0: <pad> However, the viruses continue to spread in the country.</s>

en: President John Magufuli had cast doubt on the credibility of laboratory equipment and technicians after secret tests allegedly performed on papaya and a goat gave positive test results.
swa: Rais John Magufuli ameonesha wasiwasi na ubora wa vifaa vya maabara na uaminifu wa watalaam wake baada ya majaribio ya siri kudaiwa kufanyika kwa kutumia mapapai na mbuzi kuleta majibu kuwa vilikuwa na maambukizi ya virusi hivyo.
mt0: <pad> President John Magufuli has expressed concern about the quality of the lab equipment and the credibility of its scientists after secret tests allegedly conducted with pigs and goats showed that they were infected with the viruses.</s>

en: The president said releasing this data was causing unnecessary panic and soon after, fired Nyambura Moremi, director of the national health laboratory, for allegedly botching the testing results.
swa: Rais alisema alisema kutoa takwimu hizi kulikuwa kunaleta tahayaruki isiyo na sababu na muda mfupi baadae, alimfukuza kazi Nyambura Moremi, mkurugenzi wa maabara ya afya ya taifa, kwa madai ya kuchakachua matokeo ya vipimo.
mt0: <pad> The president said that the release of these figures was causing unnecessary panic and shortly afterwards, he sacked Nyambura Moremi, director of the national health laboratory, for allegedly manipulating the results of tests.</s>

en: The ministerial COVID-19 information team was dissolved.
swa: Timu ya kushughulikia UVIKO-19 iliyoundwa na waziri nayo iliishia kuvunjwa.
mt0: <pad> The government's COVID-19 response team that was formed by the minister also ended up being disbanded.</s>

en: In June, Magufuli thanked God for eradicating the virus from Tanzania, following three days of national prayer.
swa: Mwezi June, Magufuli alimshukuru Mungu kwa kumwondoa kirusi huyo  kutoka Tanzania, kufuatia siku tatu za maombi ya kitaifa.
mt0: <pad> In June, Magufuli thanked God for removing the virus from Tanzania, after three days of national prayers.</s>

en: He made this announcement publicly during a Sunday service, amidst a praising congregation, making claims that God had answered their prayers.
swa: Alitoa tangazo hilo hadharani akiwa kwenye ibada ya Jumapili, katikati ya waumini waliokuwa wakimsifu, wakidai kuwa Mungu amejibu maombi yao.
mt0: <pad> He made the announcement publicly at Sunday's service, amongst the worshipers who were praising him, claiming that God had answered their prayers.</s>

en: He also praised congregants for not wearing face masks, despite calls from the World Health Organization to wear masks to prevent the spread of the virus.
swa: Magufuli aliwasifu waumini hao kwa kutokuvaa barakoa, pamoja na wito wa Shirika la Afya Duniani kuwaomba watu wavae barakoa kuzuia kuenea kwa virusi hivyo.
mt0: <pad> Magufuli criticized the faithful for not wearing masks, despite the call by the World Health Organization (WHO) to wear masks to prevent the spread of the viruses.</s>

en: Magufuli, nicknamed the bulldozer for his tough anti-corruption stance, was reelected for a second time in October 2020 during an election that was highly criticized for stifling dissent and opposition.
swa: Magufuli, aliyepewa jina la utani la bulldozer kufuatia msimamo wake mkali dhidi ya vitendo vya ufisadi, alichaguliwa kwa mara ya pili mwezi Oktoba 2020 katika uchaguzi uliokosolewa sana kwa kuwabana wapinzani.
mt0: <pad> Magufuli, who was given the nickname bulldozer after his fierce fight against graft, was re-elected for the second time in October 2020 in a widely criticized election that was heavily criticised for suppressing opponents.</s>

en: Just before the elections, Tanzanians experienced an internet shutdown with access denied to all the major social media platforms including Instagram, WhatsApp and Twitter.
swa: Kabla ya uchaguzi huo, Watanzania walishangazwa na kuzimwa kwa mitandao ambapo majukwaa yote makubwa ya mitandao ya kijamii ikiwa ni pamoja na Instagram, WhatsApp na Twitter yalifungwa yasipatikane.
mt0: <pad> Before the election, Tanzanians were surprised by the internet blackout where all major social media platforms such as Instagram, WhatsApp and Twitter were closed and unreachable.</s>

en: To date, many Tanzanians cannot access Twitter without using a Virtual Private Network (VPN).
swa: Mpaka leo, Watanzania wengi hawawezi kuingia kwenye mtandao wa Twita bila kutumia teknolojia ya kutumia mitandao ya siri yaani VPN.
mt0: <pad> To date, many Tanzanians can't access Twitter without using VPN technology.</s>

en: Over the last five years, the Magufuli administration has narrowed democratic and civic spaces and has cracked down hard on freedom of expression and access to information in digital spaces.
swa: Kwa zaidi ya miaka mitano, utawala wa Magufuli umebana mno uhuru wa demokrasia na shughuli za kiraia sambamba na kuminya uhuru wa kujieleza na haki ya kupata taarifa kwenye majukwaa ya kidijitali.
mt0: <pad> For over five years, the Magufuli regime has significantly restricted the freedom of democracy and civil activities as well as infringing on the right to free expression and access to information on digital platforms.</s>

en: With the governments strong denial stance, Tanzanians are not allowed to release any COVID-19 data that the government has not verified, which means that ordinary citizens as well as journalists and medical professionals are barred from commenting on COVID-19 in digital spaces, or accessing information.
swa: Kufuatia msimamo mkali wa serikali kukana uwepo wa UVIKO-19, Watanzania hawaruhusiwi kutoa takwimu zozote za UVIKO-19 ambazo serikali haijazihakiki, hii ikiwa na maana kwamba wananchi wa kawaida ikiwa ni pamoja na waandishi wa habari na wataalam wa afya wanazuiwa kutoa maoni kuhusu UVIKO-19 kwenye majukwaa ya kidijitali au kupata taarifa muhimu.
mt0: <pad> Following the government's strong position of denying the presence of COVID-19, Tanzanians are not allowed to provide any data on COVID-19 that the government has not verified, meaning that ordinary citizens including journalists and health experts are prohibited from commenting on COVID-19 on digital platforms or accessing important information.</s>

en: Access to COVID-19 information has become an elite privilege, according to one doctor from the national hospital who spoke to Global Voices on the condition of anonymity, fearing reprisal.
swa: Haki ya kupata taarifa za UVIKO-19 imegeuka kuwa upendeleo wa tabaka la watu fulani, kwa mujibu wa daktari mmoja wa hospitali ya taifa aliyeongea na Global Voices kwa masharti ya kutokufahamika, akiogopa kufukuzwa kazi.
mt0: <pad> The right to access information about COVID-19 has turned into bias against some groups, according to a national hospital doctor who spoke to Global Voices on the condition of anonymity, fearing being fired.</s>

en: Unlike other countries with established COVID-19 information response teams who give daily updates on COVID-19, Tanzania simply offers a website with limited and outdated COVID-19 information.
swa: Tofauti na nchi nyingine zenye timu maalum zinazofanyia kazi taarifa za UVIKO-19, Tanzania ina tovuti yenye taarifa chache zilizopitwa na wakati kuhusu UVIKO-19.
mt0: <pad> Unlike other countries with a special team working on COVID-19, Tanzania has a website with few current information about COVID-19.</s>

en: The denial has been so convincing that its now widely accepted by Tanzanians, including medical experts, who disregard basic safety measures like wearing face masks and social distancing.
swa: Matamshi ya kukataa uwepo wa UVIKO-19 yanaonekana kukubalika na Watanzania wengi, ikiwa ni pamoja na wataalam wa afya, wanaopuuza hatua muhimu za kuchukua tahadharani kama kuvaa barakoa na kuepuka misongamano.
mt0: <pad> The statements of denying the existence of COVID-19 seem to be accepted by many Tanzanians, including health experts, who ignore important measures to take precautionary measures such as wearing masks and avoiding crowds.</s>

en: Global Voices visited major hospitals such Muhimbili, the government referral hospital in Dar es Salaam, the cultural capital, as well as Benjamin Mkapa Hospital in Dodoma, the political capital, and witnessed very few measures taken to stop the spread of the coronavirus disease.
swa: Global Voices ilitembelea hospitali kadhaa ikiwemo Muhimbili, hospitali ya rufaa ya serikali iliyoko jijini Dar es Salaam, mji mkuu wa kiutamaduni nchini humo, pamoja na Hospitali ya  Benjamin Mkapa jijini Dodoma, mji mkuu wa kisiasa, na kushuhudia tahadhari chache zikichukuliwa kukabiliana na kuenea kwa virusi vya ugonjwa wa korona.
mt0: <pad> Global Voices visited several hospitals including the government's hospital in Dar es Salaam, the cultural capital of the country, and the Benjamin Mkapa Hospital in Dodoma, the political capital, and saw few measures taken to combat the spread of the coronavirus virus.</s>

en: People are allowed to enter hospital premises without wearing masks, there are few working hygiene and washing facilities and those that do exist lack water or are broken, which was witnessed, for example, in the pregnant mothers clinic at Muhimbili.
swa: Watu wanaruhusiwa kuingia kwenye maeneo ya hospitali bila kuvaa barakoa, kuna vifaa vichache vya usafi na kunawa mikono na vile vilivyopo havina maji au vimevunjika, hali iliyoshuhudiwa, kwa mfano, kwenye wodi ya wanawake wajawazito Muhimbili.
mt0: <pad> People are allowed to enter hospital areas without wearing masks, there are few cleanliness and handwashing supplies and the ones that are available are either broken or missing water, a situation observed, for example, at the maternity unit of the Maternity Hospital of the Women's Hospital of Muhimbili.</s>

en: While the Magufuli administration has shown little concern about the impact of the virus on everyday citizens, many government ministries and departments acknowledge that COVID-19 still exists.
swa: Wakati utawala wa Magufuli haujaonesha kujali madhara ya virusi hivi kwa maisha ya kila siku ya wananchi, mawaziri wengi wa serikali yake na idara zake wanakubali kwamba UVIKO-19 upo.
mt0: <pad> While the Magufuli administration has not shown concern for the impact of these viruses on the daily lives of the people, many ministers of his government and ministries have accepted that COVID-19 exists.</s>

en: Tanzania's minister of finance urges ministry staff to take all precautions against the coronavirus, while also saying COVID-19 is not an issue in Tanzania.
swa: Waziri wa Fedha wa Tanzania awataka wafanyakazi wa Wizara yake kuchukua tahadhari zote kujilinda na virusi vya korona, wakati huo huo akisema Tanzania haisumbuliwi na UVIKO-19.
mt0: <pad> The Tanzanian Finance Minister has ordered his ministry's employees to take all precautions to protect themselves from the coronavirus, at the same time he said Tanzania is not affected by the COVID-19 virus.</s>

en: Screenshot from Mwananchi newspaper.
swa: Picha ya gazeti la Mwananchi.
mt0: <pad> Image from Mwananchi.</s>

en: For example, when Magufuli was sworn in for the second time last year, authorities did practice COVID-19 prevention measures, requiring all attendees to have their temperatures taken and wash their hands at hygiene stations with hand sanitizer provided.
swa: Kwa mfano, Magufuli alipoapishwa kwa mara ya pili mwaka jana, mamlaka za serikali zilichukua tahadhari nyingi dhidi ya UVIKO-19, wakiwalazimisha wahudhuriaji wote kupima joto la mwili na kuosha mikono yao kwenye sehemu maalumu zenye maji na vipupushi.
mt0: <pad> For example, when Magufuli was sworn in for the second time last year, government authorities took many precautions against COVID-19, forcing all attendants to take their temperature and wash their hands in special areas with water and soap.</s>

en: On January 25, Tanzania's Minister of Finance Dr. Philip Mpango urged his staff to take precautions against COVID-19 while at the same denying its existence in Tanzania, during a meeting in Dodoma, the capital.
swa: Mnamo Januari 25, Waziri wa Fedha wa Tanzania, Dk. Philip Mpango  aliwataka watumishi wa wizara yake  kuchukua tahadhari dhidi ya UVIKO-19 na kwa wakati huo huo akikanusha kuwepo kwa ugonjwa huo nchini Tanzania, wakati wa mkutano wake jijini Dodoma, yalipo makao makuu ya kisiasa.
mt0: <pad> On January 25, the Tanzanian Finance Minister, Dr. Philip Mpango ordered his ministry's employees to take precautions against COVID-19 and at the same time denied the presence of the disease in Tanzania, during a meeting in Dodoma, the country's political capital, during his meeting in Dodoma, the country's political headquarters.</s>

en: Most in-country experts are afraid to speak up, fearing retaliation.
swa: Wataalam wengi wa ndani wanaogopa kuzungumza,   kwa hofu ya kuchukuliwa hatua.
mt0: <pad> Many internal experts are afraid to speak, for fear of being disciplined.</s>

en: Global Voices spoke with one medical expert who believed Tanzania may be experiencing a second wave of the outbreak but that this information was kept secret from the public.
swa: Global Voices ilizungumza na mtalaam mmoja wa afya aliyeamini kwamba Tanzania inaweza kuwa inakabiliwa na wimbi la pili ya mlipuko lakini akifikiri wananchi walifichwa taarifa hizi.
mt0: <pad> Global Voices spoke with a health expert who believed that Tanzania may be facing a second wave of the outbreak but thought the public was kept from this information.</s>

en: The expert did not want to be named, fearing reprisal.
swa: Mtaalam huyo hakutaka kutajwa jina, akiogopa kuchukuliwa hatua.

en: African leaders have taken decisive, early actions to curb the spread of COVID-19.

mt0: <pad> African leaders have taken a quick decision to fight COVID-19.</s>

en: In fact, the Africa Centers for Disease Control (ACDC) created its COVID-19 task force on February 5, before the continent had a single case.
swa: Kituo cha Afrika cha Kudhibiti Magonjwa (ACDC) kiliunda kikosi kazi ya UVIKO-19 Februari 5 , kabla ya bara hili halijashuhudia hata mgonjwa mmoja.
mt0: <pad> The African Center for Disease Control (ACDC) established the COVID-19 task force on February 5, before the continent had seen a single case of the disease.</s>

en: Today, Africa is currently the least impacted region in the world, with 1,293,048 confirmed COVID-19 cases so far and a remarkable 1,031,905 recoveries, according to the Africa CDCP.
swa: Leo hii, Afrika ambalo kwa sasa ndilo eneo lililoathirika kidogo sana duniani likiwa na wangonjwa wapato 1,293,048 waliothibitishwa wenye UVIKO-19 na kinachovutia zaidi ni wagonjwa 1,031,905 wakiripoti kupona, kwa mujibu wa Afrika CDCP.
mt0: <pad> Today, Africa which is now the least affected region in the world with 1,293,048 confirmed cases of COVID-19 and the most interesting number of patients reporting recovery, according to the African CDCP.</s>

en: The continent has less than 5 percent of reported cases and less than 1 percent of all deaths.
swa: Bara hili lina chini ya asilimia 5 ya wagonjwa walioripotiwa duniani kote na chini ya asilimia 1 ya vifo vyote vilivyotokea duniani kote.
mt0: <pad> This continent contains less than 5 percent of all the patients reported worldwide and less than 1 percent of all the deaths reported worldwide.</s>

en: Now, as African countries  led by the African Union   ease COVID-19 restrictions and prepare to reopen their economies and borders, many governments are employing innovative technologies.
swa: Sasa, kama nchi za Kiafrika  ikiongozwa na Umoja wa Afrika   wanalegeza vikwazo za COVID-19 na kujiandaa kufungua tena uchumi na mipaka yao, serikali nyingi wanatumia teknolojia bunifu.
mt0: <pad> Now, as African countries led by the UN ease COVID-19 restrictions and prepare to reopen their economies and borders, many governments are using innovative technology.</s>

en: A need for a unified, pan-African technology that can track the spread and connect COVID-19 testing centers across the continent has led to the use of PanaBIOS, an African Union-backed biosurveillance technology.
swa: Utaji wa umoja, wa teknolojia ya Kiafrika inayoweza fuatilia usambaa na kukutanisha vituo ya kupima COVID-19 kote bara umepelekea utumizi wa PanaBIOS, teknolojia wa uangalizi wa kibiolojia unaoungwa mkono na Umoja wa Afrika.
mt0: <pad> The need for a single, African technology that can track the spread and connect test sites for COVID-19 across the continent has led to the use of PanaBIOS, a biological monitoring technology backed by the UN.</s>

en: PanaBIOS provides a mobile and web-based app that uses algorithms to track and trace persons facing potential health threats and track and keep records of test samples from their origin to in-country labs.
swa: PanaBIOS umetoa programu inayotegema rununu na wavuti na kutumia algorithimu kufuata watu walio hatarini kiafya na kuweka rekodi ya vipimo vya sampuli toka asili hadi maabara..
mt0: <pad> PanaBIOS has developed a mobile and web-based application that uses an algorithm to track people at risk of health and record sample tests from the natural world to the lab.</s>

en: The technology was developed by Koldchain, a Kenyan startup, and funded by AfroChampions, a public-private partnership designed to galvanize African resources and institutions to support the emergence and success of the African private sector.
swa: Huu teknolojia umeundwa na Koldchain, taasisi chipukizi ya Kenya, na kufadhiliwa na AfroChampions, ushirikiano wa umma na binafsi uliobuniwa kuleta pamoja rasilimali ya Afrika na taasisi kusaidia ubuzi na mafanikio ya sekta binafsi Afrika.
mt0: <pad> The technology is developed by Koldchain, a startup Kenyan organization, and funded by AfroChampions, a public and private partnership designed to bring together African resources and institutions to support the development and success of the private sector in Africa.</s>

en: Ghana is currently the only African country using PanaBIOS technology as it reopens its borders.
swa: Ghana ndio nchi pekee kwa saa hii inayotumia teknolojia ya PanaBIOS wakati inafungua mipaka yake.
mt0: <pad> Ghana is the only country at the moment that is using PanaBIOS technology when opening its borders.</s>

en: PanaBIOS ensures that travelers are able to use test results from one country to satisfy port clearance requirements in another country through their personal PanaBios app or by adding a system-generated SMS/USSD passcode to another travel document.
swa: PanaBIOS  kuhakikisha wasafiri wanaweza tumia matokeo ya vipimo toka nchi nyingine kuridhisha mahitaji ya idhini ya bandari kwa nchi wanayosafiria kupitia programu-tumizi ya PanaBios au kwa kuongezea nywila unaozalishwa na mfumo kwa hati za usafiri.
mt0: <pad> PanaBIOS ensures that passengers can use the results of tests from other countries to meet the requirements of port approval for the country they are traveling through PanaBios software or by adding the system-generated code to their travel documents.</s>

en: Port health officials use the enterprise version of the app to validate health declarations in a uniform manner across countries.
swa: Maafisa wa afya bandarini wanatumia programu-tumizi toleo la biashara kudhibitisha hati za afya kwa namna sawa kwa nchi zote.
mt0: <pad> Health officials at the port use business version software to verify health documents in the same way for all countries.</s>

mt0: <pad> The African Union and the African CDCP encourage member states to share a mobile-based platform, PanaBIOS, which will allow results from all over the continent to be combined.</s>

swa: Nchi nyingine Afrika, kama Ghana yamebadili sheria kuipa rais mamlaka ya dharura kukabiliana na janga kwa kuamrisha kampuni ya mawasiliano ya simu kuipa maelezo ya kibinafsi ya wateja kama vile hifadhidata ya mteja, kumbukumbu ya simu ya mteja, data ya pesa uliohamishwa kutumia simu na haujatumika, misimbo ya wafanyabiashara wa miamala , na anwani.
mt0: <pad> Other African countries, like Ghana have changed the law to give the president an emergency power to deal with the pandemic by ordering the phone company to provide personal information of customers such as customer data store, customer phone record, transferred money data used and unused, business transaction codes, and addresses.</s>

en: To ensure data protection and privacy, all machine learning techniques used by PanaBIOS are on aggregated data.

mt0: <pad> To ensure data protection and privacy, all machine learning techniques used by PanaBIOS are in the general data.</s>

en: To ensure the prevention of privacy infringement, the African Union, PanaBIOS, and its partners must propose how it will comply with various country-based data protection laws to protect privacy, ensure data consent and avoid data sharing for commercial use.

mt0: <pad> The challenge is how this privacy policy will meet the objectives of different regional, national and regional data protection laws such as the African Union Agreement on Internet Security and Data Protection, South African Development Community (SADC) law on data protection, West African Economic Community (ECOWAS) Law Supplement A/SA.1 / 01/10 on the Protection of Personal Data within ECOWAS and East African Community Web Code of Internet Rules.</s>

en: Since September 22, news reports and social media posts circulating on the Chinese-speaking internet inaccurately claim that World Health Organization (WHO) Chief Scientist, Dr. Soumya Swaminathan, said Chinas COVID-19 vaccines have proved to have an effect.
swa: Tokea Septemba 22, taarifa za habari na machapisho ya mtandao ya kijamii inayoenea katika mitandao ya Kichina ilinukuu sivyo kuwa mwanasayansi mkuu wa Shirika la Afya Duniani (SAD), Dkt. Soumya Swaminathan, alisema chanjo za Uchina dhidi ya COVID-19 zimethibitishwa kuwa na athari.
mt0: <pad> On September 22, Chinese news reports and social media posts on the Chinese internet reported incorrectly that the head of World Health Organization (WHO), Dr. Soumya Swaminathan, said China's vaccines against COVID-19 have been verified to be effective.</s>

en: These reports and posts cite as a source a one-minute video produced by China Central Television for the Chinese video-sharing app Miaopai.
swa: Hizi ripoti na machapisho zinanukuu chanzo  video ya dakika inayotayarishwa na televisheni ya China kwa programu-tumizi ya kushiriki video China Miaopai.
mt0: <pad> These reports and publications quote a source video of one minute produced by Chinese television for the China Miaopai video-sharing application.</s>

en: The video shows a speech by WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on the importance of the development of a COVID-19 vaccine, followed by remarks by Dr. Swaminathan.

mt0: <pad> The video shows the speech of the Director General of the World Health Organization Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on the importance of expanding the COVID-19 vaccine, followed by the comments of Dr. Swaminathan.</s>

en: In the CCTV video, whose captions say WHO chief scientist: Chinese COVID-19 vaccines have proved to have an effect (), this is Swaminathan's speech:

mt0: <pad> In the video of CCTV, which has a short description that WHO's senior scientist: China's COVID-19 vaccines have been verified to be effective (), this is Swaminathan's statement.</s>

en: As you know, they also have a very active vaccine development programme and several of their vaccine candidates are in advanced stages of clinical trial, so this is also of interest to us, so we're following those very closely.
swa: Kama mnavyofahamu,pia wanayo programu amilifu ya kukuza chanjo na baadhi ya chanjo yako hatua mbele katika majaribio ya kliniki, huu pia ni maslahi kwetu, tunaifuatilia kwa karibu.
mt0: <pad> As you know,they also have an active vaccine promotion program and some vaccines are a step ahead in clinical trials, this is also of interest to us, we are closely monitoring it.</s>

en: Some of their candidates actually prove to be successful in the clinical trials that are going on.
swa: Wengineo wa washirika wamethibitisha kufaidika kutokana na majaribio la kliniki yanayoendelea..
mt0: <pad> Other sponsors have confirmed they are benefiting from the ongoing clinical trials.</s>

en: However, Dr. Swaminathan's original speech has been edited.

en: Her last sentence, in reality, began with the word if, and the video's background music makes it sound as if she's saying proved instead of prove.

mt0: <pad> His last sentence, of course, began with the word if, and the background music made it seem like or that he said he confirmed instead of confirm.</s>

en: Dr. Swaminathan's complete remarks are the following:
swa: Matamshi ya Dkt.Swaminathan kamili ni haya yafuatayo :
mt0: <pad> The full statement of Dr. Swaminathan is as follows:</s>

en: We've been engaged in discussions with China for the last several months because, as you know, they also have a very active vaccine development programme and several of their vaccine candidates are in advanced stages of clinical trial so this is also of interest to us so we're following those very closely.
swa: Tumehusika na mjadala na Uchina kwa miezi mingi iliyopita kwa sababu,mnavyojua, hao pia wanao programu amilifu ya kukuza chanjo na na chanjo zao mingi ziko hatua mbele ya majaribio ya kliniki, huu ni maslahi kwetu,kwa hivyo tunafuatilia kwa karibu.
mt0: <pad> We've been in discussion with China for many months because,as you know, they also have an active program to develop vaccines and their vaccines are in a lot of stages before clinical trials, this is of interest to us, so we're closely monitoring.</s>

en: We've had very constructive and open discussions with them and they have always been reiterating their commitment to global access if some of their candidates actually prove to be successful in the clinical trials that are going on [emphasis added].
swa: Tumekuwa na mjadala wa kujenga na wazi nao na kila mara wamesisitiza kujitolea kwao kwa ufikavu kote duniani  ikiwa baadhi ya chanjo zao zimepita majaribio ya kliniki yanayoendelea [msisitizo umeongezwa].
mt0: <pad> We have had a constructive and open discussion with them and they have always stressed their commitment to easing famine around the world if some of their vaccines have passed clinical trials that are still ongoing [emphasis added].</s>

en: So I think the conversations are going on, it's still open and we're hopeful that more countries are going to join.
swa: Kwa hivyo nafikiria mazungumuzo yanayoendelea, bado ni wazi na tunatumania nchi mingi watajuinga.
mt0: <pad> So I think the talks are still ongoing, it's still open and we hope many countries will support us.</s>

en: The conference aimed to present updates on the 18-billion-USD initiative by WHO and other organizations to deploy a future COVID-19 vaccine around the world.

mt0: <pad> The conference was expected to present an update on the 18 billion-dollar plan by the WHO and other agencies to deliver a COVID-19 vaccine to the world in the future.</s>

en: So far, 156 countries have signed up for the program; neither China nor the U.S. is among them.

mt0: <pad> To date, 156 countries have registered in this plan; neither China nor the United States are among them.</s>

en: Hundreds of Angolans took to the streets on September 12 in Luanda, Benguela, and in cities in 15 other provinces against police violence.
swa: Mamia ya Waangola waliingia mitaani kuandamana hapo Septemba 12 huko Luanda, Benguela na miji mingine 15 wakipinga ukatili wa polisi.
mt0: <pad> Thousands of Angolans went to the streets on September 12 in Luanda, Benguela and 15 other cities to protest police brutality.</s>

en: The demonstrations took place following the shock from the news that Silvio Dala, a 35-year-old doctor, lost his life on September 1 while in police custody.
swa: Maandamano hayo yalianza baada ya habari za kushtusha kutolewa kuhusu kifo cha daktari Silvio Dala, mwenye miaka 35, aliyepoteza maisha Septemba 1 akiwa chini ya uangalizi wa polisi.
mt0: <pad> The protests started after news broke of the death of Dr. Silvio Dala, 35, who died on September 1 under police watch.</s>

en: According to the authorities, Dala left by car from the David Bernardino Paediatric Hospital in Luanda, where he worked as clinical director when he was stopped by police officers for not wearing a mask.
swa: Kulingana na taarifa za mamlaka, Dala aliondoka kwa gari yake kutoka hospitali ya  Watoto ya David Bernardino huko Luanda, ambapo ndiko hufanya kazi kama Mkurugenzi wa kliniki na alisimamishwa na polisi kwa sababu hakuvaa barakoa.
mt0: <pad> According to reports from the authorities, Dala left his car from the David Bernardino Children's Hospital in Luanda, where he works as the director of the clinic, and was stopped by police because he did not wear a mask.</s>

en: The doctor was then taken to the Catotes police station, in the capital's Rocha Pinto neighbourhood, when he showed signs of fatigue and began to faint, having had a bad fall, which caused minor injuries to the head, the official police statement said.
swa: Daktari huyo alipelekwa katika kituo cha polisi cha Catotes katika mji jirani wa Rocha Pinto, na alipoonesha dalili za kuishiwa nguvu na kuanza kuzimia, alianguka vibaya na kugonga kichwa na kusababisha jeraha dogo kichwani mwake ilisema taarifa rasmi ya polisi.
mt0: <pad> The doctor was taken to the police station of Catotes in the nearby town of Rocha Pinto, and when he showed signs of fainting and becoming unconscious, he fell badly and hit his head and caused a minor head injury, a police official said.</s>

en: It also states that Dala died while officers were taking him to hospital.
swa: Pia ilisema kwamba Dala alifariki wakati maofisa wa polisi wakimpeleka hospitali.
mt0: <pad> It also said that Dala died while police officers were transporting him to the hospital.</s>

en: The Union of Doctors contests this version.
swa: Chama cha Madaktari kiliipinga taarifa hiyo.
mt0: <pad> The Doctors' Association rejected the report.</s>

en: The organizations president, Adriano Manuel, told Voice of America (VOA) that there are contradictions in the authorities explanations which suggest that the doctor was subjected to physical abuse.
swa: Raisi wa chama hicho Adriano Manuel, aliiambia  Sauti ya Amerika (VOA) kwamba kuna utata katika maelezo ya mamlaka ambapo inaonesha kwamba daktari alisulubiwa.
mt0: <pad> The president of the group, Adriano Manuel, told the Voice of America (VOA) that there is confusion in the official statements showing that the doctor was crucified.</s>

en: Manuel told Deutsche Welle (DW) that the cause of death described by the police is not the real one.
swa: Manuel aliiambia  Sauti ya Ujerumani (DW) kwamba  chanzo cha kifo kilichoelezwa na polisi sio halisi.
mt0: <pad> Manuel told the German Voice (DW) that the official cause of death reported by the police was not true.</s>

en: Anyone who is a doctor and has studied medicine knows that this is not what killed Silvio.
swa: Mtu yeyote ambaye ni daktari na amesomea udaktari atajua kuwa hiki sicho kilichomuua Silvio.
mt0: <pad> Any doctor who has studied medicine will know that this is not what killed Silvio.</s>

en: According to DW, a source from the Ministry of the Interior said that the autopsy, carried out in the presence of the family and a prosecutor, concluded that the doctor was not the victim of an assault.
swa: Kulingana na DW, chanzo cha habari kutoka wizara ya mambo ya ndani kinasema kuwa uchunguzi ulifanyika mbele ya familia na mwendesha mashtaka na ikathibitika kwamba daktari hakuwa mhanga wa kipigo.
mt0: <pad> According to DW, a source of information from the ministry of interior says that an investigation was conducted in front of the family and prosecutor and it was proven that the doctor was not the victim of a beating.</s>

en: The union said it will take legal action against the police.
swa: Chama kimesema kuwa kitalichukulia jeshi la polisi hatua za kisheria.
mt0: <pad> The party said it will take legal action against the police.</s>

en: Meanwhile, the Angolan government announced the creation of a commission with the Ministry of Health to investigate the incident.
swa: Wakati huo huo serikali ya Angola imeunda tume itakayoshirikiana na Wizara ya Afya kufanya uchunguzi wa tukio hilo.
mt0: <pad> Angola's government has also formed a commission to work with the Health Ministry to investigate the incident.</s>

en: The protesters also did not believe the police's version of Dala's death.
swa: Waandanaji hawaiamini taarifa ya polisi kuhusu kifo cha Dala.
mt0: <pad> Protesters do not trust the police report about Dala's death.</s>

en: Signs used at the protests in Luanda, in different parts of the city, said: No more killings, You are paid to protect, you are not paid to kill, I am Silvio Dala, They killed Silvio Dala.
swa: Mabango yaliyotumiwa na waandamanaji katika maeneo mbalimbali ya mji wa Luanda yalisema: Kusiwepo tena Mauaji, Mnalipwa kutulinda, hamlipwi kutuua, Mimi ni Silvio Dala, Wamemuua Silvio Dala.
mt0: <pad> The posters used by the protesters in different parts of Luanda said: No more killings, You are paid to protect us, you are not paid to kill us, I am Silvio Dala, They have killed Silvio Dala.</s>

en: There were also calls for the Minister of the Interior Eugénio Laborinho to resign.
swa: Pia kuna waliomtaka waziri wa Mambo ya Ndani Eugénio Laborinho ajiuzulu.
mt0: <pad> There were also some who wanted the Interior Minister Eugénio Laborinho to resign.</s>

en: The demonstrations were organized by the Union of Doctors and by various civil society collectives and organizations.
swa: Maandamano yaliaandaliwa na Chama cha Madaktari wakishirikiana na mashirika na Taasisi za kiraia.
mt0: <pad> The protests were organized by the Doctors' Union in collaboration with other organizations and civil society organizations.</s>

en: Iconic Ethiopian singer Hachalu Hundessa gained prominence for using his creative talent to raise the consciousness of the Oromo people.
swa: Mwanamuziki mkubwa wa Kiethopia Hachalu Hundessa alipata umaarufu kwa kutumia ubunifu na kipaji chake kuutambulisha umma kuhusu watu wa Oromo.
mt0: <pad> The great Ethiopian musician Hachalu Hundessa gained fame for using his creativity and talent to introduce the public to the Oromo people.</s>

en: He was assassinated in a suburb of Ethiopias capital, Addis Ababa, on June 29.
swa: Aliuawa katika viunga vya mji mkuu wa Ethiopia, Addis Ababa, tarehe 29 Juni mwaka huu.
mt0: <pad> He was killed in the suburbs of the capital of Ethiopia, Addis Ababa, on June 29, this year.</s>

en: That night, at 9:30 pm, as Hachalu was exiting his vehicle, a man named Tilahun Yami allegedly walked up to his car and fired a gun into the artists chest.
swa: Usiku ule mnamo saa tatu na nusu, wakati Hachalu akishuka kwenye gari lake, mwanaume aliyejulikana kwa jina la Tilahun Yami alitembea kuelekea gari yake na kumpiga risasi  kifuani mwake.
mt0: <pad> The night of the shooting, at 3:30 pm, when Hachalu was leaving his car, a man known as Tilahun Yami walked towards his car and shot him in the chest.</s>

en: He was rushed to the nearest hospital, where he was officially declared dead.
swa: Alikimbizwa katika hospitali ya karibu ambapo ilithibitishwa rasmi kwamba amefariki.
mt0: <pad> He was rushed to a local hospital where it was officially confirmed that he had died.</s>

en: It was later determined that the bullet severely damaged his internal organs.
swa: Iligundulika baadaye kwamba risasi iliharibu vibaya sana viungo vyake vya ndani.
mt0: <pad> It was later discovered that the bullet had severely damaged his internal organs.</s>

en: Addis Ababas police chief reported two suspects were arrested.
swa: Mkuu wa polisi wa Addis Ababa  aliripoti kwamba watuhumiwa wawili wamekamatwa.
mt0: <pad> The Addis Ababa police chief said that two suspects were arrested.</s>

en: After a few days, government authorities charged an alleged assassin along with two other accomplices.
swa: Baada ya siku chache mamlaka za serikali ziliwahukumu wauaji hao pamoja na washirika wao wawili.
mt0: <pad> After a few days the government authorities convicted the murderers and their two companions.</s>

en: In the wake of his murder, the country has struggled to come to terms with the violence that followed.
swa: Katika kuuawa kwake, nchi imeingia katika wakati mgumu wa kutuliza ghasia zilizofuata.
mt0: <pad> In his death, the country has entered a difficult time of trying to contain the violence that followed.</s>

en: The truth of Hachalu's assassination is not yet fully clear, and in its aftermath, speculation began to fly as politicians and activists stoked long-standing tensions between Oromo and Amahara elites, two of Ethiopia's largest ethnic groups.
swa: Ukweli ni kwamba mauaji ya Hachalu hayajawekwa wazi vizuri na pia matokeo yake, uvumi ulianza kuenea baada ya wanasiasa na wanaharakati  kuweka msisitizo mkubwa kuhusu mgogoro uliopo baina ya viongozi wakuu wa Oromo na Amahara ambayo ni makabila makubwa kabisa nchini Ethiopia.
mt0: <pad> The truth is that the Hachalu massacre has not been well documented and its consequences, rumors began to spread after politicians and activists put great emphasis on the conflict between the leaders of the Oromo and Amahara which are the two biggest tribes in Ethiopia.</s>

en: That day, mourners flooded the streets of Addis Ababa and cities and towns across Oromia state.
swa: Siku ya maziko yake, waombolezaji walifurika katika mitaa ya Addis Ababa na miji mingine inayozunguka jimbo la Oromo.
mt0: <pad> On the day of his funeral, mourners filled the streets of Addis Ababa and other cities around the Oromo region.</s>

en: The next morning, Oromia Media Network (OMN), a satellite TV station on which Hachalu had his last contentious interview, provided online and TV coverage as his casket was transferred from Addis Ababa to Hachalus hometown, Ambo.
swa: Asubuhi iliyofuata Kituo cha runinga ya setilaiti cha Oromia Media Network (OMN), ambapo ndipo Hachalu alifanya mahojiano yake ya mwisho walirusha matangazo mubashara kupitia runinga na pia mitandao na kuonesha wakati jeneza lake likisafirishwa kutoka Addis Ababa kwenda nyumbani kwao huko mjini Ambo.
mt0: <pad> The next morning the Oromia Media Network (OMN), where Hachalu made his last interview, aired live on television and online and showed the moment his coffin was transported from Addis Ababa to his hometown of Ambo.</s>

en: The slow, televised journey turned into a deadly battle between government authorities and opposition politicians over where Hachalu would be buried, and OMN interrupted its coverage as the hearse was forced to return to Addis Ababa.
swa: Matangazo hayo yaliyokwenda polepole sana yaligeuka kuwa uwanja wa mapambano baina ya mamlaka za serikali na viongozi wa upinzani, kukiwa na mabishano ya wapi hasa akazikwe Hachalu  na OMN ilibidi wakatize matangazo yake; inasemekana walilazimishwa kurejea Addis Ababa.
mt0: <pad> The very slow broadcasts became a battleground between the government and the opposition leaders, with arguments over where Hachalu was buried and OMN had to suspend its broadcasts; it is said that they were forced to return to Addis Ababa.</s>

en: At least ten people were killed and several were injured in Addis Ababa.
swa: Watu kumi waliuawa na wengine kadhaa kujeruhiwa huko Addis Ababa.
mt0: <pad> 10 people were killed and several injured in Addis Ababa.</s>

en: The scuffle led to the arrest of several opposition politicians including Jawar Mohammed, an OMN figurehead, and opposition politician Bekele Gerba, who were both charged with instigating the mayhem.
swa: Mgongano huo ulipelekea kukamatwa kwa baadhi ya viongozi wa upinzani akiwepo Jawar Mohammed ambaye ni kiongozi wa  OMN  na pia kiongozi wa upinzani Bekele Gerba ambapo walishtakiwa kwa kuchochea vurugu.
mt0: <pad> The clashes led to the arrest of some opposition leaders including Jawar Mohammed, leader of OMN and the opposition leader Bekele Gerba, who were accused of inciting violence.</s>

en: Confusion swirled after government authorities eventually took Halachu's body back to Ambo by helicopter, where feuding parties continued to clash, denying the bereaved family members a proper burial.
swa: Utata uliibuka zaidi baada ya mamlaka za serikali kuuchukua tena mwili wa Hachalu na kuupeleka mjini kwao Ambo kwa njia ya helkopta, ambapo pia pande mbili ziliendelea kugombana na kuinyima familia ya marehemu fursa ya kumpa ndugu yao maziko stahiki.
mt0: <pad> The dispute intensified after the government took Hachalu's body back to his hometown of Ambo by helicopter, where the two sides continued to fight and deny the family of the dead the chance to give their brother a proper burial.</s>

en: Meanwhile, turmoil and violence ensued.
swa: Baada ya hapo vurugu na mapigano yalifuata.
mt0: <pad> After that, violence and fights followed.</s>

en: A three-day rampage gripped parts of Oromia and Addis Ababa, at a substantial cost: 239 people were left dead; hundreds of others were injured and more than 7,000 people were arrested for violence and property damage worth millions of Ethiopian birr.
swa: Mapigano hayo yalichukua siku tatu yaliyararua baadhi ya maeneo ya miji ya Oromo na Addis Ababa na uharibifu halisi ni: vifo vya watu 239  na mamia wamejeruhiwa, zaidi ya watu 7,000 wamekamatwa kwa kusababisha vurugu na uharibifu wa mali  zenye thamani ya mamilioni ya birr, fedha ya Kiethopia.
mt0: <pad> The fighting lasted for three days and affected some areas of the cities of Oromo and Addis Ababa and the real damage was: 239 people died and hundreds were injured, over 7,000 people were arrested for inciting violence and destroyed property worth billions of birr, the Ethiopian currency.</s>

en: On June 30, the government imposed an internet shutdown to attempt to halt calls for violence circulating on social media that lasted three weeks.
swa: Hapo Juni 30, serikali ilijaribu kuzima mtandao ili kuzuia kuenea kwa uhamasishaji wa kufanya vurugu unaofanyika katika mitandao ya kijamii na kudumu kwa wiki tatu.
mt0: <pad> On June 30, the government tried to shut down the internet to prevent the spread of violent incitement on social media and lasted for three weeks.</s>

en: A number of people were shot and killed by government security forces, but several news outlets including Voice of America and Addis Standard reported that angry mobs from the Oromo ethnic group attacked multiethnic, interfaith towns and cities in southeastern Oromia, targeting non-Oromo, non-Muslim families in the region.
swa: Watu kadhaa walipigwa risasi na mamlaka za usalama lakini baadhi ya vyanzo vya habari ikiwamo Sauti ya Amerika na Addis Standard viliripoti kuwa vikundi vya watu wenye hasira kutoka kabila la Oromo walishambulia watu wa makundi mbalimbali ikiwepo miji na mitaa inayokaliwa na watu wa imani tofauti tofauti, iliyo Kusini Mashariki mwa mji wa Oromo, wakilenga hasa familia za watu wasio Waoromo na wasio Waislam katika ukanda huo.
mt0: <pad> Several people were shot by security authorities but some media sources including the American Voice and Addis Standard reported that groups of angry Oromo people attacked different groups including towns and neighborhoods which are mixed-faith, southeast of the city of Oromo, targeting particularly families of non-Oromo and non-Islam people in the region.</s>

en: Most of the violence fell along ethnic Amahara-Oromo lines, but religion may have played a more central role due to an intricate, localized understanding of ethnicity: The southeast Oromo communitys ethnic identity markers usually combine the religion of Islam and the Afan-Oromo language.
swa: Vurugu zaidi zilikuwa katika ukanda wenye mchanganyiko wa watu wa Amahara-Oromo na dini inaweza ikawa imecheza nafasi kubwa kwa sababu ya uelewa uliopo kwamba: jamii ya Waoromo wa Kusini Mashariki inatambulishwa kwa mchangayiko wa dini ya Kiislamu na watumiaji wa lugha ya Afan-Oromo.
mt0: <pad> The most violence was in the Amahara-Oromo area and religion may have played a large role because of the knowledge that: the South East Oromo community is identified by a mixture of Islam and the Afan-Oromo language.</s>

en: A local farmer reportedly said we thought Hachalu was Oromo after he watched Hachalu's televised funeral rites that followed the traditions of the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church.
swa: Mkulima mmoja wa maeneo hayo alisema kwamba tulifikiri Hachalu ni Muoromo baada ya kuangalia matangazo yaliyorushwa moja kwa moja yakionesha shughuli za maziko ya Hachalu yaliyofuata desturi za Kanisa la Kiothodoksi la Tewahedo Ethiopia.
mt0: <pad> One farmer in the area said that we thought Hachalu was Muoromo after watching live streaming of Hachalu's funeral following the customs of the Orthodox Tewahedo Church of Ethiopia.</s>

en: According to reports, most victims of the most gruesome violence were minority Christian Amharas, Christian Oromos and Gurage people.
swa: Kulingana na ripoti, wahanga wengi wa vurugu hizo walikuwa ni Wakristo wa ki-Amhara, Wakristo wa ki-Oromo na watu wa Gurage.
mt0: <pad> According to the reports, most of the victims of the violence were Amhara Christians, Oromo Christians and Gurage people.</s>

en: Eyewitnesses say mobs destroyed and burned property, committed lynching and beheadings and dismembered victims.
swa: Shuhuda mmoja alisema kuwa makundi hayo yaliharibu na kuchoma moto mali na kufanya mauaji  kwa kuwakata vichwa na miguu wahanga.
mt0: <pad> One witness said that the gangs destroyed and burned property and committed murder by cutting off the head and legs of victims.</s>

en: A fateful interview
swa: Utabiri wa Mahojiano
mt0: <pad> The prediction of the interview</s>

en: When news of Hachalus assassination first hit, Oromo diaspora media outlets zeroed in on Hachalus fateful interview with OMN host Guyo Wariyo, that aired the week before Halachu was killed.
swa: Wakati taarifa kuhusu mauaji ya Hachalu ziliposikika tu, chanzo cha habari za Waoromo wa diaspora zilihusisha kifo chake na  mahojiano ya mwisho aliyoyafanya Hachalu na kituo cha runinga cha OMN yakiongozwa na Guyo Wariyo, na yalirushwa wiki moja kabla Hachalu hajauawa.
mt0: <pad> When the news of Hachalu's murder was just announced, the source of Oromo news in the diaspora linked his death to the last interview Hachalu had with OMN television station led by Guyo Wariyo, and aired a week before Hachalu was killed.</s>

en: During the interview, Guyo repeatedly asked Hachalu provocative questions about his alleged sympathy for the ruling party, interrupting him multiple times to challenge his answers.
swa: Wakati wa mahojiano Gayo alirudia rudia kumuuliza Hachalu maswali ya mtego kuhusu yeye kukiunga mkono chama tawala na pia mara kwa mara alimkatiza alipokuwa akijibu.
mt0: <pad> During the interview Gayo repeatedly asked Hachalu tricky questions about his support for the ruling party and he often cut him off when he was answering.</s>

en: Hachalu fiercely denied any sympathies with the ruling party, but also decried the deeply discordant and fractionalized Oromo political parties, demonstrating his staunch independence as a thinker and musician  a quality that made him a target for online abuse until the day of his murder.
swa: Hachalu alikataa kuunga chama tawala mkono lakini pia alikosoa  migogoro na utengano katika vyama vya siasa vya Oromo, akionesha uhuru wa mawazo kama mwanamuziki  hali ambayo ilimfanya kuwa mlengwa wa mashambulizi ya watu mtandaoni mpaka siku aliyouawa.
mt0: <pad> Hachalu refused to support the ruling party but also criticized conflicts and divisions within the Oromo political parties, showing his free opinion as a musician which made him the target of online attacks until the day of his death.</s>

en: At one point, however, Guyo asked Hachalu about the historical injustices allegedly committed against the Oromo people by Menelik II, Ethiopias 19th-century emperor who shaped modern Ethiopia.
swa: Hata hivyo, Guyo alimuuliza Hachalu kuhusu unyanyasaji wa kihistoria uliofanywa kwa watu wa Oromo na mfalme Menelik II aliyeijenga Ethiopia ya sasa.
mt0: <pad> However, Guyo asked Hachalu about the historic oppression of the Oromo people by King Menelik II who created the current Ethiopia.</s>

en: Hachalu shocked some listeners when he answered that the horse seen immortalized in Meneliks equestrian statue in Addis Ababa belongs to an Oromo farmer called Sida Debelle, and that Menelik robbed that horse.
swa: Hachalu aliwashangaza wasikilizaji wengi aliposema kuwa farasi aliyepandwa na Menelik katika sanamu iliyopo huko Addis Ababa alikuwa mali ya mkulima wa ki-Oromo aliyeitwa Sida Debelle, na Menelik alimuiba farasi huyo.
mt0: <pad> Hachalu surprised many listeners when he said that the horse planted by Menelik in his statue in Addis Ababa was the property of an Oromo farmer named Sida Debelle, and Menelik stole the horse from him.</s>

en: This exchange attracted applause  and criticism  from commentators on Facebook and Twitter.
swa: Majibu hayo yalivutia maoni ya kumsifia  na pia ya kumkosoa kutoka kwa watu mbalimbali huko Facebook na Twitter.
mt0: <pad> The response attracted both praise and criticism from people on Facebook and Twitter.</s>

en: When Hachalu was killed one week later, many members of the Oromo diaspora community immediately speculated that Hachalus criticism of the Menelik II statue infuriated sympathizers of imperial Ethiopia, which may have led to his murder.
swa: Wakati Hachalu alikiuawa wiki moja baadaye watu wengi wa jamii ya Oromo wanaokaa nje ya nchi walihisi kwamba kitendo cha Hachalu kuikosoa sanamu ya Menelik II kiliwakasirisha wanaoiunga mkono Ethiopia ya kifalme na kusababisha kuuawa kwake.
mt0: <pad> When Hachalu was killed a week later many people of the Oromo community living abroad felt that Hachalu's criticism of Menelik II's statue angered supporters of the monarchical Ethiopia and led to his death.</s>

en: On social media, Oromo netizens focused obsessively on Hachalus Menelik-related remarks, which led many down a winding path to an insidious disinformation campaign.
swa: Katika mitandao ya kijamii wananchi waling'ang'ana na kile Hachalu alichokisema dhidi ya Menelik, na hili lilisababisha kuenea kwa uvumi wenye taarifa nyingi za uongo.
mt0: <pad> On social media people were busy arguing about what Hachalu said about Menelik, and this caused the spread of rumors with many lies.</s>

en: The rest of the interview contains other loaded issues of divisions and contradictions within the Oromo community.
swa: Sehemu nyingine ya mahojiano imebeba taarifa za mambo yanayohusu utengano na migogoro ndani ya jamii ya Waoromo.
mt0: <pad> The other part of the interview covered issues about divisions and conflicts within the Oromo community.</s>

en: Throughout the interview, Guyo grilled Hachalu about the countrys ongoing political reforms, stoking anti-government sentiment with questions about Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed, himself an Oromo, and whether or not the government had met the demands of the Oromo people after the prime minister came to power in 2018.
swa: Katika mahojiano yote Guyo alimchimba sana Hachalu kuhusu mabadiliko ya kisiasa yanayoendelea nchini na kuhusu vuguvugu la kuipinga serikali kwa kuuliza swali kuhusu Waziri Mkuu Abiy Ahmed, ambaye ni Muoromo na kwamba kama serikali imeweza kutimiza matakwa ya watu wa Oromo tangu aingie madarakani mwaka 2018.
mt0: <pad> In all the interview Guyo drilled Hachalu hard about the political changes in the country and the protest movement by asking questions about PM Abiy Ahmed, who is an Oromo, and whether the government has met the demands of the people of the Oromo since he came to power in 2018.</s>

en: Hachalu reiterated his non-involvement in the rabid partisanship of Oromo politics but he did criticize those who question Abiys Oromo identity.
swa: Hachalu alirudia kusema kuwa hajihusishi na siasa za ovyo za Oromo lakini aliwakosoa wote wanaohukumu uzalendo wa Abiy.
mt0: <pad> Hachalu reiterated that he was not involved in the dirty politics of the Oromo but criticized all those who denounce Abiy's patriotism.</s>

en: He defended his position against top Oromo opposition leaders who sought an alliance with the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), a once-dominant party with historic ties to the now-defunct Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Front (the EPRDF).
swa: Aliilinda nafasi yake dhidi ya viongozi wakuu wa upinzani walioungana na Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), ambacho kilishawahi kuwa na ukaribu na  chama kikuu chenye historia kubwa cha Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Front (the EPRDF).
mt0: <pad> He secured his position against the main opposition leaders who joined the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), which had been closely linked to the long-standing Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Front (EPRDF).</s>

en: The TPLF turned into an opposition party after Abiy dismantled the EPRDF.
swa: TPLF iligeuka kuwa chama cha upinzani baada ya Abiy kuibomoa EPRDF.
mt0: <pad> TPLF became a political party after Abiy dismantled the EPRDF.</s>

en: Hachalu also addressed the political violence in the Oromia region, blaming both government authorities and the militant, splinter right-wing Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) militia group (informally known as OLF-Shane).
swa: Hachalu pia alizungumza kuhusu vurugu za kisiasa zinazoendelea katika mkoa wa Oromo akilaumu pande zote yaani mamlaka za serikali na wanamgambo wa kikundi cha wanamgambo wa mrengo wa kulia Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) ambapo pia (hufahamika kama OLF-Shane).
mt0: <pad> Hachalu also spoke about the political violence that is taking place in the Oromo region, blaming both sides, the government and the right-wing militia group the Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) which is also known as OLF-Shane.</s>

en: Following Hachalus murder, the government was able to acquire and release the full 71-minute interview to the public.
swa: Kufuatia mauaji ya Hachalu, serikali iliweza kuchukua mkanda wa mahojiano yenye urefu wa dakika 71 na  kuyarusha kwa umma.
mt0: <pad> After Hachalu's murder, the government was able to take a 71-minute interview and air it for the public.</s>

en: The missing tape included Hachalus accounts of death threats he received from parts of western Oromia, where the radical OLF-Shane militia is active.
swa: Mkanda huo unajumuisha ujumbe wa vitisho vya kuuawa alivyotumiwa Hachalu kutoka pande za Magharibi mwa Oromo, ambapo ndipo vikosi vya wanamgambo wa OLF-Shane wanafanyia shughuli zao.
mt0: <pad> The tape includes a death threat sent to Hachalu by the OLF-Shane militias in western Oromo, where they conduct their operations.</s>

en: Hachalu said he believed he would not have been attacked on social media if he had praised OLF-Shane.
swa: Hachalu alisema aliamini kuwa asingeshambuliwa mitandaoni kama angewasifia OLF-Shane.
mt0: <pad> Hachalu said he believed he would not be attacked online if he had criticized OLF-Shane.</s>

en: He addressed a direct conflict he had with Getachew Assefa, Ethiopias security and intelligence chief during the TPLF period.
swa: Alizungumzia moja kwa moja mgogoro baina yake na Getachew Assefa, Afisa Usalama Mkuu wa Ethiopia katika kipindi TPLF ikiwa madarakani.
mt0: <pad> He discussed directly the conflict between him and Getachew Assefa, the Ethiopian Security Officer during the TPLF's rule.</s>

en: Guyo, who promoted this interview on Facebook as must-see TV in the days before its broadcast, has since been arrested and the government is investigating the full 71-minutes of interview tape for further clues that may help determine the facts regarding Hachalu's murder.
swa: Guyo, aliyeyatangaza mahojiano hayo katika ukurasa wake wa Facebook kwa kuyaita lazima uyaone siku chache kabla ya kurushwa kwake hewani, amekamatwa na polisi tangu wakati huo na serikali inafanya upelelezi wa mkanda wa dakika 71 za mahojiano hayo ili kupata vielelezo vitakavyosaidia kupata ufumbuzi wa chanzo cha mauaji ya Hachalu.
mt0: <pad> Guyo, who announced the interview on his Facebook page a few days before it aired, has been arrested by police since then and the government is investigating the 71-minute tape to find clues that will help solve the cause of Hachalu's death.</s>

swa: Soma zaidi kuhusu madhara yaliyotokana na mauaji ya Hachalu Hundessa katika sehemu ya II.
mt0: <pad> Read more about the effects of Hachalu Hundessa's murder in Part II.</s>

en: Screenshot from a Guardian YouTube video about female genital mutilation.
swa: Picha kutoka  Guardian YouTube video kuhusu ukeketaji wa wanawake.
mt0: <pad> Image from Guardian YouTube video about women's abuse</s>

en: COVID-19 has deeply affected womens rights in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA), from increased domestic violence to job loss.
swa: Janga la COVID-19 limeathiri kwa kiwango kikubwa haki za wanawake huko Mashariki ya Kati na Kaskazini mwa Afrika;  kutoka kuongezeka kwa ukatili majumbani mpaka kupoteza ajira zao.
mt0: <pad> The COVID-19 pandemic has affected women's rights in the Middle East and North Africa in a large way; from an increase in domestic abuse to loss of their jobs.</s>

en: But there is also one less visible area where women are affected: female genital mutilation (FGM), due to disruption in prevention because of the pandemic.
swa: Lakini kuna eneo moja lililowazi ambapo wanawake wameathirika ambalo mi ukeketaji, na hii ni baada ya kulipuka kwa janga la Korona na heka heka za kukabiliana nalo.
mt0: <pad> But there is one open area where women have been affected that is rape, and this is after the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic and the efforts to deal with it.</s>

en: In April, the United Nations announced that due to pandemic-related disruptions in prevention programs, two million FGM cases could occur over the next decade that would otherwise have been averted.
swa: Mwezi April, Umoja wa Mataifa ulitangaza kuwa kutokama ma vizuizi vilivyotokana na juhudi za kupambana na janga la korona, kuna visa milioni 2 vya ukeketaji ambavyo vinakisiwa kutokea kwa muongo ujao ambapo ingewekana kuzuia kama uzuiaji wa korona usingetibua mpango na juhudi za kupambama na ukeketaji
mt0: <pad> April, the UN announced that due to the restrictions imposed by the efforts to fight the coronavirus pandemic, there were 2 million abortion visas predicted to occur in the next decade which could be prevented if the coronavirus restrictions had not affected the plan and efforts to combat the spread and prevention of abortion.</s>

en: Female genital mutilation includes all procedures that involve partial or total removal of the external female genitalia, or other injury to the female genital organs for non-medical reasons, according to the World Health Organization (WHO).
swa: Ukeketaji unajumuisha shughuli za kukata kwa sehemu au kuondoa kabisa sehemu ya nje ya uke, au kuumiza sehemu  za uke bila uhusiano au dhana yoyote ya kutabibu, kulingana na Shirika la Afya Ulimwenguni (WHO).
mt0: <pad> Female circumcision is the practice of cutting or removing part or all of the external female vagina, or injuring the vagina without any medical association or concept, according to the World Health Organization (WHO).</s>

en: The practice, rooted in extensive traditions, cultural and religious beliefs throughout Africa, the Middle East and Asia, is typically performed by traditional midwives or healers using knives, razors or glass.

en: The practice varies according to social class, ethnicity and education in each country, with notable differences between urban and rural areas.

en: The scale and scope of FGM may be underestimated because the official global picture of FGM/C is incomplete, according to a joint report from March, authored by Equality Now, End FGM European Network and the US End FGM/C Network.
swa: Ukubwa na upana wa ukeketaji utakuwa umedharauliwa kwa sababu ya ulimwengu kutokuwa na picha halisi ya ukeketaji iliyokamilika, kulingana na ripoti ya pamoja kuanzia Machi, imeidhinishwa na  Usawa sasa, Mtandao kutoka Ulaya wa Kutokomeza Ukeketaji   na  Mtandao wa kutokomeza ukeketaji kutoka Marekani.

en: The report revealed growing evidence that the ritual is also practiced in other regions including the Middle East and Asia, and the world woefully underestimates FGM.

mt0: <pad> Small recent studies show that rape is also occurring in Iran, along with all Gulf countries such as Kuwait, the United Arab Emirates, Oman and Saudi Arabia.</s>

mt0: <pad> Divya Srinivasan from Now Is Good told Reuters that she was very surprised by the results of the small study from places like Oman and Saudi Arabia which are not usually places that come to mind when you talk about Trafficking.</s>

en: This lack of public awareness may perpetuate the perception that FGM is not an issue of concern.

en: In the Middle East, taboos around womens bodies and sexuality prevent open, public discussions about sensitive issues like FGM, often tied to cultural, religious and traditional beliefs.
swa: Huko Mashariki ya Kati, kuna miiko inayoizingira miili ya wanawake ambapo ni marufuku kujadili hadharani mambo ya siri kama vile ukeketaji ambapo umefungamanishwa na imani za kimila, dini na utamaduni.
mt0: <pad> In the Middle East, there are cultures that suppress women's bodies where it is prohibited to discuss publicly secrets such as rape which is linked to religious beliefs, racial and cultural traditions.</s>

en: In Egypt, for example, Christians and Muslims both believe that circumcision of girls prevents them from vice and makes them more attractive for future husbands; mothers fear that their daughters cant get married if they have not been cut, according to a report by Stop FGM Middle East, a campaign created in 2013 to raise awareness about FGM and whose aim is to get the message out that FGM exists not only in Africa, but also in many countries in the Middle East and Asia.
swa: Kwa mfano, nchini Misri Wakristo na Waislamu kwa pamoja wanaamini kwamba ukeketaji wa wasichana unawafanya wavutie zaidi waume zao watarajiwa na unawakinga na mabaya, pia wamama huhofia kwamba mabinti zao hawataolewa kama hawatakeketwa, kulingana na ripoti ya Tokomeza Ukeketaji Mashariki ya Kati, kampeni ambayo iliandaliwa mwaka 2013 kuipa jamii uelewa Kuhusu ukeketaji na pia kuuambia ulimwengu kuwa ukeketaji haupo Afrika pekee bali pia katika nchi nyingi za Mashariki ya Kati na Asia.
mt0: <pad> For example, in Egypt both Christians and Muslims believe that circumcision of girls makes them more attractive to their future husbands and protects them from bad things, and mothers fear that their daughters will not be married if they are not circumcised, according to the Report on Ending Childbirth in the Middle East, a campaign launched in 2013 to educate the public about childbirth and also to tell the world that childbirth is not only in Africa but also in many Middle Eastern and Asian countries.</s>

en: The organization lobbies for more data on FGM and has created a survey toolkit to help individuals and groups create small-scale surveys on FGM.

mt0: <pad> The organization is continuing to collect more information about rape and has developed a collection method that will help individuals or groups of people conduct small research on rape.</s>

en: With more families falling below the poverty line and girls taken out of school or forced into early marriage, FGM is also likely to continue to take place without notice in the region.

mt0: <pad> The wife of Dadiyata, Kadija in an interview with the BBC recalled that her husband was talking on the phone while the engine of his car was still running when he was abducted by the hostages.</s>

en: Although Kadija could not hear what ensued over the phone or who he was talking to, she recalled that her husband's abductors had followed him, they even came into the house.
swa: Ingawa Kadija hakuweza kusikia kilichokuwa kinazungumzwa au ni nani alikuwa anaongea naye kwenye simu, anakumbuka watekaji wa mume wake walikuwa wanamfuatilia na walikuja hadi nyumbani.
mt0: <pad> Although Kadija couldn't hear what was being said or who was talking to her on the phone, she remembers that the hostages of her husband were following her and came to her house.</s>

en: Dadiyatas wife watched from her room as they drove her husband away.

en: It is painful, Kadija told the BBC, as their children keep asking about their missing father.

mt0: <pad> It's very sad, especially how their children continue to ask for their father who has been missing, Kadija told the BBC.</s>

en: Rather than finding Dadiyata, Nigerian security agencies are absolving themselves from any form of guilt or blame for his disappearance.
swa: Kuliko kumtafuta Dadiyata, taasisi za ulinzi za Nigeria zimeendelea kujitoa kwenye lawama za aina yoyote zinazohusiana na kupotea kwake.
mt0: <pad> Instead of looking for Dadiyata, Nigerian security agencies have continued to deny any kind of allegations related to his disappearance.</s>

en: Nigerias Department of State Security (DSS) had in January denied having Dadiyata in their custody.
swa: Idara ya Ulinzi wa Taifa la Naijeria, mpaka Januari iliendelea kukataa kumweka Dadiyata kizuizini.
mt0: <pad> The Nigerian National Security Agency, until January, continued to refuse to hold Dadiyata in custody.</s>

en: The state security agency stated that since Dadiyata was taken away from his house by some armed men does not suggest that those men were DSS staff.
swa: Idara ya Ulinzi wa Taifa inasema kwamba kwa kuwa Dadiyata alichukuliwa nyumbani kwake na watu wenye silaha haimaanishi kwamba watu hao ni wafanyakazi wa Idara ya Usalama wa Taifa.
mt0: <pad> The National Security Department says that the fact that Dadiyata was taken from his home by armed men does not mean that the men were National Security Service agents.</s>

en: Similarly, Aisha Dikko, the attorney general of Kaduna State, denied knowing the whereabouts or of being involved whatsoever in Dadiyatas abduction.
swa: Vilevile mwanasheria mkuu wa Jimbo la Kaduna, Aisha Dikko, alikataa kufahamu alipo au kuhusika na lolote katika utekaji wa Dadiyata.
mt0: <pad> Also the state lawyer of Kaduna, Aisha Dikko, refused to know where or have any involvement in the kidnapping of Dadiyata.</s>

en: Anything to the contrary is a vile assertion that seeks to stretch the fact that he was abducted within Kaduna State to mean the involvement of the state government, said Dikko.
swa: Kwa vyovyote ni kinyume na ni mtazamo finyu kutaka kuamini kwamba kwa kuwa alitekwa akiwa katika jimbo la Kaduna basi serikali ya jimbo inahusika, alisema Dikko.
mt0: <pad> It is certainly wrong and a narrow view to think that because he was kidnapped in Kaduna state, the state government is involved, said Dikko.</s>

en: However, these denials by DSS and Kaduna State Government neither mitigates the agony of Dadiyatas wife and their two children  nor does it restore his liberty.
swa: Hata hivyo, kukana kuhusika kwa Usalama wa Taifa na serikali ya jimbo la Kaduna hakuondoi sononeko la mke wa  Dadiyata na watoto wao wawili wala hairejeshi uhuru wake.
mt0: <pad> However, the denial of involvement by National Security and the Kaduna state government did not ease the pain of Dadiyata's wife and their two children or regain his freedom.</s>

en: Armed bandits attacked a secondary school in Kaduna, northwestern Nigeria, on August 24, killing one person and kidnapping four students and a teacher, reports Nigerian online medium, SaharaReporters.
swa: Maharamia wakiwa na silaha walivamia shule ya sekondari huko Kaduna, Kaskazini Magharibi mwa Nigeria hapo Agosti 24 na kumuua mtu mmoja na kuwateka wanafunzi wanne na mwalimu kiliripoti chanzo cha habari za mitandaoni, SaharaReporters.
mt0: <pad> armed robbers attacked a school in Kaduna, north-west Nigeria on August 24 and killed one person and kidnapped four students and a teacher, according to an online news source, SaharaReporters.</s>

en: The gunmen who arrived at Damba-Kasaya village in Chikun Local Government Area, Kaduna State, at around 7:45 a.m. on motorbikes first raided the community, where they reportedly killed Benjamin Auta, a farmer, according to Nigerian online newspaper Premium Times.
swa: Watu hao wakiwa na silaha walifika na kushambulia kijiji cha Damba-Kasaya katika serikali ya mtaa wa Chikun, jimbo la Kaduna mnamo saa 1.45 asubuhi wakiwa kwenye pikipiki na  iliripotiwa kuwa walimuua Benjamin Auta, ambaye ni mkulima, kulingana na taarifa ya gazeti la mtandaoni la Premium Times.
mt0: <pad> The armed men arrived and attacked the village of Damba-Kasaya in Chikun, Kaduna state at 1.45 a.m. on motorcycles and were reported to have killed Benjamin Auta, a farmer, according to the online news website Premium Times.</s>

en: The gunmen then proceeded to Prince Academy Secondary School, where they abducted teacher Christianah Madugu, and four students: Favour Danjuma, 9, Miracle Danjuma, 13, Happy Odoji, 14, and Ezra Bako, 15.
swa: Watu hao wenye silaha walielekea katika shule ya sekondari ya Prince ambapo walimteka  mwalim Christianah Madugu na wanafunzi wanne ambao ni Favour Danjuma, 9, Miracle Danjuma, 13, Happy Odoji, 14, na Ezra Bako, 15.
mt0: <pad> The armed men went to Prince Secondary School where they kidnapped the teacher Christianah Madugu and four students, Favour Danjuma, 9, Miracle Danjuma, 13, Happy Odoji, 14, and Ezra Bako, 15.</s>

en: Happys father, Isiaka Odoji,  told Daily Trust, a Nigerian daily, that the gunmen are asking for a ransom of 20 million naira (about $53,000 USD) to set their children free  an amount they cannot possibly afford.
swa: Baba yake Happy,  Isiaka Odoji,  aliiambia  Daily Trust, gazeti la kila siku la Naijeria kwamba watekaji hao wanadai fedha kiasi cha Naira milioni 20(sawa na Dola za Marekani $53,000) ili waweze kuwaachilia huru watoto wao, lakini kamwe hawana uwezo wa kukusanya kiasi hicho.
mt0: <pad> Happy's father, Isaiah Odoji, told the Daily Trust, a Nigerian daily that the kidnappers demand 20 million Naira (equivalent to $53,000) for their children to be freed, but they can never afford to collect that sum of money.</s>
