en: Banditry violence spiked in Nigerias northwestern states of Zamfara, Kaduna, Niger, Sokoto, Kebbi and Katsina.
swa: Vurugu za kiharamia zililipuka Kaskazini Mashariki mwa Naijeria katika majimbo ya Zamfara, Kaduna, Niger, Sokoto, Kebbi na Katsina.
mt0: <pad> Islamic violence broke out in the north-east of Nigeria in Zamfara, Kaduna, Niger, Sokoto, Kebbi and Katsina.</s>

en: ACAPS, an independent humanitarian think tank, asserts that this armed violence is unconnected to the Boko Haram insurgency in the northeast:
swa: ACAPS ni shirika huru linaloshughulika na masuala ya kibinadamu, lilithibitisha kwamba vurugu hizi hazihusiani na uasi wa Boko Haram huko Kaskazini Mashariki:
mt0: <pad> ACAPS is an independent human rights organization, confirmed that this violence was not linked to the Boko Haram rebellion in northeast Nigeria.</s>

en: The banditry violence began as a farmer/herder conflict in 2011 and intensified between 2017 to 2018 to include cattle rustling, kidnapping for ransom, sexual violence and killings.
swa: Vurugu hizi za kiharamia zilianza kama mgogoro baina ya wafugaji na wakulima mwaka 2011 na kukua zaidi kati ya mwaka 2017 na 2018 zikihusisha wizi wa mifugo, utekaji kwa ajili ya kujipatia fedha, ubakaji na mauaji.
mt0: <pad> These bandit violence began as a conflict between farmers and ranchers in 2011 and grew more intensely between 2017 and 2018 involving animal theft, kidnapping for money, rape and murder.</s>

en: By March 2020, more than 210,000 people have been internally displaced.
swa: Mpaka mwezi Machi 2020 zaidi ya watu 210,000 wamekuwa wakimbizi wa ndani.
mt0: <pad> Since March 2020, more than 210,000 people have been refugees within the country.</s>

en: Rural communities have been left at the mercy of these bandits who, between January and June this year, have killed at least 1,126 people in northern Nigeria.

mt0: <pad> The rural communities have been living on the mercy of pirates who have killed 1,126 people from north-eastern Nigeria between January and June this year.</s>

en: Villages in southern Kaduna are the worst hit, with 366 lives lost in the first half of 2020, says Amnesty International.
swa: Vijiji vya Kusini mwa Kaduna ndivyo vinavyoshambuliwa zaidi ambapo wameshauawa watu 366 katika nusu ya kwanza ya mwaka 2020, lilisema Shirika la Kimataifa la Haki za Binadamu.
mt0: <pad> The southern villages of Kaduna are the most attacked, with 366 people killed in the first half of 2020, the International Human Rights Organization said.</s>

en: Chikun LGA, the home of the kidnapped students, had experienced a series of militia attacks that has resulted in the deaths, abduction, with 45 communities displaced and occupied since 2019, according to the Southern Kaduna Peoples Union.

mt0: <pad> Chikun LGA, the house of the kidnapped students has been under attack from bandit groups which have been accompanied by abductions and deaths with 45 families fleeing their homes where they were abducted since 2019, according to a report by the South Kaduna People's Union.</s>

en: The people of southern Kaduna allege that the bandits are Fulani herders, on a land grab mission, with the passive consent of both the federal and state governments.
swa: Watu wa Kusini mwa Kaduna wanadai kuwa maharamia hao ni wafugaji wa kabila la Fulani ambao wana mkakati wa kupora ardhi, wakisaidiwa na kutokuchukuliwa kwa hatua na serikali kuu na ile ya jimbo.
mt0: <pad> People in South Kaduna state claim that the pirates are Fulani farmers who have a plan to seize land, aided by the lack of action by the central and local governments.</s>

en: But Kaduna State governor, Nasir El-Rufai denied that the carnage had anything to do with land grabbing nor any ethnoreligious motivation.
swa: Lakini gavana wa jimbo la Kaduna,  Nasir El-Rufai alikataa uharamia huo kuhusishwa na mpango wa kupora ardhi au kuchochewa na itikadi za kidini.
mt0: <pad> But the governor of Kaduna state, Nasir El-Rufai denied that the violence was linked to any plot to seize land or religious beliefs.</s>

en: On August 22, the Kaduna State government relaxed the curfew from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m., which was imposed in some parts of the state to curb the banditry.

en: Despite concerns about its implications for freedom of expression, the Bangladeshi parliament approved the Digital Security Act in September 2018.

mt0: <pad> Although it was shown to restrict the freedom of expression, the Bangladeshi parliament passed the Internet Security Act in September 2018.</s>

en: The law replaced the notorious Information and  Technology Act, which had also been used as a tool for silencing critical speech online.
swa: Sheria hii ilichukua nafasi ya sheria nyingine kandamizi ya Habari na Teknolijia, ambayo pia ilikuwa ilitumika kama chombo cha  kuwanyamazisha wakosoaji Mitandaoni.
mt0: <pad> The law replaced another restrictive Information and Technology Act, which had also been used as a tool to muzzle online critics.</s>

en: The Act criminalizes various types of online speech, ranging from defamatory messages to speech that injures religious values or sentiments introducing hefty fines.
swa: Sheria hii inahukumu baadhi ya mazungumzo mitandaoni kuanzia jumbe za kubeza mpaka  mazungumzo yenye kuumiza hisia na maadili ya  kidini ikiorodhesha pia faini kubwa.
mt0: <pad> The law punishes some online conversations from insulting messages to religiously abusive or defamatory speech, and also lists large fines.</s>

en: It also authorizes lengthy prison sentences for using the internet to create public unrest, and for gathering, sending or preserving classified government documents using a digital device.
swa: Pia inaruhusu vifungo vya muda mrefu kwa makosa ya  kutumia mitandao kusababisha vurugu katika jamii na kwa kukusanya, kutuma na kuhifadhi habari na nyaraka nyeti za serikali kupitia huduma za kidigitali.
mt0: <pad> It also allows long-term imprisonment for internet crimes that cause social disorder and for collecting, transmitting and storing information and government documents through digital services.</s>

en: The Editors Council of Bangladesh said that the Act is against the freedom guaranteed by the constitution, media freedom and freedom of speech.
swa: Baraza la Wahariri la Bangladeshi lilisema kuwa sheria hii ni kinyume na uhuru uliotolewa kikatiba, uhuru wa vyombo vya habari na uhuru wa kujieleza.

The SLMA group led by Abdul Wahid al-Nur, and the North Sudanese Liberation Movement (SPLM-N), led by Abdelaziz al-Hilu, both refused to sign the accords because of the unanswered questions about the operational system of the coalition army and the country's identity.</s>

mt0: <pad> Three days after the signing of the peace deal, the Sudanese Prime Minister traveled to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to meet with al-Hilu to discuss the conflict according to the Sudanese Mediation.</s>

en: Sudan social media buzzed with a circulated copy of the agreement in English, with a particular focus on Article 3 on the subject of religion and state:
swa: Mitandao ya kijamii ya Sudan ilizizima kwa kusambazwa kwa nakala ya makubaliano hayo yaliyoandikwa kwa lugjs ya Kiingereza, mkazo ukiwa katika kipengele cha 3 kinachozungumzia masuala ya dini na utaifa:
mt0: <pad> The Sudanese social media exploded with the distribution of a copy of the deal written in English, emphasizing Article 3 which deals with issues of religion and nationality.</s>

en: A democratic state must be established in Sudan.
swa: Taifa la kidemokrasia lazima lisimikwe Sudani.
mt0: <pad> A democratic state must be established in Sudan.</s>

en: For Sudan to become a democratic country where the rights of all citizens are enshrined, the constitution should be based on the principle of separation of religion and state in the absence of which the right to self-determination must be respected.
swa: Kwa Sudani kuwa Taifa la kidemokrasia ambapo haki za watu wote zinaheshimiwa, katiba lazima iwe na misingi ya kutenga udini na utaifa  ambapo haki za mtu binafsi lazima ziheshimiwe.
mt0: <pad> For Sudan to be a democratic state where all people have equal rights, the constitution must have principles of sectarian and national segregation where individual rights must be respected.</s>

en: Freedom of belief and worship and religious practice shall be guaranteed in full to all Sudanese citizens.
swa: Uhuru wa kuamini na kuabudu na shughuli za kidini utolewe kwa  wananchi wote wa Sudani.
mt0: <pad> Freedom of belief and worship and religion activities be guaranteed to all Sudanese citizens.</s>

en: The state shall not establish an official religion.No citizen shall be discriminated against based on their religion.
swa: Serikali isiweke dini ya Taifa, asiwepo mwananchi atakayebaguliwa kwa sababu ya dini yake.
mt0: <pad> If the government does not set a national religion, no citizen will be discriminated against because of his religion.</s>

en: Sudanese people split into two camps on the matter: The first sees the separation of religion and state as a guarantee of fundamental human rights; the second says the transitional government does not have the right to decide this without authorization from citizens via democratic elections.
swa: Wananchi wa Sudani wamegawanyika katika makundi mawili katika suala hili: kundi la kwanza linaona kuwa kutenga uraia na dini ni jambo la msingi katika misingi haki za Binadamu; kundi la pili linaona kuwa serikali ya mpito haina mamlaka ya kufanya maamuzi juu ya jambo hilo bila ruhusa ya wananchi kupitia uchaguzi wa kidemokrasia.
mt0: <pad> The Sudanese people are divided into two groups on this issue: the first group believes that separating citizenship and religion is an important aspect of human rights; the second group believes that the interim government has no power to make any decision on this issue without the consent of the people through democratic elections.</s>

en: Following the meeting, the prime ministers Twitter account published an Arabic version of the agreement that differed from the English one, addressed as a joint press release.
swa: Baada ya mkutano huo, ukurasa wa Twitter wa Waziri Mkuu ulichapisha nakala ya mkataba huo kwa lugha ya Kiarabu  ambapo maudhui yake yalitofautiana na yale yaliyopo katika nakala iliyoandikwa kwa lugha ya Kiingereza.
mt0: <pad> After the meeting, the PM's Twitter account posted a copy of the contract in Arabic, which was different from the English-language version.</s>

en: While the English document emphasized the separation of religion from the state as an inevitability, the Arabic document only recommended discussion of the controversial issue.
swa: Wakati katika nakala ya Kiingereza msisitizo umewekwa kwa kuonesha kuwa haiwezekani kutenganisha dini na utaifa, katika nakala ya lugha ya Kiarabu inapendekeza majadiliano katika suala hili lenye utata.
mt0: <pad> While the English version stresses that it is impossible to separate religion and nationality, the Arabic version proposes discussion on this controversial issue.</s>

en: The differences between the two documents raise questions about the future of this agreement.
swa: Tofauti katika nakala hizi mbili umeibua maswali mengi kuhusu hatma ya makubaliano haya.
mt0: <pad> The difference between these two copies has raised many questions about the future of these agreements.</s>

en: While peace has brought happy news to Sudan, the Nile River continues to flood, ushering in an unprecedented humanitarian disaster.

mt0: <pad> While peace brings joy in Sudan, the Nile River continues to flow over, causing unexpected disasters to humans.</s>

en: According to a Sudanese National Council for Civil Defense report on September 8, total losses due to the Nile flood amounted to 103 deaths, 50 injuries, 5,482 deaths of livestock, 27,341 complete house collapses, 42,210 cases of partial house collapse, damage to 179 government and private facilities, loss of 359 shops and stores and damage to 4,208 agricultural acres.
swa: Kulingana na taarifa ya Septemba 8  ya, baraza la Ulinzi wa Taifa, kutokana na mafuriko hayo vimetokea vifo vya watu 103, majeruhi 50, vifo vya mifugo 5,482, nyumba 27,341zimebomoka kabisa na nyumba 42,210 zimebomoka nusu,  majengo ya serikali na taasisi binafsi 179 yameharibiwa, maduka na maghala 359 yameharibiwa na hekari 4,208 za mazao zimeharibiwa na mafuriko hayo.
mt0: <pad> According to the National Security Council's report on September 8, there have been 103 deaths, 50 injuries, 5,482 animal deaths, 27,341 homes totally and 42,210 partially destroyed, 179 government and private buildings have been destroyed, 359 shops and warehouses have been destroyed and 4,208 hectares of crops have been destroyed by the floods.</s>

en: The levels of the Blue Nile this night witnessed a great rise accompanied by heavy rain, which led to the breaking of the covers and shields, a simple dam built by sacks of the soil, of the city of Singa and Umm Benin areas, and the water began to flood the city and its homes, as well as the neighbourhoods of Umm Benin.

mt0: <pad> The level of the Nile River has increased this night because of the large rainfall that caused the breakdown of the levees and walls of protection which are a small dam built with sandbags in the city of Singa and Umm Benin, and water has begun to overflow into the city and into the people's homes.</s>

en: Student Union of Thailand (SUT) president Jutatip Sirikhan has been arrested while on the way to university on September 1 for her participation in the July 18 mass protest.
swa: Raisi wa Umoja wa wanafunzi wa Thailand Jutatip Sirikhan amekamatwa akiwa njiani akielekea chuoni hapo Septemba 1, kwa sababu ya kushiriki katika maandamano makubwa ya Julai 18.
mt0: <pad> The president of the Thai Students Union Jutatip Sirikhan was arrested on September 1 while he was going to school for his part in the large protests of July 18.</s>

en: Jutatip was arrested while in a taxi on her way to class at Thammasat Universitys Tha Prachan campus in Bangkok.
swa: Jutatip alikamatwa akiwa ndani ya gari akielekea darasani katika chuo kikuu cha Thammasat kampasi ya Tha Prachan huko Bangkok.
mt0: <pad> Jutatip was arrested while on his way to school at Thammasat University Tha Prachan campus in Bangkok.</s>

en: She went live on Facebook at 12:50 pm on September 1 when plainclothes police officers stopped the taxi she was in and delivered an arrest warrant.
swa: Aliingia mubashara katika ukurasa wake wa Facebook mnamo saa 07:50 mchana hapo Septemba 1, wakati askari waliovalia kiraia waliposimamisha taksi aliyokuwa amepanda na wakamwonesha hati ya kumkamata.
mt0: <pad> He went live on Facebook at 7:50 p.m. on September 1, when civilians stopped his taxi and showed him a handwritten arrest warrant.</s>

en: Jutatip was taken to Samranrat Police Station.
swa: Jutatip alipelekwa kwenye kituo cha polisi cha  lSamranrat.
mt0: <pad> Jutatip was taken to the Samranrat police station.</s>

en: An officer accompanied her in another taxi to the station, since she did not feel safe enough to travel in the private car the officers brought to arrest her.
swa: Afisa wa polisi aliambatana naye kuelekea kituoni akiwa kwenye taksi nyingine kwa sababu hakujisikia kuwa salama kupanda gari binafsi walilokuja nalo askari waliokuja kumkamata.
mt0: <pad> The police officer accompanied him to the station in another taxi because he didn't feel safe to ride the private car that the policemen came with when they arrested him.</s>

en: She stayed live on Facebook and read out passages from the Thai translation of Thomas Paines Common Sense during the travel to the station.
swa: Aliendelea kuwa mubashara katika ukurasa wake wa Facebook, akisoma kifungu cha habari  Ufahamu wa Kawaida kilichotafsiriwa kwa Kithailand na Thomas Paine.
mt0: <pad> He continued to livestream on his Facebook page, reading a passage from the book Common Sense translated into Thai by Thomas Paine.</s>

en: She was then taken to the Bangkok Criminal Court and was granted bail and released at 5:20 pm in the custody of a lecturer at Thammasat University.
swa: Alipelekwa katika mahakama ya kihalifu ya Bangkok na alipewa dhamana na kuachiliwa saa 11.20 jioni akiwa chini ya uangalizi wa Mhadhiri kutoka chuo kikuu cha Thammasat.
mt0: <pad> He was taken to the Bangkok criminal court and bailed at 11.20 pm under the watch of a professor from Thammasat University.</s>

en: The Court did not require her to immediately pay the 100,000 baht (3,190 US dollars) bail but imposed the condition that she does not repeat the actions for which she was being charged  the same condition given to everyone else who has been arrested and released on the same charges.
swa: Mahakama haikumtaka alipe papo hapo kiasi cha baht 100,000  (sawa na dola za Marekani 3,190) kwa ajili ya dhamana, lakini aliwekewa masharti kwamba hatakiwi kurudia tena makosa aliyoshtakiwa kwayo  masharti hayo hayo yalitolewa kwa kila mmoja aliyekamatwa na kuachiliwa kwa mashtaka hayo.
mt0: <pad> The court did not require him to pay the immediately available bail of baht 100,000 (equivalent to US$ 3,190), but he was given conditions that he would not commit the same crimes again. These conditions were also imposed on each of the arrested and freed people who were charged with the same offenses.</s>

mt0: <pad> Paint painting is also something that can be done.</s>

en: Jutatip then threw a bucket of white paint over herself while holding up her hand in the three-finger Hunger Games salute.
swa: Kisha Jutatip alijimwagia ndoo ya rangi nyeupe mwilini mwake huku akiwa ameinua mkono wake juu huku akiwa amenyoosha vidole vitatu saluti  ya Mchezo wa Njaa.
mt0: <pad> Then Jutatip poured white water onto his body while raising his hand up with three fingers bent in the Hunger Games salute.</s>

en: She said that the white paint represents purity and justice, and that they are demanding justice back.
swa: Alisema kuwa rangi nyeupe inawakilisha usafi na haki, na wanadai urejesho wa haki.
mt0: <pad> He said that white represents purity and justice, and they demand the restoration of justice.</s>

en: We are showing that this is freedom, this is the kind of expression we can do.
swa: Tunaonesha kuwa hii ni haki, hii ni aina ya kielelezo cha kwamba tunaweza kufanya.
mt0: <pad> We show that this is fair, this is a kind of example that we can do.</s>

en: Even if now it is throwing paint over ourselves, it is a way of showing that we can throw paint at any time.
swa: Hata kama ni kujimwagia rangi kwa sasa, ni njia ya kuonesha kuwa tunaweza kujimwagia rangi saa yoyote.
mt0: <pad> Even if it's just a spray paint for now, it's a way to show that we can spray paint anytime.</s>

en: We can throw paint over those with power, because those with power throw legal charges over us, throw bullets at us without exception.
swa: Tunaweza kuwamwagia rangi hao walio na mamlaka kwa sababu wanatutia hatiani na kuturushia risasi saa yoyote bila kujali, kwa kuwa wana mamlaka.
mt0: <pad> We can paint those in power because they are accusing us and firing us shots at any time without regard, because they have power.</s>

en: Paint can be washed out, but we cant wash out injustice.
swa: Rangi inaweza kusafishwa lakini uonevu hauwezi kusafishwa.
mt0: <pad> Color can be cleaned but insight cannot be cleaned.</s>

en: Afterward, Jutatip thanked the lecturer who came to make bail for her and the people who came to support her and helped the crowd clean the paint off the sidewalk in front of the footpath in front of the Court.
swa: Baada ya hapo, Jutatip alimshukuru Mhadhiri ambaye alimuwekea dhamana na watu waliokuja kumuunga mkono na kusaidia umati kusafisha rangi iliyokuwa imetapakaa katika njia ya waenda kwa miguu mbele ya mahakama.
mt0: <pad> Afterwards, Jutatip thanked the judge who bailed him and the people who came to support him and helped the crowd clean the paint that had spilled on the pavement in front of the court.</s>

en: We wont stop fighting until we win in everything, including monarchy reform and a new constitution, Jutatip said.
swa: Hatutaacha kupambana mpaka tushinde kila kitu, ikiwemo marekebisho ya ufalme na  katiba mpya, alisema Jutatip.
mt0: <pad> We will not stop fighting until we win everything, including the re-election of the monarch and a new constitution, he said.</s>

en: While India is going through a major general election spread over seven phases from 11 April to 19 May 2019 in order to elect its 17th parliament (Lok Sabha), some Indian voters have taken the unusual step of boycotting the electoral process.
swa: Wakati India ikipitia kipindi cha uchaguzi mkuu uliogawanyika katika awamu saba zinazoanzia 11 April mpaka 19 Mei 2019 ili kuchagua bunge lake la saba (Lok Sabha), baadhi ya wapiga kura wa India wamechukua hatia isiyo ya kawaida kwa kugomea shughuli za uchaguzi.
mt0: <pad> While India is undergoing the general election period of five rounds starting from 11 April to 19 May 2019 to elect its seventh Lok Sabha, some Indian voters have taken an unusual stand by boycotting the election process.</s>

en: Read More: All you need to know about India's 2019 general elections
swa: Soma Zaidi: Yote unayotaka kufahamu kuhusu uchaguzi mkuu wa India 2019
mt0: <pad> All you need to know about the Indian general election</s>

en: In Goa, a southwestern state of India, residents of a tribal hamlet in Canacona block (district subdivision), Marlem Village refused to vote on 23 April during the third phase of the general election, alleging that the government had been oblivious to the problems of their village.
swa: Huko Goa, jimbo la Kusini mwa India, wakazi wa kijiji kidogo kilichopo kitongoji  cha Cancona (sehemu ya wilaya), kijiji cha Marlem walikataa kupiga kura tarehe 23 Aprili katika awamu ya tatu ya uchaguzi mkuu wakiwa na madai kwamba serikali imekuwa ndio tatizo kuwa katika kijiji chao.
mt0: <pad> In Goa, the residents of the small village Marlem in the Cancona (part of the district), Marlem Village refused to vote on April 23 in the third round of the general election claiming that the government has been a problem in their village.</s>

en: Their main grievance is that basic facilities, such as proper roads and water supply, have not been provided by the government.
swa: Malalamiko yao makubwa ni kwamba mahitaji na huduma muhimu kama vile barabara nzuri na huduma ya maji safi na salama hazijawahi kutolewa na serikali.
mt0: <pad> Their main complaints are that the government has never provided basic necessities and services such as good roads and clean and safe water.</s>

en: A video by Community Correspondent Devidas Gaonkar, a member of the aboriginal shepherd tribe of Goa called Velip, documented the protests of the villagers:
swa: Video ya Mtangazaji wa masuala ya kijamii  Devidas Gaonkar, mzaliwa wa kabila la wafugaji la waGoa inayoitwa Velip, ikionesha maandano ya wanakijiji hao:
mt0: <pad> The video of social media broadcaster Devidas Gaonkar, a native of the Goa pastoralist community of Velip, showing the protests of the villagers.</s>

en: In this video, Pandurang Gaonkar, a resident from Marli village, states that:
swa: Katika video hii, Pandurang Gaonkar, mkazi wa kijiji cha Marli alisema kwamba:
mt0: <pad> In this video, Pandurang Gaonkar, a resident of Marli village said that he was shocked to see the spread of coronavirus.</s>

en: Tirwal to Marlem is a three-quilometres road stretch, which is incomplete.
swa: Kuanzia Tirwal mpaka Marlem ni kilomita tatu tu za barabara lakini hazijakamilika.
mt0: <pad> From Tirwal to Marlem is only three kilometers of road but it is not finished.</s>

en: To date, no action has been taken by the authorities.
swa: Mpaka leo hakuna hatua zozote zilizochukuliwa na mamlaka husika.
mt0: <pad> Until now, no action has been taken by the relevant authorities.</s>

en: They only make false promises, but no implementation.
swa: Wanatupa ahadi za uongo tu hakuna utekelezaji.
mt0: <pad> They only give us false promises, no action.</s>

en: For this reason, we havent cast our votes.
swa: Na kwa sababu hiyo basi, hatujapiga kura.
mt0: <pad> And for that reason, we haven't voted.</s>

en: The residents of Marlem have been living in this village for more than 20 years.
swa: Wakazi wa kijiji cha Marlem wamekuwa wakiishi katika kijiji hicho kwa zaidi ya miaka 20 sasa.
mt0: <pad> The Marlem villagers have lived in the village for over 20 years.</s>

en: In 1968, the Forest Department declared Marlem village part of a wildlife sanctuary.
swa: Mwaka 1968, idara ya misitu ilitangaza kuwa kijiji cha Marlem kama  sehemu salama kwa wanyama wa mwituni.
mt0: <pad> In 1968, the Forest Service declared Marlem Village as a safe place for wild animals.</s>

en: This makes the construction of roads, or any development work in this area, a rather complex issue.
swa: Hili linafanya ujenzi wa barabara au kazi yoyote ya maendeleo katika eneo hili kuwa na ugumu wa kutekeleza.
mt0: <pad> This makes road building or any development work in this area difficult to implement.</s>

en: According to reports, an underground power cabling project for carrying electricity to the area had been initially approved, but when digging work commenced, it was soon halted following objections coming from the state Forest Department.
swa: Kulingana na taarifa,  ni kwamba mpango wa kupitisha mkongo wa umeme aridhini ili uweze kufika eneo hilo ulishapitishwa lakini ulizuiwa hivi karibuni kutokana na mapingamizi kutoka kwa Idara ya Misitu ya Taifa
mt0: <pad> According to the report, the plan to install an affordable power line to get to the site was already approved but was recently delayed due to objections from the National Forest Department.</s>

en: Another source of frustration for the local population is the absence of proper roads.
swa: Chanzo kingine cha mahangaiko ya wakazi wa hapa ni ukosefu wa barabara nzuri.
mt0: <pad> Another source of concern for the locals is the lack of good roads.</s>

en: One has to navigate a 2.8 km unpaved and broken road to reach the first household at Marlem from the main road.
swa: Mtu anatakiwa kusafiri  kutoka barabara kuu umbali wa kilomita 2.8 katika barabara mbaya na ambayo haijasafishwa vizuri ili aweze kukuta nyumba ya kwanza katika kijiji cha Marlem.
mt0: <pad> A person must travel 2.8 kilometers from the main road on a bad and poorly paved road to find the first house in Marlem village.</s>

en: Finally, the supply of electricity and safe drinking water remain a challenge for the villagers.
swa: Mwisho kabisa, usambazaji wa umeme na maji safi na salama kwa wanakijiji vimebaki kuwa changamoto kwa wanakijiji.
mt0: <pad> Finally, the supply of power and clean water to the villagers has remained a challenge for the villagers.</s>

en: Having publicly and repeatedly voiced their complaints, but failing to get any answers, the residents of Marlem, as well as residents from two other villages decided not to vote in the elections in order to draw the attention of the authorities towards their issues.
swa: Pamoja na kuweka malalamiko yao hadharani mara kwa mara, lakini wameshindwa kupata majibu ya mahitaji yao, wakazi wa Marlem pamoja na wakazi kutoka katika vijiji vingine viwili waliamua kutokupiga kura ili kuvuta masikio ya mamlaka dhidi ya masuala yao wanayoyalalamikia.
mt0: <pad> Although they have repeatedly raised their concerns, but have not received any response to their demands, Marlem residents and residents of two other villages decided not to vote to draw attention to their problems.</s>

en: Polling officials came to talk to us, but our decision of not to vote, still stands, added Pandurang.
swa: Wafanyakazi wa tume ya uchaguzi walikuja kuongea nasi kuhusu uamuzi wetu wa kutokupiga kura na msimamo wetu uko pale pale, aliongeza Pandurang.
mt0: <pad> Election commission officials came to talk to us about our decision not to vote and our position is still the same, he added.</s>

en: Isidore Fernandes, an opposition (Indian National Congress) member of the legislative assembly of Cancona, also met the locals.
swa: Isidore Fernandes, kiongozi wa upinzani kutoka chama cha (Indian National Congress) ambaye ni mbunge katika bunge la Cancona, pia alikutana na wakazi wa eneo hilo.
mt0: <pad> Isidore Fernandes, a leader of the opposition from the Indian National Congress and a member of the Cancona Legislative Assembly, also met with local residents.</s>

en: After hearing the grievances he assured his support in favour of their agitation.
swa: Baada ya kusikiliza kero zao alieahakikishia kuwa atawasaidia kushughulikia jamjo hilo.
mt0: <pad> After listening to their concerns, he assured them that he would help them deal with the problem.</s>

en: It is important for any government to provide road, water, and electricity to people.
swa: Ni muhimu kwa serikali yoyote kutengeneza barabara, kusambaza umeme na maji kwa ajili ya watu wao.
mt0: <pad> It is important for any government to build roads, provide electricity and water for its people.</s>

en: Till now, all government officials have neglected these facilities in Marlem Village, stated Fernandes.
swa: Mpaka sasa maafida wote wa serikali wamepuuza kutoa huduma hizi katika kijiji cha Marlem, alisema   Fernandes.
mt0: <pad> To date, all government officials have ignored the provision of these services in Marlem village, said Fernandes.</s>

en: Boycotting elections is now becoming a way of protest, although voting is not mandatory in India.
swa: Kususia uchaguzi sasa imekuwa kama njia mojawapo ya mgomo, ingawa kupiga kura sio lazima katika nchi ya India.
mt0: <pad> Ignoring the election has now become a form of protest, although voting is not mandatory in India.</s>

en: Apart from Goa, villages in the central state of Madhya Pradesh, the western state of  Maharashtra, and the eastern state of Odisha are employing this method in order to get pressing issues addressed by the authorities in charge.
swa: Tofauti ya kijiji cha Goa, vijiji vilivyo katika jimbo la Kati Madhya Pradesh, Magharibi jimbo la Maharashtra, na Mashariki jimbo la Odisha wamekuwa wakitumia mbinu hii ili kuweza kufikisha mambo yao muhimu mbele ya viongozi wa mamlaka zinazohusika.
mt0: <pad> Except for the village of Goa, villages in Central Madhya Pradesh, Western Maharashtra and East Odisha have been using this method to get their important issues to the leaders of the relevant authorities.</s>

en: So far, none of those boycotts seem to have translated into action on the side of government.
swa: Hata hivyo, hakuna mgomo wowowte kati ya hii ambao umechukuliwa hatua na serikali.
mt0: <pad> However, none of these protests have been taken seriously by the government.</s>

en: Ultimately, voters are adopting such tactics as a show of frustration towards officials and politicians who often reach out to neglected communities only before elections, in hope of securing their votes, but fail to deliver once the elections are over.
swa: Wapiga kura wengi wameanza kuzoea kutumia mbinu hii kama ishara ya kuonesha hasira zao kwa wanasiasa na maofisa wa serikali ambao huzigeukia jamii walizozitelekeza katika kipindi cha uchaguzi wakiwa ma matumaini ya kupata kura zao, huku wakishindwa kutekeleza ahadi zao baada ya uchaguzi.
mt0: <pad> Many voters have begun to become accustomed to using this method as a symbol of their anger at politicians and government officials who turn away from the people they targeted during the election campaign in hopes of getting their votes, but fail to fulfill their promises after the election.</s>

en: In the end, if boycotting elections does not heed changes in society, what else can members of neglected communities do to get the attention of those supposed to hear them and take proper action?
swa: Lakini mwishowe, kama Kugomea chaguzi haitaleta mabadiliko katika jamii, je ni kitu gani wanajamii wataamua kufanya ili kuvuta masikio ya wenye mamlaka ambao wanapaswa kusikia sauti zao na kuchukua hatua za utekelezaji?
mt0: <pad> But in the end, if boycotting elections doesn't bring change in society, what will citizens decide to do to get the attention of those who have the power to hear their voice and take action?</s>

en: The journalist Amade Abubacar.
swa: Mwandishi wa Habari  Amade Abubacar.
mt0: <pad> The journalist Amade Abubacar.</s>

en: Journalists Amade Abubacar and Germano Adriano, who were detained earlier this year while covering the military conflict in northern Mozambique, were released pending trial on 23 April, 2019.
swa: Waandishi wa Habari Amade Abubacar na  Germano Adriano, ambao waliokamatwa mapema mwaka huu wakati wakikusanya habari za mgogoro wa kijeshi  katika ukanda wa Kaskazini mwa Msumbiji, wameachiliwa huru bila kushtakiwa mnamo tarehe 23 April,  2019.
mt0: <pad> The journalists Amade Abubacar and Germano Adriano, who were arrested earlier this year while collecting information about the military conflict in the north of Mozambique, were freed without charge on April 23, 2019.</s>

en: Amade, who contributes to various local media outlets including Zitamar News and A Carta, was detained on 5 January while he interviewed internally displaced people in the Macomia district of Cabo Delgado, a northern province of the country.
swa: Amade, ambaye amekuwa akichangia habari katika vyanzo mbali mbali vya habari vikiwamo Zitamar News na A Carta, aliwekwa kizuizini tarehe 5 Januari wakati akifanya mahojiano na wakimbizi wa ndani kutoka katika wilaya ya Macomia katika jimbo la Kaskazini mwa nchi, Cabo Delgado.
mt0: <pad> Amade, who has been contributing to various news sources including Zitamar News and A Carta, was detained on 5 January while he was interviewing refugees from the Macomia district in the north of the country, Cabo Delgado.</s>

en: Germano, a reporter for the local community radio Nacedje, disappeared on 6 February and was found to have been detained on 18 February.
swa: Germano, ambaye ni mwandishi wa habari wa kituo cha redio ya jamii cha Nacedje, alipotea tangu Februari 6 na alipatikana akiwa kizuizini tarehe 18, Februari.
mt0: <pad> Germano, a journalist for the community radio station Nacedje, was missing since February 6 and was found in custody on February 18.</s>

en: According to the Media Institute of Southern Africa (MISA), Amade and Germano were charged with spreading defamatory messages against members of the Mozambican Armed Defence Forces via a Facebook account that announced attacks which occurred in villages in the district of Macomia.
swa: Kulingana na taarifa kutoka kwa Shirikisho la Vyombo Vya Habari Kusini Mwa Afrika(MISA), Amade na Germano walishtakiwa kwa kueneza habari za kuwachafua baadhi ya viongozi wa Jeshi la Wananchi wa Msumbiji kupitia kurasa zao za Facebook ambapo walitangaza kuanza kwa mapigano yaliyotokea katika vijiji vya wilaya ya Macomia.
mt0: <pad> According to a report from the South African Media Association (MISA), Amade and Germano were accused of defaming some commanders of the Mozambique National Army through their Facebook pages where they announced the start of the fighting in the villages of Macomia district.</s>

en: The journalists were released from the provincial jail of Mieze in Pemba, Cabo Delgados capital, and will be on probation as they await trial before the provincial judicial court of Cabo Delgado.
swa: Wanahabari hao waliachiliwa huru kutoka katika gereza la  Mieze huko Pemba, makao makuu ya Cabo Delgado na wapo katika kipindi cha uangalizi wakati wakisubiri kushtakiwa katika mahakama ya hakimu mkazi huko Cabo Delgado.
mt0: <pad> The journalists were released from the Mieze prison in Pemba, capital of Cabo Delgado and are under observation while they wait for trial in the magistrate's court in Cabo Delgado.</s>

en: Their first hearing is scheduled for 17 May.
swa: Kesi imepangwa kusikilizwa kwa mara ya kwanza hapo Mei 17.
mt0: <pad> The trial is scheduled to begin on May 17.</s>

en: Since 2017, groups armed with knives have carried out attacks on villages in Cabo Delgado, burning houses and decapitating residents.
swa: Tangu mwaka 2017, makundi ya watu wenye silaha kama vile visu wamekuwa wakifanya mashambulizi katika vijiji vya Cabo Delgado, wakichoma nyumba  na kuwachinja wakazi.
mt0: <pad> Since 2017, groups of people with weapons such as knives have been attacking villages in Cabo Delgado, burning houses and killing the residents.</s>

en: More than 90 people have died since the attacks began, according to the police.
swa: Zaidi ya watu 90 wameshauwa tangu kuanza kwa mashambulio hayo kulingana na taarifa za polisi.
mt0: <pad> Over 90 people have been killed since the start of the attacks, police say.</s>

en: To date, no group has publicly claimed responsibility for the attacks.
swa: Mpaka leo hakuna kikundi ambacho kimejitokeza hadharani kukiri kuhusika na mashambulio hayo.
mt0: <pad> To date, no group has come forward to claim responsibility for the bombings.</s>

en: In December 2018, the newspaper A Carta de Moçambique revealed the existence of a Facebook page, run under a name that appears to have been falsified, that praised the armed groups attacks in Cabo Delgado.
swa: Hapo Disemba 2018 gazeti la  A Carta de Moçambique lilidhihirisha uwepo wa ukurasa wa Facebook, yenye jina ambalo inaonekana ni la kughushi ambapo ukurasa huo unasifu mashambulio ya vikundi vya watu wenye silaha huko Cabo Delgado
mt0: <pad> In December 2018 the newspaper A Carta de Moçambique showed the existence of a Facebook page, with a name that seems to be a fake, which praised the attacks by armed groups in Cabo Delgado.</s>

en: It unknown whether or not the accusations against Amade and Germano are concerning this same page.
swa: Haifahamiki kama mashtaka dhidi ya Amade na Germano yanahusishwa na ukurasa huo.
mt0: <pad> It is not known whether the charges against Amade and Germano are related to the page.</s>

en: The journalists defence team says there is no connection between them and any illegal activity via Facebook.
swa: Timu ya utetezi wa wanahabari hao inasema kuwa hakuna uhusiano wowote baina yao na ukurasa huo au vitendo vingine vya uhalifu vinavyofanyika katika kurasa za Facebook.
mt0: <pad> The defense team of the journalists said that they have no connection to the page or any other criminal activity on Facebook.</s>

en: The proceedings against the journalists have been marked by irregularities.
swa: Mashtaka dhidi ya wanahabari hawa yamegubikwa na sintofahamu nyingi.
mt0: <pad> The charges against these journalists have been clouded by many uncertainties.</s>

en: After detaining Amade, the police placed him in military custody.
swa: Baada ya Amade kuwekwa kizuizini, polisi walimweka chini ya ulinzi wa Jeshi la Wananchi.
mt0: <pad> After Amade was arrested, the police placed him under the supervision of the National Guard.</s>

en: He was put in a military prison, where he spent 12 days incommunicado before being transferred to a civilian prison.
swa: Aliwekwa katika gereza la Kijeshi ambapo alikaa siku 12 bila kufanya mawasiliano yoyote na kisha kuhamishiwa katika gereza la kiraia.
mt0: <pad> He was placed in military jail where he spent 12 days without contact and then transferred to civilian jail.</s>

en: The journalists were only charged on 16 April, violating the deadline of 90 days set out in the Mozambican Law of Pre-trial Detention in the case of Abubacar.
swa: Wanahabari hawa walishtakiwa tu ilipofika tarehe 16 Aprili, ikiwa ni ukiukwaji wa utaratibu wa mwisho wa siku 90, kinyume na sheria ya ukamataji na kuwekwa kizuizini ya Msumbiji, katika kesi ya Abubacar.
mt0: <pad> These journalists were charged only on April 16, in violation of the 90 days last order, against the Mozambique arrest and detention law, in Abubacar's case.</s>

en: In court proceedings during their pre-trial detention, both journalists were accused of crimes of violating state secrets through digital means and public incitement to a crime using digital means.
swa: Katika muendelezo wa kesi katika kipindi chao cha kuwa kizuizini wandishi wote kwa pamoja walituhumiwa kwa makosa ya uhalifu wa kuvujisha siri za serikali kupitia mitandao ya kijamii na kuchochea jamii kwa kutumia njia za kidigitali.
mt0: <pad> In the continuation of their trial during their detainment, the journalists were all charged with crimes of leaking government secrets through social media and inciting the public to use digital means.</s>

en: These accusations differ from the formal charges that have now been filed against them, which MISA described as spreading defamatory messages against members of the Mozambican Armed Defence Forces via a Facebook account that announced attacks which occurred in villages in the district of Macomia.
swa: Mashtaka haya yanapishana na mashtaka ya awali yaliyotolewa dhidi yao, ambapo MISA waliyatafsiri kama  kueneza ujumbe wa kuchafua baadhi ya viongozi wa jeshi la wananchi wa Msumbiji kupitia ukurasa wa Facebook ambao ulingaza mashambulio ya watu katika vijiji vya wilaya ya Macomia.
mt0: <pad> These charges contradict the previous charges against them, which MISA interpreted as distributing a message of insult to some members of the Mozambique National Guard through Facebook that highlighted people's attacks in villages in the Macomia district.</s>

en: During the 106 days he spent in prison, Abubacar faced a lack of food and refusal of medical assistance, according to Amnesty International.
swa: Katika kipindi cha siku 106 alizokaa gerezani, Abubacar alikumbana na ukosefu wa chakula na kunyimwa huduma za matibabu, kulingana na taarifa ya Shirika la Haki za Binadamu (Amnesty International).
mt0: <pad> During the 106 days he spent in jail, Abubacar suffered from shortages of food and medical care, according to Amnesty International.</s>

en: His family told the newspaper @Verdade that they were stopped from visiting him during the whole time that Abubacar was in custody.
swa: Familia yake  waliliambia gazeti la @Verdade kwamba walizuiwa kumtembelea  Abubacar katika kipindi chote alichokuwa kizuizini.
mt0: <pad> His family told the @Verdade that they were not allowed to visit Abubacar during his detainment.</s>

en: What has happened to these journalists may be part of a trend of intimidation against media workers in northern Mozambique.
swa: Kilichotokea kwa waandishi hawa wa habari ni sehemu ya muendelezo  wa unyanyaswaji dhidi ya wafanyakazi wa vyombo vya habari Kaskazini mwa Msumbiji.
mt0: <pad> What happened to these journalists is part of the continuing abuse against media workers in north-eastern Mozambique.</s>

en: Independent investigative journalist Estácio Valoi was detained in December 2018, also in Cabo Delgado on legally dubious terms.
swa: Mwandishi wa Habari za Uchunguzi wa kujitegemea Estácio Valoi aliwekwa kizuizini  mwezi Disemba 2018,  pia huko Cabo Delgado kwa sababu za kisheria zisizoeleweka.
mt0: <pad> The independent investigative journalist Estácio Valoi was also detained in December 2018, also in Cabo Delgado for unclear legal reasons.</s>

en: There were, and still are, people in Iran who believe that by empowering civil society organizations, political parties and independent media, the Islamic Republic might change gradually from within.
swa: Kulikuwapo na bado wapo watu ndani ya Irani ambao wanaamini kuziwezesha jumuiya za kijamii,vyama vya siasa na uhuru wa habari, serikali ya kiislamu inaweza kubadilika polepole kwa kuanzia ndani.

en: On the other side, there are forces trying to prove them wrong, and one way to do so is by making the environment so threatening that no one dare stay active in the field.
swa: Kwa upande mwingine kuna nguvu nyingine zinazopambana kuthibitisha kuwa hilo haliwezekani na njia mojawapo ni kuyafanya mazingira kuwa hatarishi kiasi kwamba hakuna mtu atadhubutu kubaki akifanya alichokuwa anakifanya.

en: On May 15, thousands of Brazilians took to the streets in all 26 states and the Federal District against the Bolsonaro government's slashing of federal funds to education that will affect dozens of universities and schools.
swa: Hapo Mei 15, maelfu ya Wabrazili waliingia mitaani katika majimbo yote 26 wakiandamana kuipinga serikali ya Bolsonaro kukata fedha za elimu ambapo itaathiri mamia ya shule na vyuo.
mt0: <pad> On May 15, thousands of Brazilians went to the streets in all 26 states to protest Bolsonaro's education cut that will affect hundreds of schools and universities.</s>

en: At the end of April, Brazil's government announced cuts of 30 percent on a so-called discretionary budget, which goes towards expenses such as electricity, water, general maintenance, and research.
swa: Mwishoni mwa mwezi Aprili, serikali ya Brazili ilitangaza kukata kiasi cha asilimia 30 ya kile kinachosemekana ni bajeti ambayo ilikuwa kwa ajili ya gharama za maji, umeme, uendeshaji wa jumla pamoja na tafiti.
mt0: <pad> At the end of April, the Brazilian government announced that it was cutting 30 percent of what it called its budget which was for water, power, general running and research.</s>

en: When considering the total federal budget for higher education, the cuts would amount to around 3,5 percent.
swa: Wakati ukifiria kuwa jumla ya bajeti kuu ya serikali kwa ajili ya elimu ya juu, makato hayo yanaweza kufikia mpaka asilimia tatu au 5.
mt0: <pad> When you consider the total government budget for higher education, these taxes can reach up to three percent or five percent.</s>

en: Besides, the government has suspended funds for 3,500 publicly-funded postgraduate scholarships.
swa: Hata hivyo, serikali imefuta udhamini kwa wanafunzi wa elimu za juu wapatao 3,500 waliokuwa wakidhaminiwa na serikali..
mt0: <pad> However, the government has removed its sponsorship of about 3,500 university students who were previously sponsored by the government.</s>

mt0: <pad> From Paulista Street in São Paulo, the center of a multi-ethnic protest to the natural farms in Alto Rio Negro, near the Colombian border, people went out to defend public education.</s>

en: This article is part of a series called The identity matrix: platform regulation of online threats to expression in Africa.These posts interrogate identity-driven online hate speech or discrimination based on language or geographic origin, misinformation and harassment (particularly against female activists and journalists) prevalent in digital spaces of seven African countries: Algeria, Cameroon, Ethiopia, Nigeria, Sudan, Tunisia and Uganda.

en: According to the United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO), linguistic and cultural diversity are of strategic importance for people around the world to strengthen the unity and cohesion of societies.
swa: Kulingana na shirika la Umoja wa Mataifa la Elimu, Sayansi na Utamaduni (UNESCO), utofauti wa lugha na utamaduni una umuhimu kimkakati kwa watu ulimwenguni kote katika juhudi za kuimarisha umoja na mshikamano wa jamii.
mt0: <pad> According to UNESCO, the diversity of language and culture is a strategic importance for people around the world in the efforts to strengthen unity and solidarity of the community.</s>

en: This linguistic and cultural diversity propelled the UNESCO general conference to proclaim International Mother Language Day (IMLD) in November 1999, to be commemorated annually on February 21 annually.
swa: Utofauti huu wa lugha na utamaduni ulishinikiza kongamano kuu la UNESCO kutangaza Siku ya Kimataifa ya Lugha ya Mama (IMLD) mnamo Novemba 1999, siku inayokumbukuwa mnamo Februari 21 kila mwaka.
mt0: <pad> This linguistic and cultural differences prompted the UNESCO General Conference to declare International Mother Language Day (IMLD) on November 1999, a day that is celebrated on February 21 every year.</s>

en: To bolster IMLD, the United Nations (UN) declared the International Year of Indigenous Languages (IYIL 2019), to draw attention to the endangerment of the worlds indigenous languages.
swa: Kuimarisha IMLD, Umoja wa Mataifa (UN) ulitangaza Mwaka wa Kimataifa wa Lugha za Asili (IYIL 2019), ili kuzingatia hatari ya kuangamia kwa lugha za asili ulimwenguni.
mt0: <pad> To strengthen IMLD, the UN (UN) declared International Year of Indigenous Languages (IYIL 2019), to highlight the danger of the extinction of indigenous languages around the world.</s>

en: Today, there are over 7,100 languages spoken around the world, 28 percent of which are spoken on the African continent alone.
swa: Hivi leo, kuna zaidi ya lugha 7,100 zinazozungumzwa kote duniani,asilimia 28 yazo zikizungumzwa barani Afrika pekee.
mt0: <pad> Today, there are over 7100 different languages spoken around the world, 28 percent of them in Africa.</s>

en: Despite this, English dominates online spaces in the region.
swa: Licha ya hili, Kiingereza kinaongoza mtandaoni katika eneo hili.
mt0: <pad> However, English is the dominant language on the internet in this area.</s>

en: Some twenty years ago, 80 percent of the worlds online content was English-centric.
swa: Miaka ishirini iliyopita, asilimia 80 ya maudhui ya dunia mtandaoni yalikuwa yanaegemea Kiingereza.
mt0: <pad> Over the past 20 years, 80% of the world's internet content was in English.</s>

en: Currently, however, English content online is said to have shrunk to between 51- 55 percent.
swa: Kwa sasa, hata hivyo, maudhui ya Kiingereza yanasemekana kupungua hadi kiwango cha kati ya asilimia 51 hadi 55.
mt0: <pad> Now, however, the English language content is said to be down to a level of 51 to 55 percent.</s>

en: The million-dollar question, therefore, is: Could this sharp drop be an indicator that people now favor their native languages online over English, considering that less than 15 percent of the world population speaks English as their first language?
swa: Swala kizushi, kwa hivyo, ni:je, kupungua huku kunaashiria kuwa sasa watu wanapendelea lugha zao za asilia kuliko Kiingereza, ukizingatia kuwa ni chini ya asilimia 15 tu ya idadi ya watu duniani inayozungumza Kiingereza kama lugha yao ya kwanza?
mt0: <pad> The wrong question, therefore, is:does this decrease mean that people are now preferring their native languages over English, given that only about 15 percent of the world's population speaks English as their first language?</s>

en: Swahili is recognized as one of the official languages of the African Union (AU), alongside English, Portuguese, French, Spanish and Arabic.
swa: Kiswahili kinatambuliwa kama mojawapo wa lugha rasmi za Umoja wa Afrika (AU), kando na Kiiengereza, Kireno, Kifaransa, Kihispania na Kiarabu.
mt0: <pad> Kiswahili is recognised as one of the official languages of the African Union (AU), along with English, Portuguese, French, Spanish and Arabic.</s>

en: Swahili is also the lingua franca for East Africa Community (EAC) member states.
swa: Kiswahili pia ni lugha ya matumizi mapana ya mataifa wanachama wa Jumuiya ya Afrika mashariki (EAC).
mt0: <pad> Kiswahili is also the widely used language of the countries of the East African Community (EAC).</s>

en: Rwanda, an EAC member, saw its lower legislative house approve a law making Swahili an official language in 2017  in addition to Kinyarwanda, French and English.
swa: Rwanda, taifa mwanachama wa EAC, kupitia bunge lake la chini, ilipitisha msuada wa kukifanya Kiswahili kuwa lugha rasmi mnamo 2017  kando na Kinyarwanda, Kifaransa na Kiingereza.
mt0: <pad> Rwanda, a member of the East African Community (EAC), through its lower house of parliament, passed a law in 2017 to make Swahili a official language alongside Kinyarwanda, French and English.</s>

en: Besides being used for administrative purposes, Swahili will be incorporated into Rwandas school curriculum.
swa: Licha ya kutumiwa kwa madhumuni ya utawala, Kiswahili kitajumuishwa kwenye mtaala wa elimu wa nchi hiyo.
mt0: <pad> Although it is used for official purposes, the language will be included in the education curriculum of the country.</s>

en: In Uganda, the government in September 2019 approved the establishment of the National Swahili Council.
swa: Nchini Uganda, mnamo Septemba 2019, serikali iliidhinisha uanzishaji wa Baraza la Kitaifa la Kiswahili.
mt0: <pad> In Uganda, in September 2019, the government approved the establishment of the National Council for Kiswahili.</s>

en: Article 6 (2) of the Constitution of Uganda also spells out that Swahili shall be the second official language in Uganda to be used in such circumstances as Parliament may by law prescribe.
swa: Kifungu cha 6 (2) cha Katiba ya Uganda pia kimeelezea kuwa Kiswahili kitakuwa lugha rasmi ya pili nchini Uganda na kitatumika katika mazingira kadri Bunge litakavyoweza kuagiza kwa sheria.
mt0: <pad> Section 6 (2) of the Ugandan Constitution also states that Kiswahili will be the second official language in Uganda and will be used in the manner as the House may determine by law.</s>

en: In 2018, South Africa, which boasts 11 official languages, formalized Swahili as an optional subject in its curriculum, starting in 2020.
swa: Mnamo 2018, Afrika Kusini, nchi inayojivunia lugha rasmi 11, ilirasimisha Kiswahili kama somo la hiari katika mtaala wake, kuanzia mwaka wa 2020.
mt0: <pad> In 2018, South Africa, a country with 11 official languages, officially recognized Swahili as an optional subject in its school curriculum, starting from 2020.</s>

en: In 2019, the Southern Africa Development Community (SADC) adopted Swahili as its fourth official language.

mt0: <pad> In 2019, the South African Development Community (SADC) adopted Kiswahili as the fourth official language of the community.</s>

en: Despite Swahili being the most widely spoken African language, with approximately 150 million speakers  mostly in East Africa, the Great Lakes region, southern Somalia, and some parts of Southern Africa, its visibility online is dismal.
swa: Licha ya kuwa lugha ya Kiafrika inayozungumzwa sana, na takribani watu milioni 150  haswa katika Afrika Mashariki, kanda ya maziwa makuu, kusini mwa Somalia, na maeneo mengine ya kusini mwa Afrika, muonekano wa Kiswahili mtandaoni ni finyu.
mt0: <pad> Although it is the most widely spoken African language, with around 150 million people mainly in East Africa, the Commonwealth of the Southern Hemisphere, south Somalia and other parts of southern Africa, its presence on the internet is limited.</s>

en: John Walubengo, a lecturer at the Multimedia University of Kenya, states in an op-ed with the Nation, a Kenyan daily, that the absence of online linguistic and cultural diversity creates a society with a tunnel-vision view of the world.
swa: John Walubengo, mhadhiri wa Chuo Kikuu cha Multimedia cha Kenya, anachanganua kwenye makala yake katika Nation, jarida la kila siku nchini Kenya, kuwa ukosefu wa lugha na utamaduni mtandaoni unaunda jamii yenye mtazamo mdogo wa dunia.
mt0: <pad> John Walubengo, a professor at Kenya's Multimedia University, suggests in his article in Nation, a daily newspaper in Kenya, that the lack of language and culture online creates a small world view.</s>

en: Walubengo predicts that most indigenous cultures end up surrendering their identities to the English way of doing things.
swa: Walubengo anaelezea kuwa tamaduni nyingi za kiasili huishia kusalimisha utambulisho wao kwa hali za Kiingereza za ufanyaji mambo.
mt0: <pad> Walubengo explains that many indigenous cultures end up losing their identity by adopting English-style ways of doing things.</s>

en: This sad reality can only be reversed if indigenous civilizations fight to retain their identities both online and offline, he says.
swa: Ukweli huu wa kusikitisha hata hivyo unaweza kubadilishwa tu iwapo jamii asilia zitapigania kuhifadhi utambulisho wao mtandaoni na vile vile nje ya mtandao, anasema.
mt0: <pad> This sad reality can however only be changed if the original communities fight to keep their identity online and also off the internet, he says.</s>

en: But all is not gloom and doom.
swa: Hata hivyo, yote si ya kutamausha.
mt0: <pad> However, it's not all to be complained about.</s>

en: There are some dedicated organizations at the forefront of promoting and developing Swahili online.

en: (ICANN), a global multi-stakeholder organization that coordinates Internet Domain Name System (DNS), Internet Protocol (IP) addresses and autonomous system numbers, instituted the Internationalized Domain Names (IDNs) that enable people to use domain names in local languages and scripts.
swa: (ICANN),  shirika la kimataifa lenye wadau wengi linaloratibu Mfumo wa Majina ya Mtandao(DNS), Anwani za Mtandao (IP) na nambari za mfumo huru, lilianzisha Majina ya Kikoa ya Kimataifa (IDNs), yanayowezesha watu kutumia majina ya kikoa katika lugha na maandishi ya kiasili.Kiuhakika, huundwa kwa kutumia herufi kutoka maandishi tofauti, kama vile Kiarabu, Kichina, au Kisiriliki.
mt0: <pad> (ICANN), the international multi-party organization that coordinates the Domain Name System (DNS), Internet Addresses (IP) and free system numbers, has established International Domain Names (IDNs), which allow people to use domain names in native language and script. In fact, they are created by using characters from different script, such as Arabic, Chinese, or Greek.</s>

en: Ideally, they are formed using characters from different scripts, such as Arabic, Chinese, or Cyrillic.These are then encoded by the Unicode standard and used as allowed by relevant IDN protocols, a set of standards defined by the Internet Architecture Board (IAB), and its subsidiary groups; the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) and the Internet Research Task Force (IRTF).
swa: Herufi hizi kisha husimbwa na kiwango cha Unicode na kutumiwa kama inavyoruhusiwa na vikoa vya IDN, seti ya viwango vilivyoainishwa na Bodi ya Usanifu wa Mtandao (IAB), na vikundi vyake vya kampuni ndogo; Tume ya Kazi ya Uhandisi wa Mtandao (IETF) na Tume ya Utafiti wa Mtandao (IRTF).
mt0: <pad> These characters are then embedded into Unicode and used as permitted by the IDN regions, a set of standards established by the Internet Advertising Board (IAB), and its smaller companies; the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) and the Internet Research and Technology Foundation (IRTF).</s>

en: UASG is a community-based team of industry leaders, supported by ICANN, that prepares online communities for the next billion internet users.

en: This is achieved through a process known as Universal Acceptance (UA) that ensures that internet applications and systems treat all top-level domains (TLDs) and emails based on those domains in a consistent manner  including those in non-Latin-based languages and those that are more than three characters long.
swa: Huku kunafanikishwa kupitia mchakato unaojulikana kama Ukubalikaji Ulimwenguni (UA), ambao huhakikisha kwamba programu na mifumo ya mtandao inashughulikia vikoa vyote vya viwango cha juu (TLDs) na barua pepe kulingana na vikoa hivyo kwa njia thabiti  pamoja na vile vilivyoko kwenye maandishi yasiyo ya Kilatini na vile ambavyo ni zaidi ya herufi tatu.
mt0: <pad> This is achieved through a process called Globalization (GA), which ensures that software and network systems handle all top level domains (TLDs) and email addresses based on those domains in a consistent way including those in non-Latin characters and those that are more than three characters.</s>

en: UA serves digital natives around the world in their local languages and with domain names that better align with their cultural identities.

en: Matogoro Jabhera, KCN founder and lecturer at the University of Dodoma, Tanzania, told Global Voices in a Skype call, that he believes that local content provides an incentive for more [of the] offline population to get online because they can relate with their local news [] compared to the current situation where most contents are in the English language.

en: Therefore, a lack of sufficient local content could have adverse effects as far as digital inclusion.

mt0: <pad> Accordingly, this will affect digital rights in particular, internet access, right to access information online, and the right to use their native language to create, share, and disseminate information and knowledge through the Internet.</s>

en: It is thus vital to put in place formidable action plans that will foster the development of ICT applications and services, as well as the use of local languages, to guarantee digital inclusion for all.

en: This, complemented by actions such as localization of digital training and learning materials, and rural ICT literacy programs, is likely to spur a digital revolution, hence promoting digital rights of internet users and bridging the digital divide.

en: The activists will tweet in African languages like Bambara, Igbo, Khoekhoe, N|uu, Swahili, Yorùbá, in addition to French and English.
swa: Wanaharakati hao watatwiti kwa lugha za ki-Afrika kama vile ki-Bambara, ki-Igbo, ki-Khoekhoe, ki-N|uu, ki-Swahili, ki-Yorùbá, sambamba na ki-Faransa na ki-Ingereza.
mt0: <pad> The activists will tweet in African languages such as Bambara, Igbo, Khoekhoe, N|uu, Swahili, Yoruba, as well as French and English.</s>

en: They will also share their personal experiences and insights using a language lens on challenges and threats to digital rights.
swa: Pia wataweza kutushirikisha uzoefu na uelewa wao binafsi kwa mtazamo wa lugha kuhusu changamoto zinazotishia haki za kidijitali.
mt0: <pad> They can also share their experience and knowledge with us from a language perspective about the problems that are threatening digital rights.</s>

en: The conversations will interrogate how threats to net neutrality marginalize digital content in African languages; the expansion of mis- and disinformation in African languages on various digital platforms and what companies or civil society are doing about it; the effects of a lack of affordable internet connectivity in places where there are large communities of speakers of an African language; the importance of and challenges for the right to access information in digital spaces in African languages.
swa: Mazungumzo hayo yatahoji namna gani tishio la kutoegemea upande wowote mtandaoni linavyoathiri maudhui ya mtandaoni kwenye lugha za Kiafrika; uenezaji wa taarifa potovu katika lugha za Kiafrika kwenye lugha tofauti mtandaoni na kile kinachofanywa na makampuni au mashirika ya kijamii kuhusiana na hili; athari za ukosekanaji wa mtandao wa bei nafuu katika maeneo yaliyo na jamii kubwa za wazungumzaji wa lugha ya Kiafrika; umuhimu wa na changamoto za haki ya kupata taarifa katika lugha za kidijitali a Kiafrika.
mt0: <pad> The discussions will address how the threat of unilateralism affects online content in African languages; the dissemination of false information in African languages on different languages online and what companies or social organizations do about this; the effects of the lack of cheap internet access in areas with large African-speaking communities; the importance and challenges of access to information in digital African languages;</s>

en: They will also look at corporate policies, as well as ongoing challenges that may affect how citizens can freely express themselves in their language.
swa: Vile vile, wataangazia suala la sera za mashirika, na pia changamoto zinazoendelea kuwepo zenye uwezo wa kuathiri jinsi raia wanavyoweza kujielezea huru katika lugha yao.
mt0: <pad> They will also address the issue of organizational policies, and also the ongoing difficulties that can affect the way citizens can freely express themselves in their own language.</s>

en: In the early morning of November 15, 2017, Zimbabweans woke up to the news that former strongman, the late Robert Mugabe, had been deposed in a coup d'etat, and was under house arrest with his family at the presidential residence, State House.
swa: Mapema asubuhi ya Novemba 15, 2017, raia wa Zimbabwe waliamka na habari zilizoenea kwamba aliyekuwa mbabe, marehemu Robert Mugabe, alikuwa amengolewa madarakani katika mapinduzi ya serikali, na alikuwa nguvuni kwenye makazi yake, Ikulu, pamoja na familia yake.
mt0: <pad> Early in the morning of November 15, 2017, Zimbabweans awoke to widespread news that the former leader, Robert Mugabe, had been removed from power in a coup d'état, and was held in his home, the Embassy, with his family.</s>

en: Major General Sibusiso Moyo, now foreign affairs minister, announced on state television that the president was safe under state custody and that the situation has moved to another level.
swa: Meja Jenerali Sibusiso Moyo, ambaye kwa sasa ni waziri wa mambo ya nje, alitangaza kwenye runinga ya taifa kuwa rais huyo alikuwa salama chini ya ulinzi wa serikali na kwamba hali ya mambo iko katika ngazi nyingine.
mt0: <pad> General Sibusiso Moyo, who is now the foreign minister, announced on national television that the president was safe under government protection and that the situation was at another level.</s>

en: Almost immediately following General Moyos announcement, Zimbabweans fervently took to social media  in particular, WhatsApp, Twitter and Facebook  to get updates on the situation.
swa: Mara tu baada ya tangazo hilo la Jenerali Moyo, raia wa Zimbabwe walimiminika kwa msisimko mkubwa kwenye mitandao ya kijamii  hasa WhatsApp, Twitter na Facebook  ili kupata taarifa mpya kuhusu hali hiyo.
mt0: <pad> Just after the announcement by General Moyo, Zimbabweans rushed to social media especially WhatsApp, Twitter and Facebook to get new information about the situation.</s>

en: This newfound popularity of social media to access information and mobilise protests took root for the first time among Zimbabweans, when protesters took to the streets and helped push Mugabe out of office.
swa: Kwa mara ya kwanza, umaarufu mpya wa mitandao ya kijamii kuwezesha kupata habari na kuhamasisha maandamano ulimea mizizi miongoni mwa raia wa Zimbabwe, wakati waandamanaji walipoingia mitaani na kusaidia kushinikiza kuondolewa kwa Mugabe madarakani.
mt0: <pad> For the first time, the new popularity of social media to facilitate information and organize protests took root among Zimbabweans, as protesters went onto the streets and helped push Mugabe out of power.</s>

en: The new government, led by Emmerson Dambudzo Mnangagwa, took notice of social medias power.
swa: Serikali mpya, iliyoongozwa na Emmerson Dambudzo Mnangagwa,ilingamua mara nguvu ya  mitandao ya kijamii.
mt0: <pad> The new government, led by Emmerson Dambudzo Mnangagwa, would have used social media more than any other government.</s>

en: As a former state security minister, Mnangagwa also appreciated the importance and value of disinformation in Zimbabwes political terrain.
swa: Kama waziri wa zamani wa usalama wa nchi, Mnangagwa pia alitambua umuhimu na nafasi ya  upotoshaji taarifa katika nyanja za kisiasa za Zimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> As former minister of national security, Mnangagwa also recognized the importance and role of information defamation in the politics of Zimbabwe.</s>

en: In a calculated move to consolidate newfound political power and ensure an electoral victory during the presidential and legislative elections scheduled for next year, Mnangagwa instructed his ruling ZANU PF (Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front) party youth league to enter the social media and online firmament and batter the opponent, back in March 2018.
swa: Mnamo mwezi Machi, 2018, kwa kutambua mara na ili kujitwalia mamlaka ya kisiasa yaliyojianika mbele yake na ili kuhakikisha ushindi katika uchaguzi wa rais na wabunge katika mwaka uliofuatia, Mnangagwa aliamuru umoja wa vijana wa chama tawala cha  ZANU PF (Zimbabwe National Union-Patriotic Front) kujimwaga katika mitandao ya kijamii na mtandaoni na kuwachafua na kuwashambulia wapinzani.
mt0: <pad> In March 2018, aware of the political power that was already in his grasp and to secure victory in the next presidential and legislative elections, Mnangagwa commanded the ZANU PF young wing to get into social media and online and denigrate and attack opponents.</s>

en: In post-Mugabe Zimbabwe, this has exacerbated a mis- and disinformation crisis, leaving Zimbabweans with few credible and accurate sources of information to stay informed about the countrys transition and and anti-government protests.
swa: Katika Zimbabwe baada ya Mugabe, mpango wake huu umeimarisha mgogoro wa upotoshaji na utoaji taarifa zisizo za kweli, na hivyo kuwaacha Wazimbabwe na vyanzo vichache tu vya kuaminika vya kupata habari na kujua kuhusu yanayoendelea katika kipindi cha mpito na maandamano ya kupinga serikali.
mt0: <pad> In the post-Mugabe Zimbabwe, this plan has intensified the problem of misinformation and false information, leaving Zimbabweans with only a few reliable sources to get information and know about what's happening in the transitional period and the protests against the government.</s>

en: While the new government decried fake news pertaining to any news circulated on social media that they perceived to threaten the countrys status quo, it also deployed tactics aimed at misleading the public about its handling of anti-government protests.
swa: Wakati ambapo serikali mpya ilijidai kulaani habari za uongo  kwa taarifa zilizosambazwa kwenye mitandao ya kijamii na ambazo waliziona kuwa tishio utawala ulio madarakani,  pia ilifanya hila ilikuupotosha umma kuhusu namna ilivyoshughulika na maandamano ya kuipinga serikali.
mt0: <pad> While the new government pretended to condemn fake news for what it saw as threats to the current government, it also made a plot to mislead the public about how it dealt with the protests against the government.</s>

en: Zimbabwe has witnessed a significant rise in mobile internet and social media usage over the past few years.
swa: Zimbabwe imeshuhudia ongezeko kubwa la matumizi ya intaneti kwenye simu za mkononi na mitandao ya kijamii katika miaka michache iliyopita.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe has seen a large increase in the use of internet on mobile phones and social media in the past few years.</s>

en: The internet penetration rate increased by 41.1 percent, from 11 percent of the population to 52.1 percent between 2010 and 2018, while mobile phone penetration increased by 43.8 percent from 58.8 percent to 102.7 percent over the same period.
swa: Kiwango cha kuenea kwa intaneti kiliongezeka kwa asilimia 41.1, kutoka asilimia 11 ya idadi ya watu hadi asilimia 52.1 kati ya 2010 na 2018, wakati kuenea kwa simu za mkononi kuliongezeka kwa asilimia 43.8 kutoka asilimia 58.8 hadi asilimia 102.7 kwa kipindi hicho hicho.
mt0: <pad> The percentage of internet access increased by 41.1 percent, from 11 percent of the population to 52.1 percent between 2010 and 2018, while mobile phone access increased by 43.8 percent from 58.8 percent to 102.7 percent for the same period.</s>

en: This means that half the population is now connected to the internet, compared to only 11 percent in 2010.
swa: Hii inamaanisha kuwa nusu ya idadi ya watu sasa imeunganishwa na intaneti, ikilinganishwa na asilimia 11 tu katika mwaka 2010.
mt0: <pad> This means half of the population is now connected to the internet, compared with just 11% in 2010.</s>

en: However, mis- and disinformation have found fertile ground to flourish owing to a variety of factors: extreme polarisation in the media, proposed government controls over social media, poor official communication methods and low digital literacy among internet users.
swa: Hata hivyo, upotoshaji na utoaji taarifa za uongo nao vimepata mazingira ya kushamiri kwa sababu kadhaa: mgawanyiko mkubwa katika vyombo vya habari, mapendekezo ya serikali kudhibiti mitandao ya kijamii, njia hafifu za mawasiliano rasmi na na elimu duni miongoni mwa watumiaji wa intaneti.
mt0: <pad> However, misinformation and false information have also found the environment to thrive for several reasons: widespread divisions in the media, government proposals to control social media, weak official communication and poor internet education among Internet users.</s>

en: During the anti-government protests of January 2019, when state security forces arrested and beat hundreds of protesters, news of these clampdowns competed with government claims of fake news or their absolute denial.
swa: Wakati wa maandamano dhidi ya serikali ya Januari 2019, kipindi vikosi vya usalama vya serikali vilipowakamata na kuwashambulia mamia ya waandamanaji, habari za ukandamizaji huu zilishindana na madai ya serikali kwamba zilikuwa habari za uongo au pale ilipokanusha kabisa kuwepo kwake.
mt0: <pad> During the anti-government protests of January 2019, when government security forces arrested and attacked dozens of protesters, news of this repression was challenged by government claims that it was fake news or when it denied its existence.</s>

en: The government restricted access to internet services to disrupt the flow of information and contribute to widespread confusion.
swa: Serikali ilizuia upatikanaji wa huduma za intaneti ili kuvuruga mtiririko wa habari na hivyo kuleta mkanganyiko mkubwa.
mt0: <pad> The government blocked access to internet services to disrupt the flow of information and thus create great confusion.</s>

en: They and their supporters also resorted to public misinformation about the protests and discredited any truthful information or reports as fake news.
swa: Viongozi wa serikali na wafuasi wao pia walitumia mbinu ya kupotosha taarifa kuhusu maandamano hayo na kupenyeza mashaka katika taarifa zozote zilizokuwa za weli kwa kuzipachika jina la habari za uongo.
mt0: <pad> The government leaders and their followers also used techniques to mislead about the protests and instill doubt in any true news by labeling it as fake news.</s>

en: In Zimbabwe, citizens usually regard general statements issued by government ministers as official policy.
swa: Kwa kawaida, nchini Zimbabwe,  raia huzichukulia taarifa zozote zitolewazo na mawaziri wa serikali kama ndio sahihi.
mt0: <pad> In Zimbabwe, people usually take any statement made by government ministers as true.</s>

en: For example, Deputy Information Minister Energy Mutodi sought to convince people that everything was normal and that videos and images of the military patrolling the streets were the work of a few rogue individuals.
swa: Kwa mfano, Naibu Waziri wa Habari Energy Mutodi alijitokeza kuwashawishi watu kuwa kila kitu kilikuwa shwari na kwamba video na picha za wanajeshi waliokuwa wakipiga doria mitaani zilitengenezwa na wahuni wachache.
mt0: <pad> For example, the deputy minister of information Energy Mutodi went on to convince people that everything was fine and that videos and pictures of soldiers patroling the streets were made by a few bandits.</s>

en: Mutodi further misled the nation when he claimed on state television that there was no internet shutdown but rather a congested network.
swa: Mutodi alizidi kupotosha taifa pale alipodai kwenye runinga ya taifa kwamba hakukuwepo na uzimwaji wa intaneti bali kulikuwa na msongamano katika mtandao.
mt0: <pad> Mutodi continued to mislead the nation when he claimed on national television that there was no internet blackout but there was a network overload.</s>

en: In another suspected case of possible government-sanctioned disinformation, millions of people remained cut off from social media during the January protests.

mt0: <pad> In another case of alleged government-backed media defamation, millions of people were blocked from social media during the January protests.</s>

mt0: <pad> Some downloaded tools from a Virtual Private Network (VPN) service to stay informed, however a warning was spread that downloading such tools would lead to arrest, which increased the fear and panic.</s>

en: When in March 2019, Human Rights Watch (HRW) tweeted a report denouncing the governments use of horrific violence during the January 2019 protests, government supporters took to Twitter to discredit and attack HRW.

mt0: <pad> In March 2019, when Human Rights Watch (HRW) posted a tweet that condemned the use of horrific government brutality to control the January 2019 protests, government supporters used Twitter to denigrate and attack HRW.</s>

mt0: <pad> One user tweeted that the organization was spreading openly lies and called it a modern imperialist organization with the mission of pressuring uninjured countries to serve the imperialist American objectives.</s>

en: And disinformation about government policies and other events of public interest have continued well beyond the January protests.
swa: Na upotoshaji kuhusu sera za serikali na matukio mengine yenye maslahi ya umma zimeendelea kukithiri baada ya maandamano ya Januari.
mt0: <pad> And misinformation about government policies and other public interest events has continued to rise after the January protests.</s>

en: Most recently, ruling party ZANU PF members took to Twitter to misinform the public about the disappearance of Dr. Peter Magombey, acting president of the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association (ZHDA).
swa: Hivi karibuni, wanachama wa chama tawala cha ZANU PF walitumia mtandao wa Twita kuupotosha umma kuhusu kutoweka kwa Dk.Peter Magombey, ambaye ni kaimu Rais wa Chama cha Madaktari wa Hospitali za Zimbabwe (ZHDA).
mt0: <pad> Last week, members of the ruling party ZANU PF used Twitter to misinform the public about the disappearance of Dr. Peter Magombey, who is the acting president of the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association (ZHDA).</s>

en: Media control in Zimbabwe bears its origins in colonial policies of the 20th century, which were tainted with violent subjugation to political authority.
swa: Udhibiti wa vyombo vya habari nchini Zimbabwe una chimbuko katika sera za kikoloni za karne ya 20, ambao ulitiwa doa kwa matumizi ya nguvu ili kunyongonyeza mbele ya mamlaka za kisiasa.
mt0: <pad> The media control in Zimbabwe has its origins in the 20th century colonial policy, which was criticized for using force to subdue the press to the political powers.</s>

en: The Ian Smith-led Rhodesian government valued propaganda and centralised information control as a weapon of choice, not only to endorse the regimes believed legitimacy but to spread disinformation about the war.
swa: Serikali ya Rhodhesia iliyoongozwa na Ian Smith ilijikita katika propaganda na kudhibiti habari kama silaha yake bora zaidi, sio tu kuunga uhalali wa serikali hiyo bali pia kueneza taarifa potovu kuhusu vita.
mt0: <pad> The Rhodesia government led by Ian Smith focused on propaganda and information control as its best weapon, not only to support the legitimacy of the government but also to spread false information about the war.</s>

en: The colonial government passed a plethora of laws to suppress free expression or dissent against Smiths racist policies and they brutally enforced these laws to target liberation leaders.
swa: Serikali ya kikoloni ilipitisha idadi kubwa ya sheria za kukandamiza kujieleza au kupinga sera za kibaguzi za Smith na ilitekeleza sheria hizi kwa ukatili mno kuwalenga viongozi wa ukombozi.
mt0: <pad> The colonial government passed a number of laws to suppress the right to express or protest against Smith's racial policy and it executed these laws with great brutality against the leaders of the freedom movement.</s>

en: Information blockades were the norm even before independence in 1980, and this set the government's tone in terms of communication policies and media management for years to come.
swa: Udhibiti wa habari ilikuwa hali ya kawaida kabla ya uhuru mwaka wa 1980, na hali hii iliweka mfano wa serikali katika suala la sera za mawasiliano na usimamizi wa vyombo vya habari kwa miaka mingi iliyofuatia.
mt0: <pad> Information control was common before the 1980s independence, and this situation set the government's example in terms of communication and media policy for many years afterwards.</s>

en: During the 2016 general elections, Ugandan authorities resorted to shutting down entire social media platforms twice.
