en: The first shutdown took place on February 18, 2016, on the eve of the presidential election, and it affected social media platforms and mobile money services.
swa: Ufungwaji wa kwanza ulitekelezwa mnamo Februari 18, 2016, wakati wa mkesha wa uchaguzi wa urais, na uliathiri majukwaa ya mitandao ya kijamii na huduma za kutuma pesa kwa njia ya simu.
mt0: <pad> The first restrictions were implemented on February 18, 2016, during the run-up to the presidential election, and affected social media platforms and mobile money services.</s>

en: The restrictions lasted for four full days.

mt0: <pad> The blockade lasted for a total of four days.</s>

en: On May 11, 2016, social media platforms including Facebook, WhatsApp and Twitter and mobile money transfer services were once again blocked.
swa: Mnamo Mei 11, 2016, majukwaa ya mitandao ya kijamii, ikiwemo Facebook, WhatsApp na Twita na huduma za kutuma pesa kwa njia ya simu zilifungwa kwa mara nyingine.
mt0: <pad> On May 11, 2016, social media platforms, including Facebook, WhatsApp and Twitter and mobile money transfer services were again blocked.</s>

en: This shutdown lasted for one day and took place a day before President Museveni was sworn in for his fifth term as president.

en: Opposition to his rule is growing: According to a public opinion poll released in April 2019, an overall majority of Ugandans opposed a 2017 decision to remove the maximum age limit of 75 to run for president, which would allow the 74-year-old to run again in the 2021 elections.
swa: Upinzani dhidi ya uongozi wake unaimarika: Kulingana na kura ya maoni iliyotolewa mnamo Aprili 2019, idadi ya Waganda wengi inapinga uamuzi wa 2017 wa kuondoa kigezo cha umri wa 75 waa kugombea urais, ambacho kingeweza kumruhusu rais huyo mwenye umri wa miaka 74 kuwania tena katika uchaguzi wa 2021.
mt0: <pad> Criticism of his presidency is growing: According to an opinion poll conducted in April 2019, most Ugandans oppose his decision in 2017 to remove the 75-year age limit for presidential candidates, which could allow the 74-year-old president to run for re-election in 2021.</s>

en: During both shutdowns in 2016, the Ugandan government cited national security as the motivation behind restrictions.
swa: Wakati wa matukio yote ya ufungwaji mwaka 2016, serikali ya Uganda ilitaja kuwa sababu ilikuwa ni usalama wa kitaifa ili kudhibiti mtandao.
mt0: <pad> When all the shutdowns in 2016, the government of Uganda stated that the reason was national security to control the internet.</s>

en: The disruptions were ordered by Ugandas security agencies and the Uganda Communications Commission (UCC), which regulates the telecommunications sector, online publications, broadcasting (both radio and television), film industry, postal and courier services.
swa: Uvurugwaji uliagizwa na vyombo vya usalama vya Uganda na Tume ya Mawasiliano ya Uganda (UCC), ambayo inasimamia sekta ya mawasiliano, machapisho ya mtandaoni, utangazaji (wote redio na runinga), tasnia ya filamu, huduma za posta, usambazaji barua na vifurushi.
mt0: <pad> The attack was launched by the Ugandan security forces and the Communications Commission of Uganda (UCC), which oversees the communication sector, online publications, broadcasting (both radio and television), film industry, postal services, mail delivery and parcel distribution.</s>

en: On February 18, 2016, MTN Uganda, a telecommunications service provider, issued a statement on Twitter confirming that UCC, the regulator had directed MTN to disable all social media and mobile money services due to a threat to public order and safety.
swa: Mnamo Februari 18, 2016, MTN Uganda, mtoa huduma ya mawasiliano ya simu na mtandao, ilitoa taarifa kwenye Twita ikithibitisha kwamba UCC, ilikuwa imeiagiza MTN kufunga huduma zote za mitandao ya kijamii na huduma za kutuma pesa kwa njia ya simu kwa sababu ya tishio la kiusalama kwa umma.
mt0: <pad> On February 18, 2016, MTN Uganda, a mobile and internet service provider, posted a tweet confirming that the UCC had instructed MTN to shut down all social media and money transfer services for the purpose of protecting public security.</s>

en: This also affected other telecoms companies such as Airtel, Smile, Vodafone, and Africel.

mt0: <pad> The order also affected other mobile phone companies such as Airtel, Smile, Vodafone, and Africel.</s>

en: The same day, President Museveni told journalists that he ordered the blocking of social media: Steps must be taken for security to stop so many getting in trouble, it is temporary because some people use those pathways for telling lies, he said.
swa: Siku hiyo hiyo, Rais Museveni aliwaambia waandishi wa habari kwamba aliamuru kufungwa kwa mitandao ya kijamii: Hatua lazima zichukuliwe kwa ajili ya usalama kuzuia watu wengi kujiingiza kwenye taabu, ni kwa muda mfupi kwa sababu watu wengine hutumia njia hizo kusema uongo, alisema.
mt0: <pad> The same day, President Museveni told journalists that he had ordered the ban on social media: "Measures must be taken for security to prevent many people from getting into trouble, it's for a short time because some people use these tools to lie," he said.</s>

en: On March 17, in an official declaration during Supreme Court deliberations in which President Musevenis 2016 victory was challenged, the UCC executive director Godfrey Mutabazi explained that he received instructions from the Inspector General of Police, Kale Kayihura, to shut down social media networking sites and mobile money facilities owing to security concerns.
swa: Mnamo Machi 17, katika tamko rasmi wakati wa maamuzi ya Mahakama Kuu ambako ushindi wa Rais Museveni ulipingwa, mkurugenzi mtendaji wa UCC, Godfrey Mutabazi alielezea kwamba alipokea maagizo kutoka kwa Inspekta Jenerali wa Polisi, Kale Kayihura, kufunga tovuti za mitandao ya kijamii na huduma za kutuma pesa kwa njia ya simu kwa sababu za kiusalama.
mt0: <pad> On March 17, in a formal statement during the High Court ruling where President Museveni's victory was challenged, the executive director of UCC, Godfrey Mutabazi, revealed that he had received instructions from the Inspector General of Police, Kale Kayihura, to close social media sites and mobile money transfer services for security reasons.</s>

en: These shutdowns interfered with the rights and daily lives of Ugandans who use the internet and social media platforms to access information, express views and conduct everyday business online.
swa: Kufungwa huku kuliingilia haki na maisha ya kila siku ya Waganda wanaotumia mtandao na majukwa ya mitandao ya kijamii kupata habari, kuelezea maoni na kufanya biashara zao za kila siku.
mt0: <pad> The ban has affected the rights and daily lives of Ugandans who use the internet and social media to get information, express their opinion and do their daily business.</s>

en: During the weeks prior to the 2016 elections, Ugandans actively tweeted and debated about the elections using hashtags like #UgandaDecides and #UGDebate16.
swa: Majuma kabla ya uchaguzi wa 2016, Waganda walijitolea sana kuchapisha na kujadili kuhusu uchaguzi huo kwa kutumia kibwagizo cha #UgandaDecides na # UGDebate16.
mt0: <pad> weeks before the 2016 election, Ugandans have been actively posting and debating about the election using the hashtags #UgandaDecides and #UGDebate16</s>

en: Ugandan citizens level of online civic engagement was sparked by the first-ever televised presidential debates, the first of which was held in January and the second, a week later.
swa: Kiwango cha Waganda cha ushiriki wa raia kwenye mtandao kilichochewa na midahalo ya rais ya kwanza  kabisa kuwahi kurushwa na runinga, wa kwanza ambao ulifanyika mnamo Januari na wa pili, wiki moja baadaye.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandan level of civic participation on the Internet was boosted by the first televised presidential debates, the first in January and the second, a week later.</s>

en: Even with the social media bans in place, many Ugandans continued to post about the elections using Virtual Private Networks or VPNs.
swa: Licha ya ufungwaji wa mitandao ya kijamii, Waganda wengi waliendelea kutuma taarifa kuhusu uchaguzi kwa kutumia anwani ya mtandao binafsi inayofahamika kama VPN.
mt0: <pad> Although social media was blocked, many Ugandans continued to send information about the election by using a private network address known as VPN.</s>

en: On election day, citizens were able to share updates on late arrivals of voting materials at various stations, reports of election malpractice, and provisional election results on social media.
swa: Siku ya uchaguzi, raia waliweza kushiriki yaliyokuwa yanajiri kuhusu kucheleweshwa kwa vifaa vya kupiga kura katika vituo mbali mbali, visa vya udanganyifu katika uchaguzi, na matokeo ya muda ya uchanguzi kwenye mitandao ya kijamii.
mt0: <pad> On the day of the election, citizens were able to share information about delays in voting equipment at different stations, cases of fraud in the election, and the early election results on social media.</s>

en: Human rights activists say that targeted shutdowns during election periods slow down communication, just when access to information and citizen expression are most needed.
swa: Wanaharakati wa haki za binadamu wanasema kwamba ufungwaji wa kimkakati wakati wa uchaguzi hupunguza kasi ya mawasiliano, wakati tu upatikanaji wa habari na usemi wa raia unahitajika sana.
mt0: <pad> Human rights activists say that strategic closures during the election slow communication, when only access to information and the voice of the people is so important.</s>

en: Internet shutdowns limit people from communicating particular concerns that affect them, such as health, interaction with friends as well sharing of political views and opinions, Moses Owiny, the chief executive of the Center for Multilateral Affairs, an independent platform for policy analysis operating in Uganda and Tanzania, told Global Voices in an interview.
swa: Kufungwa kwa mtandao kunazuia watu kuzungumzia mambo fulani yanayowaathiri, kama vile afya, mwingiliano na marafiki na pia kubadilishana maoni ya kisiasa, Moses Owiny, afisa mkuu wa the Center for Multilateral Affairs, jukwaa huru la uchambuzi wa sera linalofanya shughuli nchini Uganda na Tanzania, aliiambia  Global Voices katika mahojiano.
mt0: <pad> The internet censorship has stopped people from discussing certain issues that affect them, such as health, social interactions with friends and also political opinion, Moses Owiny, the director of the Center for Multilateral Affairs, an independent policy analysis platform that works in Uganda and Tanzania, told Global Voices in an interview.</s>

en: According to Owiny, shutdowns primarily aim to stop dissent in politics based on perceived fear by the state that citizens views and concerns are likely to incite the public, an accusation he believes is unfounded and not grounded in reality but assumptions.
swa: Kwa mujibu wa Owiny, ufungwaji hukusudia kuzuia upinzani katika siasa kwa misingi ya hofu ya serikali kwamba maoni ya raia yanaweza kuchochea umma, madai ambayo anaamini hayana msingi kiuhakika ila ni ya kudhaniwa.
mt0: <pad> According to Owiny, the ban is meant to prevent political opposition on the basis of the government's fear that the views of citizens can provoke the public, a charge he believes does not have any real basis but is simply a hypothetical one.</s>

swa: Historia ya Uganda kufunga majukwaa ya mitandaoni na tovuti
mt0: <pad> The history of Uganda to close internet platforms and websites</s>

en: On April 14, 2011, the UCC instructed ISPs to temporarily block access to Facebook and Twitter for 24 hours to eliminate connecting and sharing information.
swa: Mnamo Aprili 14, 2011, UCC iliagiza watoa huduma za mtandao (ISPs) kufunga kwa muda ufikiaji kwa Facebook na Twitter kwa saa 24 ili kuondoa uunganishwaji na ubadilishanaji habari.
mt0: <pad> On April 14, 2011, UCC instructed Internet Service Providers (ISPs) to temporarily close access to Facebook and Twitter for 24 hours to prevent the linking and information exchange.</s>

en: The order came in the heat of opposition-led walk to work protests over rising fuel and food prices.
swa: Agizo hilo lilitolewa wakati wa maandamano motomoto ya walk to work yaliyoongozwa na upinzani kufuatia kupanda kwa bei ya mafuta na chakula.
mt0: <pad> The order was issued during a fierce walk to work protest led by the opposition after the rise in oil and food prices.</s>

en: The regulator stated that security agencies requested the block to minimize social media use in order to prevent violence.
swa: Mamlaka hiyo ya mawasiliano ilisema kwamba vyombo vya usalama viliomba ufungwaji wa matumizi ya mitandao ya kijamii ili kuzuia vurugu.
mt0: <pad> The communication authority said that security agencies requested the ban on social media to prevent violence.</s>

en: In 2011, the elections were marked with SMS filtration that contained certain words including Egypt, bullet and people power.
swa: Mnamo mwaka wa 2011, uchaguzi ulikumbwa na uchujwaji wa ujumbe mfupi (SMS) wenye maneno fulani yakiwemo Egypt, bullet na people power.
mt0: <pad> In 2011, the election was affected by a spate of SMS with words such as Egypt, bullet and people power.</s>

en: In the lead up to the 2006 elections, the UCC instructed ISPs to block access to the website of Radio Katwe for publishing malicious and false information against the ruling National Resistance Movement and its presidential candidate, according to a 2015 ICT policy briefing by Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA).
swa: Kuelekea uchaguzi mkuu wa 2006, UCC iliagiza watoa huduma za mtandao (ISPs) kuzuia upatikanaji wa wavuti ya Radio Katwe kwa kuchapisha habari mbovu na za uongo dhidi ya chama tawala cha National Resistance Movement na mgombea wake wa urais, kwa mujibu wa chapisho la sera ya tehama la 2015 la Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA).
mt0: <pad> Before the 2006 general election, UCC instructed internet service providers (ISPs) to ban access to Radio Katwe's website for publishing bad and false information about the ruling National Resistance Movement and its presidential candidate, according to the 2015 policy paper of the Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA).</s>

en: Ugandan authorities blocked access to the radio station and the Daily Monitor website for publishing independently tallied election results.
swa: Mamlaka ya Uganda ilizuia upatikanaji wa matangazo ya kituo hicho cha redio na wavuti wa the Daily Monitor kwa kuchapisha matokeo huru ya uchaguzi.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandan authorities have blocked access to the station's radio and the Daily Monitor website for publishing independent election results.</s>

en: Media platforms were quickly reinstated but only after the electoral commission announced official results.

mt0: <pad> Bobi Wine is currently facing a criminal charge for insulting the president and if convicted, he will not be allowed to run for election.</s>

en: According to Human Rights Watch, in 2018 authorities targeted six opposition members including Bobi Wine and Francis Zaake, ahead of the August 15 by-elections in Arua (northern Uganda).
swa: Kwa mujibu wa Human Rights Watch, mnamo 2018 utawala uliwalilenga wabunge sita wa upinzani wakiwemo Bobi Wine na Francis Zaake, kabla ya uchaguzi mdogo wa Agosti 15 huko Arua (kaskazini mwa Uganda).

en: That same day, police also arrested two journalists, Herber Zziwa and Ronald Muwanga, as they covered the by-election and related violence, including the deadly shooting by the military of Bobi Wines driver.
swa: Siku hiyo hiyo, polisi pia waliwakamata waandishi wa habari wawili, Herber Zziwa na Ronald Muwanga, walipokuwa wakiripoti kuhusu uchaguzi na vurugu zilizohusiana na uchaguzi huo, ikiwemo mauaji mabaya ya kufyatuliwa risasi dereva wa Bobi Wine yaliyotekelezwa na jeshi.
mt0: <pad> The same day, police also arrested two journalists, Herber Zziwa and Ronald Muwanga, while they were reporting on the election and the election-related violence, including the horrific shooting of Bobi Wine's driver by the troops.</s>

en: As the 2021 election approaches, Uganda authorities are very likely to continue to crack down on political dissent, including through social media shutdowns.
swa: Wakati uchaguzi wa 2021 unapokaribia, kuna uwezekano mkubwa kuwa utawala wa Uganda utaendeleza ukandamizaji wa wapinzani, ikiwa ni pamoja na kufunga mitandao ya kijamii.
mt0: <pad> As the 2021 election nears, it is very likely that the Ugandan government will continue to repress opposition, including closing social media.</s>

en: In fact, since the 2016 elections, there has been no change in the legal framework that allows the government to restrict the rights to freedom of expression and access to information online.
swa: Kwa kweli, tangu uchaguzi wa 2016, hakujakuwepo na mabadiliko katika mfumo wa kisheria ambao unaruhusu serikali kuzuia haki ya uhuru wa kujieleza na ufikiaji wa habari mtandaoni.
mt0: <pad> In fact, since the 2016 election, there has been no change in the legal system that allows the government to restrict the right to free speech and access to information online.</s>

en: According to the 2016 State of Internet Freedom in Africa report,  the 2013 Communications Act gives UCC broad powers and functions under Section 5 that permits the communications regulator to monitor, inspect, license, supervise, control, and regulate communications services and to set standards, monitor, and enforce compliance relating to content.
swa: Kwa mujibu wa 2016 State of Internet Freedom in Africa report, Sheria ya Mawasiliano ya 2013 inaipa UCC nguvu zaidi na inafanya kazi chini ya kifungu cha 5 kinachoruhusu mdhibiti wa mawasiliano kufuatilia, kukagua, kutoa leseni, kusimamia, na kudhibiti huduma za mawasiliano na kuweka viwango, kufuatilia, na kutekeleza uzingatifu unaohusu taarifa.
mt0: <pad> According to the 2016 State of Internet Freedom in Africa report, Communications Law 2013 gives UCC more power and it works under Section 5 which allows the communication regulator to monitor, inspect, license, supervise, and control communication services and set standards, monitor, and implement compliance with reporting requirements.</s>

en: At the request of the government, the UCC used this section to order ISPs to block access to social media and mobile money services during the 2016 elections.
swa: Kwa ombi la serikali, UCC ilitumia sehemu hii kuagiza watoa huduma za mtandao (ISPs) kuzuia ufikiaji wa mitandao ya kijamii na huduma za pesa kwa njia ya simu wakati wa uchaguzi wa 2016.
mt0: <pad> For the government's request, UCC used this platform to order internet service providers (ISPs) to ban access to social networks and mobile payment services during the 2016 election.</s>

en: The government continues to weaponize these laws to control public debate and to silence political dissent, particularly at times of elections.
swa: Serikali inaendelea kutumia sheria hizi kudhibiti mijadala ya umma na kunyamazisha wapinzani wa kisiasa, haswa wakati wa uchaguzi.
mt0: <pad> The government continues to use these laws to control public discussions and muzzle political opponents, especially during the election period.</s>

en: Owiny argues that the state is capable of shutting down the internet at any time deemed necessary: Where regime security and that of its citizens converges, and where regime security is threatened, the regime security and its survival will take precedent.
swa: Owiny anatoa hoja kwamba serikali ina uwezo wa kuzima mtandao wakati wowote ule inapoonekana kuna umuhimu huo: Pale ambapo usalama wa serikali na ule wa raia wake unaingiliana, na pale usalama wa serikali unapotishiwa, usalama wa serikali na uponaji wake utapewa kipaumbele.
mt0: <pad> Owiny argues that governments have the power to shut down the Internet whenever they see it necessary: When government security and the security of its citizens intersect, and when government security is endangered, government security and its survival will be given priority.</s>

en: Nongovernmental organizations and human rights defenders have been organizing in Uganda so that shutdowns like the ones that took place in 2016 dont happen again.
swa: Asasi zisizo za kiserikali na watetezi wa haki za binadamu wamekuwa wakijiandaa nchini Uganda ili ufungaji kama ule uliofanyika mwaka wa 2016 hautokei tena.
mt0: <pad> NGOs and human rights activists have been preparing in Uganda to prevent such executions as those in 2016 from happening again.</s>

en: Several organizations wrote a joint letter to the African Union and regional bodies asking them to condemn the decision by Ugandan authorities to shut down internet access during the 2016 elections.
swa: Asasi kadhaa ziliandika barua ya pamoja kwa Jumuiya ya Afrika na mashirika ya kikanda zikiyaomba kulaani uamuzi wa utawala wa Uganda wa kufungia ufikiaji wa mtandao wakati wa uchaguzi wa 2016.
mt0: <pad> Several organizations wrote a joint letter to the African Union and regional organizations asking them to condemn the decision of the Ugandan government to ban internet access during the 2016 election.</s>

en: Unwanted Witness Uganda took the Ugandan state to court, along with internet service providers and the regulator, in a case filed in September 2016.
swa: Shirika la Unwanted Witness Uganda liliipeleka serikali ya Uganda mahakamani, pamoja na watoa huduma za mtandao (ISPs) na mdhibiti wa mawasiliano (UCC), katika kesi iliyowasilishwa mnamo Septemba 2016.
mt0: <pad> The Unwanted Witness Uganda organization sued the Ugandan government, along with internet service providers (ISPs) and communication regulator (UCC), in a case filed on September 2016.</s>

en: The organization contended that the internet shutdown planned by the state violated the rights of Ugandans to personal freedom of speech and expression is enshrined in Article 29(1) of the 1995 constitution.
swa: Shirika hilo lilionyesha kwamba hatua ya ufungwaji wa mtandao iliyopangwa na serikali ilikiuka haki za raia wa Uganda za uhuru wa kusema na kujieleza kama inavyoelezwa kwenye kanuni za kifungu cha 29 (1) cha katiba ya 1995.
mt0: <pad> The organization pointed out that the government's planned internet ban violated the rights of Ugandan citizens to speak and express themselves as defined in the provisions of Article 29 (1) of the 1995 constitution.</s>

en: However, a judge ruled that the applicants failed to prove any violations that resulted from the shutdowns, Unwanted Witness Uganda told Global Voices.
swa: Hata hivyo, jaji alitoa uamuzi kwamba upande wa mashtaka ulishindwa kuthibitisha ukiukwaji wowote uliotokana na ufungwaji huo, Unwanted Witness ililiambia shirika la Global Voices.
mt0: <pad> However, the judge ruled that the prosecution failed to prove any violation of the detention, Unwanted Witness told Global Voices.</s>

en: Achieving uninterrupted access to the internet  particularly during the upcoming elections  will require more advocacy.
swa: Kufanikisha kutokatishwa kwa ufikiaji wa mtandao  hasa wakati wa uchaguzi ujao  kutahitaji utetezi zaidi.
mt0: <pad> To ensure that internet access is not cut off, especially during the upcoming election will require more arguments.</s>

en: Owiny suggested the need for digital rights activists to deepen conversations between the government and private sector to present the negative impact of shutdowns because the private sector is intimidated by the state.
swa: Owiny alipendekeza hitaji la wanaharakati wa haki za dijitili kuongeza mazungumzo kati ya serikali na sekta binafsi kuwasilisha athari mbaya za ufungwaji kwa sababu sekta binafsi inatiwa hofu na serikali.
mt0: <pad> Owiny suggested the need for digital rights activists to increase discussions between the government and private sector to present the bad effects of the shutdown because the private sector is feared by the government.</s>

en: Uganda was among the first African countries to enact a right to information law, known as the Access to Information Act (ATIA), in 2005.
swa: Uganda ilikuwa miongoni mwa nchi za kwanza barani Afrika kutunga sheria ya haki ya raia kupata habari za umma, inayojulikana kama Access to Information Act (ATIA), mnamo 2005.
mt0: <pad> Uganda was one of the first countries in Africa to promulgate a law on the right of citizens to access public information, known as Access to Information Act (ATIA), in 2005.</s>

en: The law promises to provide efficient, effective, transparent and accountable that will enable the public to effectively access and participate in decisions that affect them as citizens of the country.
swa: Sheria hiyo inaahidi kutoa ufanisi, urahisi, uwazi na uwajibikaji ambao utawezesha umma kupata kwa urahisi na kushiriki katika maamuzi ambayo yanawaathiri kama raia wa nchi.
mt0: <pad> The law promises to provide efficiency, simplicity, transparency and accountability that will allow the public to access and participate in decisions that affect them as citizens.</s>

en: This article is part of a series of posts examining interference with digital rights through methods such as network shutdowns and disinformation during key political events in seven African countries: Algeria, Ethiopia, Mozambique, Nigeria, Tunisia, Uganda, and Zimbabwe.

en: Thousands of visitors to the historic city of Stone Town, Zanzibar, have followed the sound of music to the Dhow Countries Music Academy (DCMA), a music school that promotes and preserves the islands musical traditions of the Swahili Coast along the Indian Ocean.
swa: Maelfu ya wageni wanaozuru Mji Mkongwe, Zanzibar, mji wa kale uliofahamika kubeba historia  kubwa ya visiwa hivyo, hufuatilia sauti ya muziki unaorindima kutoka DCMA, shule ya muziki inayolenga kutangaza na kutunza muziki wa mwambao unaofahamika kuwa na asili yake visiwani humo na maeneo mengine ya pwani ya Bahari ya Hindi.
mt0: <pad> Thousands of visitors visiting Old Town, Zanzibar, an ancient city known to hold the greatest history of the islands, follow the sound of music playing from DCMA, a music school that aims to promote and conserve the traditional beach music which is native to the islands and other areas of the Indian Ocean coast.</s>

en: Since 2002, the school has promoted and preserved the Zanzibar's unique mix of Arab, Indian and African cultures through music.
swa: Tangu mwaka 2002, shule hiyo imekuwa ikiutangaza na kuutunza utamaduni huo wa kipekee wa Zanzibar unaochanganya tamaduni za ki-Arab, ki-Hindi na ki-Afrika kupitia muziki.
mt0: <pad> Since 2002, the school has been promoting and preserving this unique culture of Zanzibar that combines Arab, Indian and African cultures through music.</s>

en: After 17 years, the school faces a financial crisis that threatens its closure.
swa: Miaka 17 tangu kuanzishwa kwa shule hiyo, sasa ni wazi inakabiliwa na hali mbaya ya kifedha inayotishia kufungwa kwake.
mt0: <pad> 17 years after the school was founded, it is now clearly facing a bad financial situation that threatens to close it.</s>

en: Nearly 70% of its 80 full-time students can't afford to pay their tuition, which comes to about $13 USD per month, according to an official DCMA press release.
swa: Karibu asilimia 70 ya wanafunzi 80 wanaosoma shuleni hapo hawana uwezo wa kulipa ada ya masomo, ambayo ni kiasi cha dola za Marekani 13 kwa mwezi, kwa mujibu wa taarifa rasmi ya DCMA kwa umma.
mt0: <pad> About 70 percent of the 80 students who study at the school are unable to pay the tuition fee, which is about US$13 per month, according to DCMA's official report to the public.</s>

en: While the school has received support over the years from international donors and diplomatic missions, they face a gap in funding that may force them to shut their doors at the historic Old Customs House.
swa: Ingawa shule hiyo imekuwa ikipokea misaada kutoka kwa wafadhili wa kimataifa na mashirika ya kirafiki, kwa sasa inakabiliana na ombwe kubwa linaloweza kulazimisha kufunga virago vyake na kuondoka kwenye Jumba hilo la kihistoria mjini Zanzibar, linalofahamika kama Old Customs House.
mt0: <pad> Although the school has received funding from international donors and friends, it is now facing a large gap that may force it to close its doors and move out of the historic building in Zanzibar, known as Old Customs House.</s>

en: Without crucial funds to continue, DCMA students and staff fear that the soulful sounds that flow through the hallways of this iconic institution that make these islands sing  may cease.
swa: Bila kupata fedha za haraka kuwezesha shughuli zake kuendelea, wanafunzi na walimu wa DCMA wana wasiwasi kwamba sauti zilizozoeleka kurindima kutoka kwenye viunga vya jengo hilo na kufanya visiwa vipate burudani ya sanaa  zinaweza kukoma.
mt0: <pad> Without quick funding to allow its activities to continue, students and teachers at DCMA are worried that the familiar voices that ring from the walls of the building and make the islands get their arts entertainment may end.</s>

en: The school not only teaches and promotes traditional culture and heritage through music, but it's also home to a community of young musicians who seek alternatives to making a living as creatives.
swa: Shule hiyo si tu hufundisha na kutangaza utamaduni na urithi wa asili kupitia muziki, lakini pia hukaliwa na kundi kubwa la wanamuziki vijana wanaotafuta njia mbadala za kuendesha maisha yao kwa kutumia sanaa.
mt0: <pad> The school not only teaches and promotes the culture and heritage of the natural world through music, but also is home to a large group of young musicians who are looking for alternative ways to support their lives through art.</s>

mt0: <pad> We have started to deal with a bad financial situation, says Alessia Lombardo, CEO of DCMA, in the official DCMA video.</s>

en: From now to the next six months, we are not sure that we can guarantee the salaries to our teachers and staff.
swa: Kuanzia sasa mpaka miezi sita ijayo, hatuna uhakika kwamba tunaweza kuwa na uwezo wa kuwalipa mishahara walimu na wafanyakazi wengine.

en: At the moment, 19 master teachers and small core staff have gone without salaries for over three months as the school struggles to secure strong funding partnerships and explore sustainable funding models for a school.
swa: Hivi sasa, walimu 19 wabobezi na wafanyakazi wengine wachache hawajalipwa mishahara yao kwa zaidi ya miezi sita kwa sababu shule hiyo imekuwa ikihangaika kupata misaada kutoka kwa marafiki wakati huo huo ikijaribu kutengeneza mfumo endelevu wa kupata mapato kwa minajili ya uendashaji wa shule hiyo.
mt0: <pad> Now, 19 volunteer teachers and other staff have not been paid for more than six months because the school has been struggling to get donations from friends while at the same time trying to create a sustainable system of revenue for the running of the school.</s>

en: While the archipelago is known as a tourist destination for its pristine beaches and luxury hotels, the majority of local people struggle with high unemployment even as poverty has slightly decreased, according to The World Bank.
swa: Ingawa visiwa hivyo vinafahamika kuvutia watalii wengi shauri ya kuwa na fukwe na hoteli kubwa za kifahari, wenyeji wengi wanateseka na ukosefu mkubwa wa kazi ingawa takwimu zilizotolewa na Benki ya Dunia zinaonesha kuwa umasikini umepungua kidogo visiwani humo.
mt0: <pad> Although the islands are known to attract many tourists due to their beaches and large luxurious hotels, many of the locals suffer from a great unemployment, although World Bank statistics show that poverty has decreased slightly in the islands.</s>

mt0: <pad> Kidude, Zanzibar is home to a genre of music that has evolved through the cultural fusion and cooperation between the Pwani Swahili for hundreds of years.</s>

mt0: <pad> Today, students can learn traditional music such as taarab, ngoma and kidumbak, along with other instruments such as the drums, qanun and oud, as keepers and interpreters of culture and traditions.</s>

en: Zanzibars Amina Omar Juma, a former DCMA student and current DCMA teacher, recently returned from a tour in South Africa with her critically acclaimed, Siti and the Band, known for fusing the roots by blending traditional taarab sounds with contemporary, layered rhythms.
swa: Mzanzibar Amina Omar Juma, mwanafunzi wa zamani wa DCMA na mwalimu wa sasa wa DCMA, hivi karibuni alirudi kutoka kwenye ziara nchini Afrika Kusini akiambatana na bendi yake iliyojipatia sifa Siti na Bendi Yake, inayofahamika kwa kuunganisha mizizi  kwa kuchanganya sauti za taarabu ya asili na sauti za mahadhi ya kisasa.
mt0: <pad> The Zanzibari Amina Omar Juma, former student of DCMA and current DCMA teacher, recently returned from a tour in South Africa with her well-known band Siti and Her Band, which is known for blending the traditional sounds of taarab with modern mahadhi.</s>

en: She and other band members, also former DCMA students, released their first full album, Fusing the Roots, in 2018, going on to perform at Sauti za Busara, East Africa's largest music festival, that same year.
swa: Pia, kwa ushirikiano na wanabendi wenzake, ambao nao ni wanafunzi wa zamani wa DCMA, alitoa alibamu ya kwanza iitwayo, Fusing the Roots, mwaka 2018, akiendelea kufanya maonesho kwenye  Sauti za Busara, tamasha kubwa zaidi la muziki kwenye ukanda wa Afrika Mashariki, mwaka huo huo.
mt0: <pad> Also, in collaboration with other band members, who were also DCMA students, he released his first album, Fusing the Roots, in 2018, while continuing to perform at the biggest music festival in East Africa, The Voices of Wisdom, the same year.</s>

en: A history of cultural crossroads and collaboration
swa: Historia ya mwingiliano wa kiutamaduni na ushirikiano
mt0: <pad> The history of cultural interaction and cooperation</s>

en: Over 15,000 visitors have passed through the academys iconic building to enjoy live performances, workshops and classes and interact with passionate DCMA musicians who represent the future of Zanzibar culture and heritage, according to the DCMA.
swa: Zaidi ya wageni 15,000 wamewahi kupitia kwenye jengo la shule hiyo kufurahia maonesho mubashara, warsha na madarasa pamoja na kukutana na wanamuziki wa DCMA wanaowakilishia mustakabali wa utamaduni na urithi wa Zanzibar, kwa mujibu wa DCMA.
mt0: <pad> Over 15,000 visitors have passed through the school's building to enjoy live shows, workshops and classes as well as meet DCMA musicians who represent the future of the culture and heritage of Zanzibar, according to DCMA.</s>

en: Drawing from a complex history of Indian, Arab and African exchange, the school celebrates the influence of dhow countries, with inspiration from cultures that converged along the Indian Ocean and the Persian Gulf.
swa: Ikiwa na vionjo vya historia ya India, Urabuni na Afrika, shule hiyo inafurahia kuwa matokeo ya tamaduni za nchi mbalimbali, ikiwa na utamaduni uliunganishwa kwenye eneo lal Bahari ya Hindi na Ghuba ya Uajemi.
mt0: <pad> With a rich history of India, Arabia and Africa, the school is proud to be a result of different cultures, with a culture linked to the Indian Ocean and the Gulf of Persia.</s>

en: The Omani Sultanate, a major maritime force from the 17th to 19th centuries, shifted its seat of power from Muscat to Zanzibar in 1840.
swa: Sultani wa Omani, mfalme maarufu wa kati ya karne ya 17 na 19, alihamia utawala wake kutoka Muscat kwenda Zanzibar mwaka 1840.
mt0: <pad> The Ottoman sultan, a famous ruler between the 17th and 19th centuries, moved his power from Muscat to Zanzibar in 1840.</s>

en: From Stone Town, Omani kings oversaw elaborate systems of maritime trade, including cloves, gold, and textiles, powered by strong winds that set dhows  traditional Arab vessels  sailing across the Indian Ocean, from India to Oman to East Africa.
swa: Kutoka Mji Mkongwe, watawala wa Omani waliendesha biashara ya baharini, ikiwa ni pamoja na karafuu, dhahabu, nguo, wakitegemea safari za vyombo vilivyoongozwa na upepo kati ya kingo ya Bahari ya Hindi nchini India kwenda Oman na Afrika Mashariki.
mt0: <pad> From the Old City, the Oman rulers conducted sea trade, including cinnamon, gold, and clothing, relying on wind-powered voyages between the Indian hinterland in India and Oman and East Africa.</s>

en: Young Zanzibaris recognize the importance of connecting with the past to determine their future and the music created today expresses that desire to bridge the old with the new.
swa: Vijana wa Zanzibar wanatambua umuhimu wa kuelewa historia yao ili kubaini ikiwa mustakabali wao na muziki wanaoutengeneza leo unaelezea matamanio ya kuweka daraja kati ya mambo ya kale na haya ya kisasa.
mt0: <pad> The young people of Zanzibar are aware of the importance of understanding their history to determine if their future is and the music they make today expresses the wish to bridge the gap between the past and the present.</s>

en: DCMA students and teachers recently formed TaraJazz, a blend of traditional taarab and modern jazz.
swa: Hivi karibuni wanafunzi wa DCMA na walimu wao walianzisha TaraJazz, mwuunganiko wa taarab ya asili na jazi ya kisasa.
mt0: <pad> Last year, DCMA students and their teachers started TaraJazz, a fusion of traditional taarab and modern jazz.</s>

en: Their violinist, Felician Mussa, 20, has only been studying the violin for 3.5 years; TaraJazz is one of the most sought-after bands on the islands, captured here by photographer Aline Coquelle:
swa: Mwanamuziki wake, Felician Mussa, 20, amekuwa akijifunza kupiga chombo cha muziki kinachoitwa violin kwa miaka mitatu na nusu; TaraJazz ni moja wapo ya bendi zinazotafutwa zaidi visiwani humo, hapa ikiwa imenaswa na mpiga picha Aline Coquelle:
mt0: <pad> Their musician, Felician Mussa, 20, has been learning to play the violin for three and a half years; TaraJazz is one of the most sought-after bands in the islands, here captured by the photographer Aline Coquelle.</s>

en: The Swahili coast tells the story of epic cultural exchanges and the DCMA continues this tradition through its musical collaborations.
swa: Pwani ya wa-Swahili inaeleza simulizi ya mchanganyiko wa utamaduni na DCMA inaendeleza utamaduni huu kupitia ushirikiano wa kimuziki.
mt0: <pad> The Swahili Beach describes a symbiotic blend of cultures and DCMA is promoting this culture through music collaborations.</s>

en: Every year, the school hosts an initiative called Swahili Encounters, matching well-known musicians hailing from Africa, the Middle East, Europe and North America with DCMA students to create original musical compositions within a week-long period.
swa: Kila mwaka, shule hiyo huandaa mradi unaoitwa  Swahili Encounters,  [Mkutano wa ki-Swahili] unaowakutanisha wanamuziki wanaofahamika kutoka Afrika, Mashariki ya Kati, Ulaya na Amerika ya Kaskazini na wanafunzi wa DCMA kwa minajili ya kutengeneza tungo halisi za muziki ndani ya kipindi cha juma moja.
mt0: <pad> Every year, the school organizes a project called Swahili Encounters, [The Swahili Conference] that brings together famous musicians from Africa, Middle East, Europe and North America with DCMA students to create real music compositions within a week's time.</s>

en: At the end of the encounter, the newly-formed collaboration performs at Sauti za Busara, and many of these collaborations turn into life-time friendships that transcend the boundaries of language and culture, proving music is a universal language.
swa: Mwishoni mwa mkutano, timu mpya za wasanii waliokutanishwa hutakiwa kufanya onesho kwenye Sauti za Busara, na mara nyingi timu hizi huishi kuwa na urafiki unaodumu unaovuka mipaka ya lugha na utamaduni, na hivyo kuthibitisha kuwa muziki ni lugha ya dunia.
mt0: <pad> At the end of the meeting, new artists teams are invited to perform on Smart Voices, and these teams often live to be long-lasting friends that cross language and culture barriers, and thus confirm that music is the world's language.</s>

en: DCMA offers weekly live performances showcasing students talents and collaborations with visiting musicians, Stone Town, Zanzibar, 2019.
swa: DCMA huandaa onesho mubashara kila juma kuonesha vipaji vya wanafunzi wake na marafiki wanaowatembelea wanamuziki hao, Mji Mkongwe, Zanzibar, 2019.
mt0: <pad> DCMA holds a live show every week to showcase the skills of its students and friends who visit the musicians, Old Town, Zanzibar, 2019.</s>

en: The DCMA recognizes that music empowers and unites people across cultures  and it also employs talented youth living in a struggling economy with limited job opportunities.
swa: Shule ya DCMA inatambua kuwa muziki unawainua na kuwaunganisha watu bila kujali tamaduni zao  na pia inaajiri vijana wenye vipaji wnaaoishi kwenye jamii isiyo na uchumi mzuri na upungufu mkubwa wa fursa za ajira.
mt0: <pad> DCMA School recognizes that music lifts and unites people regardless of their cultures and also employs talented young people who live in a poor economic community with a great shortage of job opportunities.</s>

en: For the 1,800 students who have trained at the DCMA, this is the only musical home they know, where they can learn and grow as professional musicians and artists.
swa: Kwa idadi ya wanafunzi 1,800 waliopita kwenye mafunzo ya DCMA, shule hii ndiyo makazi pekee ya kimuziki wanayoyafahamu, ambapo wanaweza kujifunza na kukua kama wanamuziki na wasanii mahiri.
mt0: <pad> With 1,800 students who have gone through DCMA's education, the school is the only musical home they know, where they can learn and grow as professional musicians and artists.</s>

en: One traveler from Spain, who recently visited the DCMA, wrote on TripAdvisor: Personally, meeting the musicians was the best piece of my time on this island.
swa: Mtalii mmoja kutoka Uhisipania, aliyetembelea shule ya DCMA hivi karibuni, aliandika kwenye mtandao wa TripAdvisor: Binafsi, kukutana na wanamuziki ule ulikuwa wakati wangu mzuri zaidi nikiwa visiwani pale.
mt0: <pad> A visitor from Uhispania, who recently visited DCMA school, wrote on TripAdvisor: Personally, meeting the musicians was my best time while I was in the islands.</s>

en: As Zanzibars tourism sector rapidly grows, the DCMA believes that music plays an essential role in the celebration, preservation and promotion of Swahili culture, heritage and history.
swa: Wakati sekta ya utalii Zanzibar ikiendelea kukua kwa kasi, shule ya DCMA inaamini kuwa muziki una nafasi muhimu katika kusherehekea, kutunza na kutangaza utamaduni wa wa-Swahili, urithi wao na historia yao.
mt0: <pad> While the tourism industry in Zanzibar continues to grow rapidly, DCMA School believes that music plays an important role in celebrating, preserving and promoting the Swahili culture, their heritage and their history.</s>

en: Zanzibar is far more than its beaches and luxury hotels  its a place bursting with talent that stems from an extraordinary history of cultural connection and collaboration.
swa: Zanzibar ni zaidi ya fukwe na hoteli zake za kifahari  ni sehemu inayojaa vipaji vinavyochipukia kwenye historia kubwa ya mkusanyiko na miunganiko wa historia.
mt0: <pad> Zanzibar is more than its beaches and luxurious hotels it is a place full of emerging talents with a large history of collection and fusion of history</s>

en: On August 12, the World Health Organization (WHO) announced a positive development in the clinical trials of drugs being tested for the treatment of Ebola in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DR of Congo).
swa: Mapema tarehe 12 Agosti, Shirika la Afya Duniani (WHO) lilitoa taarifa chanya ya maendeleo ya michakato ya kitabibu ya majaribio ya dawa kadhaa za kutibu ugonjwa wa ebola nchini Jamhuri ya Kidemokrasia ya Congo (Jamhuri ya Congo).
mt0: <pad> Earlier on August 12, the World Health Organization (WHO) reported positive progress in clinical trials of several drugs to treat Ebola in the Democratic Republic of Congo.</s>

en: WHO asserted that the Ebola drugs showed advances that will bring patients a better chance of survival, and further affirmed that two out of the four drugs being tested are more effective in treating Ebola.
swa: WHO ilitanabaisha kuwa, dawa za ebola zilizojaribiwa zimeonesha matokeo chanya yatakayoleta matumaini ya kuishi kwa wagonjwa wa Ebola, na kuendelea kueleza kuwa dawa mbili kati ya nne zilizojaribiwa zimeonesha kuwa na uwezo mkubwa wa kutibu Ebola.
mt0: <pad> The WHO announced that, the trials of Ebola drugs have shown positive results that will give hope to patients with Ebola, and continued to say that two of the four tested drugs have shown great potential to treat Ebola.</s>

en: Who is the man behind the Ebola cure?
swa: Ni nani huyu anayehusika kwenye tiba hii ya Ebola?
mt0: <pad> Who is this person involved in this Ebola treatment?</s>

en: Esteemed professor Jean-Jacques Muyembe-Tamfum, director-general of the Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB) DR of Congo, who invested a substantial part of his adult life treating the virus.
swa: Mheshimiwa Profesa Jean-Jacques Muyembe-Tamfum, Mkurugenzi Mkuu wa Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB) DR ya Congo, aliwekeza sehemu kubwa ya Maisha yake katika kutafuta tiba ya kirusi cha Ebola.
mt0: <pad> The Honourable Professor Jean-Jacques Muyembe-Tamfum, Director General of the Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB) Republic of the Congo, has invested most of his life in finding a cure for the Ebola virus.</s>

en: While the international media has often focused heavily on the deadly, contagious nature of Ebola in DR of Congo, less has been said about the Congolese scientist who discovered its cure.
swa: Wakati vyombo vya ahabari vya kimataifa vikiwa vinaripoti kwa kiasi kikubwa kuhusu namna ugonjwa wa Ebola unavyosababisha idadi kubwa ya vifo nchini Congo, habari za kumhusu mwanasansi huyu zinazungumzwa kwa kiasi kidogo sana na vyombo hivi vya habari.
mt0: <pad> While international media are reporting extensively on the Ebola epidemic in Congo, news about this scientist is being reported very little by these same media.</s>

en: Muyembe-Tamfum declared: We will no longer say that EVD [Ebola virus disease] is not curable.
swa: Muyembe-Tamfum  alieleza : kuwa hatutasema tena kuwa ugonjwa wa  Ebola (EVD) hautibiki.
mt0: <pad> Muyembe-Tamfum said: "We will not say again that Ebola (EVD) is untreatable.</s>

en: Based on Muyembe-Tamfum's tireless work, scientists tested four drugs for Ebola treatment: ZMapp, remdesivir, mAb114 and REGN-EB3.
swa: Kutokana na kazi adhimu ya Muyembe-Tamfum, wanasayansi walifanya majaribio ya dawa nne za kutibu Ebola: ZMapp, remdesivir, mAb114 and REGN-EB3.
mt0: <pad> Based on the valuable work of Muyembe-Tamfum, scientists have tested four Ebola drugs: ZMapp, remdesivir, mAb114 and REGN-EB3.</s>

en: The results from the clinical trials conducted in 499 study participants showed that patients treated with REGN-EB3 or mAb114 had a greater chance of survival when compared to those treated with the two other drugs.
swa: Majibu ya majaribio ya kitabibu conducted kwa washiriki 499 wa utafiti yalionesha kuwa wagonjwa waliotibiwa kwa REGN-EB3 au mAb114 walionesha kuwa na nafasi kubwa ya kupona ukilinganisha na wale waliotibiwa kwa dawa nyingine mbili.
mt0: <pad> The results of the clinical trial conducted on 499 participants in the study showed that patients treated with REGN-EB3 or mAb114 had a greater chance of recovering compared to those treated with two other drugs.</s>

en: The trials were conducted under the auspices of the Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB), the DR Congo Ministry of Health and three medical humanitarian organizations: the Alliance for International Medical Action (ALIMA), the International Medical Corps (IMC) and Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF).

en: As  Böl asserted, the high mortality rate of Ebola and also the sometimesexaggerated media coverage of the epidemic created hysteria around the world.

mt0: <pad> As BÖL already said, the high rate of Ebola deaths and sometimes misleading media reports about Ebola have contributed to creating fear worldwide.</s>

en: This position was further corroborated by a 2017 study in which Hal Roberts, Brittany Seymour, Sands Alden Fish II, Emily Robinson and Ethan Zuckerman analyzed over 109,000 stories published in US mainstream/regional media and blogs between July to November 2014, with a focus on Ebola coverage.

mt0: <pad> Similar reports were also supported by 2017 research by Hal Roberts, Brittany Seymour, Sands Alden Fish II, Emily Robinson and Ethan Zuckerman who analyzed over 109,000 articles published on major U.S. news and blogs between July and November 2014, the focus of analysis being Ebola-related news.</s>

en: They discovered that three distinct peaks in Ebola coverage in the United States media and blogs occurred around July 27, September 28, and 15 October 2014:

swa: Kulingana na takwimu za hivi karibuni zilizokusanywa na Atlatszo, vyanzo vikuu vya propaganda vimeshindwa kesi nyingi, na viliamriwa na mahakama kusahihisha taarifa mara 109 kwa mwaka 2018.
mt0: <pad> According to recent data collected by Atlatszo, the main propaganda sources have lost many cases, and were ordered by the court to correct their reports 109 times in 2018.</s>

swa: Hawawezi kutuwekea mawazo yao vichwani mwetu hivyo wanatupiga risasi #SOSNicaragua Ndivyo linavyosomeka bango la mwandamanaji mmoja wakati wa maandamano kwa ajili ya wafungwa wa kisiasa huko Managua.

en: Since mass protests against president Daniel Ortega erupted in Nicaragua in April 2018, the government has banned demonstrations, arrested thousands without trial, and shut down both alternative and mainstream media outlets.
swa: Tangu maandamano makubwa dhidi ya Rais Daniel Ortega yalipuke nchini Nicaragua Aprili 2018, serikali imepiga marufuku maandamano, imewakamata maelfu bila kuwafungulia mashtaka na kufungia kwa pamoja vyanzo vikuu na vile mbadala vya habari.
mt0: <pad> Since the large protests against President Daniel Ortega broke out in Nicaragua in April 2018, the government has banned protests, arrested thousands without charge and closed both major news sources and alternative media.</s>

en: As attempts at dialogue have so far failed, the future of Nicaragua remains an open question.
swa: Majaribio ya kufanya mazungumzo yameshindikana,  kwa sasa hatma ya Nicaragua imebaki kuwa swali gumu.
mt0: <pad> Since the attempts to negotiate have failed, the future of Nicaragua has remained a difficult question.</s>

en: The demonstrations were originally against a social security reform that would raise income taxes while reducing pension benefits.
swa: Maandamano yalianza kwa kupinga mabadiliko ya sera za mifuko ya hifadhi za jamii ambapo yangepandisha makato ya kodi ya mapato wakati ikipunguza maslahi ya kiinua mgongo.
mt0: <pad> The protests started against the change in social security policy that would raise taxes on income while reducing the benefits of the retirement.</s>

en: The initial crackdown by the authorities paved the way for a nationwide call for the resignation of President Daniel Ortega and first lady and Vice-President Rosario Murillo.
swa: Mwanzoni mchakato huo ulifanywa na mamlaka ulifungua mlango wa maandamano ya nchi nzima yakimtaka Rais Daniel Ortega, mkewe na Makamu wa Rais Rosario Murillo wajiuzulu.
mt0: <pad> The authorities' initial action opened the door to nationwide protests demanding that President Daniel Ortega, his wife and Vice President Rosario Murillo resign.</s>

en: Figures given for the protests death toll vary, and have not been updated since last year as barriers to documentation efforts increase.
swa: Takwimu za vifo vilivyotokana na maandamano hayo yanapishana na hayajahuishwa tangu mwaka jana kwa sababu vikwazo dhidi ya uwekaji wa taarifa na kumbukumbu umeongezeka.
mt0: <pad> The numbers of deaths attributed to the protests have been inconsistent and not up-to-date since last year because obstacles to reporting and recording have increased.</s>

en: In December 2018 the government closed down several NGOs that were keeping track of police violence and human rights abuses, including the Nicaraguan Center for Human Rights (Cenidh) and the Institute for the Development of Democracy (Ipade).
swa: Disemba 2018 serikali iilizifungia baadhi ya NGO ambazo zilikuwa zikifuatilia kwa karibu vurugu za polisi na uvunjaji wa Haki za Binadamu ikiwepo kituo cha Haki za Binadamu cha Nicaragua (Cenidh) na Taasisi ya Maendeleo ya Demokrasia (Ipade).
mt0: <pad> In December 2018 the government closed some NGOs that were closely monitoring police brutality and human rights abuses including the Center for Human Rights in Nicaragua (Cenidh) and the Institute for the Development of Democracy (Ipade).</s>

en: Also in December, two groups set up by the Inter-American Commission for Human Rights (IACHR)the Special Follow-up Mechanism for Nicaragua (MESENI) and the Interdisciplinary Group of Independent Expertswere expelled from the country, leaving Nicaragua virtually without independent human rights observers and opening a new stage in the repression, according to Nicaraguan feminist activist and educator María Teresa Blandón.
swa: Pia Disemba hiyo, vikundi viwili vya Kamisheni ya Haki za Binadamu Ndani ya Amerika (IACHR)Mpango Maalumu wa Kuratibu Ufuatiliaji Nicaragua (MESENI) na Kikundi cha Wanazuoni Huru wa Fani Mbalimbaliwalifukuzwa kutoka nchini, na kuiacha Nicaragua bila chombo huru cha kusimamia Haki za Binadamu na kufungua hatua mpya ya unyanyasaji, hii ni kulingana na Mwanaharakati wa haki za Wanawake na Muelimishaji María Teresa Blandón.
mt0: <pad> Also in December, two groups of the American Human Rights Commission (IACHR) Special Program for Coordinating Monitorage of Nicaragua (MESENI) and the Free Scholars Group were expelled from the country, leaving Nicaragua without an independent body to monitor Human Rights and opening a new stage of abuse, according to the activist and feminist María Teresa Blandón.</s>

en: Read more: We are victims who assist victims': Documenting human rights violations in Nicaragua
swa: Soma zaidi: Sisi ni Wahanga tunaowasaidia wahanga': Wakinakili uvunjaji wa Haki za Binadamu Nicaragua
mt0: <pad> "We are victims who help victims": They document the human rights violations in Nicaragua</s>

en: The lowest estimate of the casualties, acknowledged by the government in August 2018, amounted to 197.
swa: Makadirio ya chini ya majeruhi, waliotambuliwa na serikali Agosti 2018 imeongezeka na kufika 197.
mt0: <pad> The lowest estimate of injured, officially recognized by the government in August 2018, has increased to 197, according to the Ministry of Health.</s>

en: Amnesty International, however, has estimated that there have been 322 deaths as of 18 September 2018, most of them caused by gunshots to the head, neck, and torso.
swa: Hata hivyo, Shirika la Haki za Binadamu, limekaridia kuwepo kwa vifo 322 mpaka ilipofika Septemba 18 2018, ambapo vifo vingi vilikuwa kwa kupigwa risasi kichwani, shingoni na kifuani.
mt0: <pad> However, Human Rights Watch has reported 322 deaths as of September 18, 2018, where most were by gunshot wounds to the head, neck and chest.</s>

en: Blogger Ana Siú wrote recently on Medium about her experience of the April 2018 protests:
swa: Mwanablogu Ana Siú aliandika kwenye Medium hivi karibuni kuhusu uzoefu wake katika maandamano ya Aprili 2018.:
mt0: <pad> Blogger Ana Siu recently wrote on Medium about her experience at the April 2018 protests.</s>

en: I saw a friend from University being attacked by a mob through Instagram Live.
swa: Nilimuona rafiki yangu wa chuoni akiwa anashambuliwa na genge kupitia Instagram Mubashara.
mt0: <pad> I saw my college friend being attacked by a gang via Instagram Live.</s>

en: I heard her scream and struggle to avoid being hurt [] Finally, the man in the motorcycle [that had attacked her] let her go, but he took her phone.
swa: Nilimsikia akipiga kelele na akipambana kuepuka kuumizwa [] Mwishowe, mwanaume aliyemshambulia akiwa kwenye pikipiki alimwacha lakini alichukua simu yake.
mt0: <pad> I heard her scream and fight to avoid injury [] Eventually, the man on a scooter left her but took her phone.</s>

en: He didn't realize he was still live.
swa: Hakujua kuwa bado anaonekana mubashara.
mt0: <pad> He didn't know that he was still being shown live.</s>

en: Then he said Let's go!
swa: Kisha akasema, tuondoke!
mt0: <pad> He said, Let's go.</s>

en: We have to take these phones to be checked.
swa: Tunatakiwa kuzichukua hizi simu zikakaguliwe.
mt0: <pad> We have to take these phones and turn them off.</s>

en: This went on for 20 minutes.
swa: Tukio hilo liliendelea kwa dakika 20.
mt0: <pad> The event lasted for about 20 minutes.</s>

en: She also reflects on the protest of May 30, a historic rally held on the date Nicaragua celebrates Mother's Day where 15 people were killed:
swa: Pia aliangazia kuhusu maandamano ya Mei 30, ambapo yalikuwa maandamano ya kihistoria yaliyoitishwa katika tarehe ambayo Nicaragua husherehekea siku ya Mama ambapo watu 15 waliuawa.
mt0: <pad> He also talked about the 30 May protests, which were historic protests held on the day that Nicaragua celebrates Mother's Day, where 15 people were killed.</s>

en: That day the way we saw the protests change.
swa: Siku ile tulibadili mitazamo yetu kuhusu maandamano.
mt0: <pad> The day we changed our views on protests.</s>

en: Those of us who were in that massive protest saw how they killed young people.
swa: Baadhi yetu tuliokuwa katika maandamano yale tuliona jinsi walivyokuwa wanawaua vijana.
mt0: <pad> Some of us who were in the protests saw how they were killing young men.</s>

en: It was the first time they had attacked a mass protest with bullets.
swa: Ni mara ya kwanza polisi  kushambulia maandamano makubwa kama yale kwa risasi za moto.
mt0: <pad> It's the first time police have used firearms to attack such a large protest with such a large crowd.</s>

en: I had never felt so close to death.
swa: Sijawahi kuwa karibu na kifo namna hiyo.
mt0: <pad> I've never been so close to death.</s>

en: While students barricaded themselves in universities in the capital Managua, rural workers blocked roads in the countryside.
swa: Wakati wanafunzi walipozuiana wenyewe kwa wenyewe katika vyuo vikuu katika mji mkuu wa Managua, wafanyakazi wa mashambani walifunga barabara katika maeneo ya mashambani.
mt0: <pad> While students were barricaded each other in the university in the capital Managua, farmers blocked roads in the rural areas.</s>

en: In June, protesters in Masaya declared the eastern city a dictatorship-free territory.
swa: Hapo Juni waandamanaji wa Masaya waliutangaza mji wa Mashariki kuwa mamlaka huru kutoka kwenye udikteta.
mt0: <pad> In June, Masaya protesters declared the eastern city as an independent state from the dictatorship.</s>

en: The government cracked down on these protesters, who built in barricades to defend themselves and respond to police attacks.
swa: Serikali iliwashambulia waandamanaji waliotengeneza vizuizi vya kujilinda na kujibu mashambulizi ya polisi.
mt0: <pad> The government attacked protesters who created barricades to defend themselves and responded to police attacks.</s>

en: Demonstrators increasingly engaged in more violent methods and confrontations, which resulted in the death of 22 police officers as of August 2018, according to government data.
swa: Waandamanaji walizidi kujihusisha na vurugu na mapigano na kufikia Agosti 2018 vilikuwa vimetokea vifo 22 vya maafisa wa polisi, na hii ni kulingana na takwimu za serikali..
mt0: <pad> Protesters became more involved in violence and fighting and by August 2018 there had been 22 police officers killed, according to government statistics.</s>

en: In mid-2018, the police deployed the so-called operación limpieza (clean-up operation) to dismantle barricades and prosecute suspected participants.
swa: Katikati ya 2018, polisi walianzisha walichokiita operación limpieza (Operesheni ya kusafisha) kuharibu vizuizi na kuwashtaki watuhumiwa walioshukiwa kujihusisha navyo.
mt0: <pad> In the middle of 2018, police launched what they called Operation Cleanup to break down barriers and prosecute suspects suspected of being involved.</s>

en: Reports say that law enforcement acted in cooperation with paramilitary groups.
swa: Taarifa zinasema kuwa vyombo vya usalama vilifanya hivyo vikishirikiana na Vikundi vya wanamgambo.
mt0: <pad> The reports say that the security forces did this in coordination with rebel groups.</s>

en: Many students, leaders of peasant movements, rights defenders and journalists were targeted in smear campaigns and persecuted, and some were charged with terrorism.
swa: Wanafunzi wengi, viongozi wa harakati za wakulima, wapigania haki na wanahabari walilengwa katika kampeni hiyo hatari na wengi wao wameshtakiwa.
mt0: <pad> Many students, leaders of farmers' movements, activists and journalists were targeted in this dangerous campaign and many of them have been prosecuted.</s>

en: Even health professionals who treated people injured in the riots suffered consequences.
swa: Na baadhi ya watumishi wa afya waliohudumia majeruhi wakati wa maandamano wamepata misukosuko kwa kile walichokifanya.
mt0: <pad> And some health workers who cared for the injured during the protests have been criticized for what they did.</s>

en: The Nicaraguan Medical Association said at least 240 such professionals were fired from public hospitals and clinics in retaliation.
swa: Chama cha Madaktari wa Nicaragua wamesema kuwa angalau madaktari 240  walifukuzwa kazi katika hospitali za umma kama njia ya kuwakomoa.
mt0: <pad> The Nicaraguan Medical Society said that at least 240 doctors were fired from public hospitals as a way to punish them.</s>

en: Read more: Nicaraguan protesters and journalists face violent attacks on the streets and online
swa: Soma zaidi: Waandamanaji wa Nicaragua na waandishi wa habari wakumbana na mashambulizi makali mitaani na kwenye mitandao.
mt0: <pad> More: Nicaraguan protesters and journalists have been targeted by fierce attacks on the streets and online.</s>

en: In September, protests were made essentially illegal, as all street activities now require advance permission from the authorities, which is often denied.
swa: Hapo Septemba maandamano yalifanywa kuwa sio halali tena, na shughuli zozote kwa sasa katika mitaa zinahitaji kibali maalum kutoka kwa mamlaka, ambapo mara nyingi vibali hivyo hukataliwa..
mt0: <pad> In September protests were made unlawful, and any activity in the streets now requires special permission from the authorities, which are often denied.</s>

en: On February 27, 2019, dialogue was resumed between the government and the opposition party, Alianza Cívica por la Justicia y la Democracia (Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy), following the release of a hundred people from prison.
swa: Hapo Februari 27, 2019, meza ya  mazungumzo ilirejelewa kati ya serikali na chama cha upinzani, Alianza Cívica por la Justicia y la Democracia (Muungano wa Haki na Demokrasia kwa Raia), ikifuatiwa na kuachiliwa huru kwa mamia ya watu kutoka gerezani.
mt0: <pad> On February 27, 2019, a table of talks was reopened between the government and the opposition party, Alianza Cívica por la Justicia y la Democracia (Alliance for Justice and Democracy for the People), followed by the release of hundreds of people from jail.</s>

en: Unlike previous attempts at dialogue, however, this one did not include leaders of peasant movements and students, as some of them are incarcerated, and others are in exile.
swa: Ukilinganisha na mazungumzo ya kipindi kilichopita, kikao hiki hakikujumuisha viongozi wa harakati za wakulima na wanafunzi, kwa sababu baadhi yao wako kifungoni, na wengine wapo uhamishoni.
mt0: <pad> Compared to previous discussions, this meeting did not include leaders of the farmers' and students' movement, because some of them are in jail, and some are on exile.</s>

en: Not just a new president a new beginning
swa: Sio Rais mpya pekeeni mwanzo mpya
mt0: <pad> No new president only, a new start</s>

en: As the country's crisis enters its second year, the urgency and anxiety about Nicaragua's future is conveyed through the hashtag #SOSNicaragua, which is deployed daily in conjunction with allegations, pictures of victims and accounts of students in prison and their families.
swa: Kwa kuwa mgogoro huu wa nchi unaingia mwaka wa pili sasa, wahka na wasiwasi wa kesho ya Nicaragua umebebwa na hashtagi #SOSNicaragua, ambayo hutolewa kila siku pamoja na madai, picha za waathirika na vilio juu ya wanafunzi walio magerezani na familia zao.
mt0: <pad> As the country's conflict enters its second year, the anxiety and concern for the future of Nicaragua has been taken up by the hashtag #SOSNicaragua, which is posted every day with demands, photos of victims and cries about students in jail and their families.</s>

en: Read more: Nicaragua's diaspora activists bear a double burden
swa: Soma zaidi: Wanaharakati wa Diaspora wa Nicaragua wabeba mzigo mara mbili
mt0: <pad> More: Nicaraguan Diaspora activists carry a load of supplies twice as much as they can</s>

en: Nicaraguan news outlet Niú interviewed Nicaraguans who held a protest in February in neighboring Costa Rica, and they shared accounts of the difficulties of life in exile.
swa: Chanzo cha habari cha Nicaragua, Niú waliwahoji waandamanaji walioongoza maandano ya Februari katika maeneo ya jirani na Costa Rica na walielezea ugumu wa maisha waliyo nayo huko uhamishoni.
mt0: <pad> The Nicaraguan news source, Niu interviewed protesters who led the February protests in the neighbouring areas of Costa Rica and described the difficult life they had in the exiles.</s>

en: Alejandro Donaire, a student who says he fled the country after participating in a peaceful protest, told Niú how difficult it was to feel part of a functioning society in a normal life, after spending so much time hiding, fleeing or protesting.
swa: Alejandro Donaire, mwanafunzi alisema kuwa alikimbia nchini baada ya kushiriki maandamano ya amani, aliiambia Niú jinsi ilivyo vigumu kujisikia kuwa sehemu ya jamii na maisha ya kawaida, baada ya kutumia muda mrefu kwa  kuishi kwa kujificha, kukimbia na kuandamana.
mt0: <pad> Alejandro Donaire, a student who fled the country after participating in peace protests, told Niu how difficult it was to feel part of society and normal life, after spending a long time living in hiding, running and protesting, after spending a long time living in hiding, running and protesting.</s>

en: Madelaine Caracas, spokesperson of the student group known as the Student Coordination for Democracy, also shared with Niú her aspirations for transformation in Nicaragua, which go beyond Ortega's departure:
swa: Madelaine Caracas, msemaji wa kikundi cha wanafunzi kinachofahamika kama Ushirikiano wa Wanafunzi kwa Demokrasia, pia alishirikisha Niú kiu yake ya kutaka kuona mabadiliko ya Nicaragua ambayo yatakuwa ni zaidi ya Ortega kuondoka:
mt0: <pad> Madelaine Caracas, a spokesperson for the student group Students for Democracy, also shared with Niú her wish to see a change in Nicaragua that will go beyond Ortega's resignation.</s>

en: [We need to] eradicate authoritarianism, sexism, personal autocracy and other ills that have penetrated the political culture of the country.
swa: [Tunataka] kuuondoa udikteta, ukandamizaji wa kijinsia, ubinafsi na madhaifu mengine ambayo yamejipenyeza katika utamaduni wa siasa za nchi.
mt0: <pad> [We want] to remove dictatorship, gender censorship, selfishness and other weaknesses that have penetrated the culture of national politics.</s>

en: We believe more than ever that Ortega will leave this year [] that I will return to Nicaragua this year.
swa: Tunaamini zaidi kuwa Ortega ataondoka mwaka huu na kwamba nitarudi Nicaragua mwaka huu.
mt0: <pad> We are more convinced that Ortega will leave this year and that I will return to Nicaragua this year.</s>

en: And I have the certainty because Ortega is out of air internationally and economically; and also because those who participated in the uprising last April are now more organized than ever.
swa: Na nina hakika kwa sababu Ortega kwa sasa hasikiki katika anga za kimataifa na za kiuchumi na pia kwa sababu wale wote walioshiriki maandamano ya Aprili wamejiandaa kikamilifu kwa sasa.
mt0: <pad> And I am sure because Ortega is now unaudible in international and economic circles and also because all those who participated in the April protests are now perfectly prepared for the future.</s>

en: This last round of dialogues between government and opposition came to an end on April 3, with agreements reached on two of the four topics discussed.
swa: Raundi hii ya mwisho ya mazungumzo kati ya Serikali na upinzani ilifikia mwisho Aprili 3, kukiwa na makubaliano katika mada mbili kati ya nne zilizojadiliwa.
mt0: <pad> The final round of talks between the government and the opposition came to an end on April 3, with agreement on two of the four issues discussed.</s>

en: The government has pledged, firstly, to release all political prisoners and, secondly, to respect civil liberties.
swa: Kwanza serikali imeahidi kuwa, itawaachia huru wafungwa wote wa kisiasa na pili itaheshimu uhuru wa raia.
mt0: <pad> First, the government has promised to free all political prisoners and second, to respect the freedom of the people.</s>

en: There were no agreements made regarding justice for the victims of violence or the expediting of the 2021 elections.
swa: Hapakuwepo na  makubaliano yoyote yaliyofanywa kuhusu haki kwa wahanga wa vurugu za uchaguzi au kujinadi kwa ajili ya uchaguzi wa 2021.
mt0: <pad> No agreement was made on the rights of victims of election violence or the candidacy for the 2021 election.</s>

en: Opposition group Civic Alliance pointed out, however, that the government has so far failed to honor the agreements.
swa: Kikundi cha upinzani cha Muungano wa Kiraia ulisema kuwa, hata hivyo serikali imeshindwa kabisa kuheshimu makubaliano hayo.
mt0: <pad> The opposition group Civil Union said that, however, the government has failed to comply with those agreements.</s>

en: Police repression of peaceful protests has reportedly continued.
swa: Imeendelea kuripotiwa kuwa, Polisi  wameendelea kuvuruga maandamano ya amani .
mt0: <pad> It was reported that police continued to disrupt the peace rally.</s>

en: As of April 6, only 50 out of over 600 political prisoners had been released, and those that were were placed under house arrest.
swa: Kama ilivyokuwa April 6, ni wafungwa 50 pekee kati ya wafungwa wa kisiasa 600 walioachiliwa huru, na waliowekwa katika vizuizi majumbani mwao.
mt0: <pad> As of April 6, only 50 prisoners were freed out of 600 political prisoners, and the rest were placed under house arrest.</s>

en: Later, on April 17, following new threats of sanctions from the United States, over 600 prisoners were released to complete their sentences under house arrest, though but according to Civic Alliance, only 18 members of the group were on the list of political prisoners they had hoped to see out of jail.
swa: Baadaye hapo April 17, kufuatia kitisho kipya cha kuwekewa vikwazo na Marekani, zaidi ya wafungwa 600 waliachiliwa huru na kwenda kumalizia vifungo vyao katika vizuizi vya nyumbani, hata hivyo kulingana na Muungano wa Kiraia, ni wanachama 18 pekee wa kikundi hicho waliokuwa katika orodha ya wafungwa wa kisiasa waliokuwa na tumaini la kuachiliwa huru.
mt0: <pad> Later on April 17, after a new U.S. sanctions threat, over 600 prisoners were freed and sent to finish their sentences in home confinement, however according to the Civil Union, only 18 members of the group were on the list of political prisoners who had hoped for release.</s>

en: In the minds of people like activist and researcher Felix Madariaga, the new leaders of Nicaragua's future remain in prison today.
swa: Katika fikra za watu kama vile Mwanaharakati na mtafiti Felix Madariaga, kiongozi mpya wa Kesho ya Nicaragua amebaki gerezani leo.
mt0: <pad> In the minds of people like activist and researcher Felix Madariaga, the new leader of the Future of Nicaragua remains in jail today.</s>

en: Meanwhile, opposition groups are calling for protests commemorating the anniversary of the events of April 2018.
swa: Wakati huo huo, vikundi vya upinzani vimeitisha  maandamano ya kuadhimisha kumbukumbu ya  matukio ya Aprili 2018.
mt0: <pad> At the same time, opposition groups have called for protests to mark the anniversary of the events of April 2018.</s>

en: With the refusal of authorities to grant permission to the demonstration, new police crackdowns are anticipated.
swa: Kukiwa na katazo toka kwa mamlaka na zuio la kibali dhidi ya maandamano hayo, pia inatarajiwa kuwa kutakuwepo na ukandamizaji mpya kutoka kwa polisi.
mt0: <pad> With the bans and suspensions of permits for the protests, it is also expected that there will be new police repression.</s>
